Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a Marriott”
Reviews.Author: danceadventures
Reviews.Content: Big disappointment. My husband and I stayed here the weekend of 4/14 while visiting our college student. We usually stay at the Marriott Waterfront, but thought we'd try the Renaissance since this is the hotel recommended for us to stay during commencement weekend this May. I am so sorry that our reservations are here and now we are having difficulty getting a room any place else. Lobby was not clean and definitely not what I've found to expect at Renaissance properties. Even the checkin counter left alot to be desired. Then we get to our room which was OK, not really as clean as expected, carpet soiled, and towels were old and shredding. The Starbucks and cafe in the hotel was awful. Tables were dirty with crumbs, etc. from previous customers and overall appearance was not good. I am really hoping to get into another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: t42
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a corner suite that was bigger than anything we have ever had before. We even had a dining room table that seats eight - just what we needed. Windows on two sides that opened for a cross breeze. Unfortunately, as others have commented, street noises are way too loud to leave the windows open at night (and we thought downtown Toronto was noisy!) Excellent location with stops for the free busses nearby, taxis out front and almost everything within walking distance anyway. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel since Panera Bread, Corner Bakery Cafe and Miss Shirley's were all near by. We would recommend on a busy warm weekend that you make dinner reservations ahead as all the popular restaurants were extremely busy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: cmak12
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace. We love the location to everything in and around the Inner Harbor. No need to take a car or even a cab most times if the weather is nice. Most attractions are a 10-15 minute walk away in any direction. Check in - Check in was quick and efficient. My wife checked us in as I parked the car. We arrived around lunch time and our room was ready. There was a mixup in booking since my wife did it online. They gave us a room with a single bed, but we were a party of 3. A conversation with the manager got us moved up to the conceirge level with a full harbor view. Still only a king bed, but they provided a cot for our daughter. The upgrade included access to the lounge which had continental breakfast on the weekend, so this more than made up for the confusion with the room. Service - Everyone we encountered was more than friendly and knowledgable, but there were a couple of weak points during our stay. When we arrived in our room there was an issue. My wife noticed that they hadn't cleaned the bathroom toilet. The previous guest had "left something behind". It was gross, but housekeeping quickly responded when we told the front desk, who apologized profusely and we were able to get free room service out of it. The second issue we had was with regards to room service. We put out the room service form the night before and requested it be delivered between 6am and 6:15am. The first day, around 6:20 I called down to the front desk. A few minutes later, our meal showed up. Not sure if this was because they were afraid to wake us up or just because the service was slow (hard to believe at 6am on a Saturday). Every other Marriott brand hotel we've been in has gotten room service to us on time or even a little early. The person delivering it to us apologized and said the meal was on him (even though he was unaware that it was already free). Not completely discouraged (and because it was already free), we ordered again the same way. Again, it did not arrive on time. We were working on a tight schedule so this time when I called the desk I told them to tell room service to cancel or order completely. Both days, we returned to the hotel later in the morning and ate at the club lounge. This, combined with the fact that the meals were already free made this a minor inconvenience. Other than those two issues, the rest of the service we received was fine. Rooms - Standard hotel fare. What we've come to expect from any Marriott product. It was large enough to comfortably acommodate the cot without feeling over crowded. The bed was comfortable. The room was clean (except for the bathroom issue mentioned above) and was in order. One thing of note is regarding the safe. The safe is in a drawer above the refrigerator, not in the closet. It is MUCH smaller than other room safes in other hotels. I typically have no problem storing our valuables and still have room for our Nikon Camera and telephoto lens. Most of ths space in the safe box is take up with the lid to the safe. The locking mechanism for this already small safe must be huge. I couldn't fit the camera in the safe, so I had to carry it with me or leave it in the room, hidden. This didn't sit well with me. Keep this in mind when deciding which vailuables to bring on your trip. Other notes - The hotel is attached to the Gallery Mall. Access from the mall to the lobby is for hotel guests only and can only be opened with a keycard. Parking is not associated with the hotel, so it cannot be negotiated off of your room bill. There is an elevated walkway that attaches the Gallery Mall to the smaller Harborplace Mall across the street. The entrance to the walkway is near Five Guys in Harborplace Mall. Bathrooms near the Ground Floor Cafe also need a room key to access. I'm sure this is necessary to keep undesirables from using the bathrooms. That is somewhat comforting, but also a little disturbing as well. Due to this hotel's location, we'd come back. We didn't have the service issues the first time we stayed that we did this time. I will give them a pass for now and hope that it was a not indicative of a larger issue. Overall, it was another good stay at the Renaissance Harborplace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Safe Area”
Reviews.Author: mich128
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. We walked everywhere, even to Litllte Italy!! The hotel is conncected directly to the Gallery Mall and the Gallary Mall is connected to the Harbor Inn Mall by an outside overhead cross walk. We parked our car and didn't get back in until we left. We parked in the 100 East Pratt Street Parking Garage. Parking is costly. We parked at about 3:30 on Easter Sunday and left the following Tuesday around 9:15 am and cost us $61.00. Reading reviews before we left I knew parking would be costly and emptied out my vehicle of all items due to vehicle break ins. Our vehicle was fine. The area we stayed in was very safe and cops were seen everywhere we went. The only downfall is the fridge in the room was very very small. Bring a cooler if you want to keep more than 3 items cool. I booked this hotel thru priceline for $86 a nite...I couldn't be happier!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: JenBenG
Reviews.Content: Came to Baltimore for short vacation. This hotel offers a great location in the inner harbor. I did read some of the bad reviews. It is true the trays from breakfast sit out in the hallways a little longer than they should, but this didn't bother me. I never felt unsafe. I saw security officers in hotel, the mall next door and all over the inner harbor area. We even had a safe in our room. The front desk staff treated us excellent. There was a problem with our reservation- due to cheap tickets not sending the hotel appropriate info so they initially put my family of 4 in a 1 king bed room. There were no more 2 queen bed rooms. The nice gentlemen at the front desk upgraded us to a suite at no additional cost and apologized even though it was not their error. The free breakfast is excellent. We would definately stay here in the future. The only negative to me was the price of parking- may try the lot next door next time and see if it is cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: mclh
Reviews.Content: Wanted to provide a review as I relied on tripadvisor in booking the Renaissance. Saw there were some less than stellar reviews, but booked anyway. Really glad I did. Front desk staff was amazing! Although I had apparently goofed up something when I tried to book online, the staff was able to get me the exact rooms (connecting) that I needed. There are 12 floors - the hotel is a square with an inner courtyard. We had inner rooms and could see down into the pool. The rooms are large & clean; the beds are very comfortable. Concierge lounge in on the 12th floor. Nice selection of food and is well-managed. We walked to the stadium for a ballgame, aquarium, ships at inner harbor. Everything was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inner Harbor Location/Service”
Reviews.Author: BeachMelonMama
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a conference in November of 2010. I had a tremendous experience there, and this included the fact that I had to leave my bags at the front desk because my conference started early in the morning and my check-in time wasn't until later that afternoon. the staff was helpful, the room was calming and serene, and that was nice to come back to after a day of lectures, activities, and conference-related meetings. I was able to walk to little Italy from here, as well as the Hard Rock cafe and other Inner Harbor attractions such as the Aquarium. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: felt22
Reviews.Content: Took the family down to Baltimore for a quick two day getaway. Used Marriott points for a room at the Renaissance and couldn't have been more pleased. The location is ideal as you are directly across the street from the hub of the harbor area. Paddle boats, shops, and aquarium are all right there. We hit the Discovery Children's Museum which was only a short 4 block walk and went to an Orioles game at Camden Yards which was an easy 5 block walk. Besides the location, we were very impressed with the overall service. Everyone from the valet, bellhop, front desk staff and maid service were wonderful. To top it off, a gentleman held the door for us and our stroller as we walked out the front entrance to begin exploring the area and he asked if we needed any directions. We asked a question about how far the ballpark was and a few other places and he proceeded to provide us with the best recommendations on what to do with the kids that day and beyond. Turns out he was the General Manager, Bob and he couldn't have been a nicer guy. He also treated our daughter to an apple juice the next morning while we waited at the Starbucks in the lobby. Great understanding of good service. Room and facility are all very good as well. Great spot to stay when visiting the Baltimore Harbor!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room”
Reviews.Author: bennic85
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 2 nights. We were on the "courtyard" side, which basically gives just a view of all of the other rooms, so we kept the blinds shut. But the location is great...not on water as picture suggests, but close enough. It was nice just parking our car in the attached garage and leaving it there during our stay. The rooms were very clean and the staff was courteous. Only complaints were that they didn't restock our used towels (I'm assuming just an oversight...hopefully they won't try to charge us for them) and the 1st floor bar was closed by 9:00. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Inner Harbor and Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: llamamama61
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a 3-day weekend over the Easter weekend. Hotel is across the street from the Inner Harbor and just 3 blocks from the convention center. The Gallery--a shopping venue--is within the hotel offering mostly clothing stores and fast food. Check-in was fast and friendly. A cafe and Starbucks are located on the ground floor of the hotel, but the menu and hours were limited. The hotel restaurant is located on fifth floor overlooking the Inner Harbor. We dined at their breakfast buffet which, while pricey, offered a good variety of both hot and cold breakfast foods. The hotel room was large, the bathroom clean and updated, and the beds were very comfortable. Wi-Fi was free throughout the hotel. The housekeeping staff were never able to restock the bathroom with enough towels, so a daily phone call was necessary to ask for them to restock. My main complaint would be that this large hotel is serviced by only one set of elevators and if your room was on the opposite end of the hotel, it was a long walk to get to the elevators and then a long wait for an elevator to come to the floor. If anyone in your party has difficulty walking, you should request a room closer to the elevator. Otherwise, our experience was very positive, the hotel staff was friendly and helpful, and the proximity of the hotel to the Inner Harbor activities is a real plus.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic view of the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: guilfordh
Reviews.Content: Given a beautiful room with a view of all the ships - we couldn't have asked for a better one. The front desk staff adhered to all our requests for a high floor and room with a view. I would stay here again and again. The location was great for our two day visit - very close to the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Lumpy pillows, grumpy lifeguards”
Reviews.Author: Travelrer
Reviews.Content: Overall lovely hotel. Our only issues were lumpy, not soft pillows, not comfortable pillows. We have stayed at many hotels of this caliber with much better pillows. The manager was quite responsive, although, added equally disappointing pillows to our room when we requested "better" pillows. The hotel staff was quite friendly, room was great. Hotel accommodated our requests for rollaway bed as well as being on the same floor as our visiting friends. Great location for Inner Harbor action. We traveled with several boys under 13 and visited the pool twice. The lifeguards were grumpu and easily agitated. Pool was crowdred and they were a bit overwhelmed. Overall great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 night stay for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: bluewatergolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week of March for business. The hotel is in a great location, we walked everywhere we went for dinner. The hotel was extremely clean and well maintained. My room was a king room on the back side so I did not have a harbor view. The meeting rooms were well appointed but REALLY COLD. We could not get anyone to help us with the fact that we were freezing in the meeting space. The meals were very good with a breakfast buffet and lunch served daily. Not sure what this cost our company but it was very convenient and well done. The parking is a joke. Parking is NOT included in the room rate so you pay $28.00 a day for self parking and $40.00 per day if you use the valet. So they got me for $84.00 to pull in on a Monday and leave on Thursday, what a racket.......

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SuzanSv
Reviews.Content: We just spent one night here, but I was impressed with the hotel. The rooms were nicely decorated and the bed one of the best I have slept in (better than my own) in a long time. The hotel staff was beyond friendly and helpful and the location couldn't be better for enjoying the waterfront. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and view (maybe)”
Reviews.Author: DesertCreatures
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location in the harborfront area. You may get a great view if your room overlooks the harbor. I unfortunately had an awesone view of the parking ramp. This hotel is strange in that there's a small mall built on the side of it that you can access directly from the hotel lobby. Food and parking are pricey. My room was nice and clean. I found quite annoying was that numerous emergency vehicles use the road in front of the hotel quite frequently. On a Sat nght I couldn't sleep due the incessant siren noises echoing between the buildings. It sounded like they were in my room on the 7th floor!

Reviews.Title: “Great until you forget something!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Newdo4u
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Saturday evening check in was a breeze considering I had booked multiple rooms. Was told at check in parking was 28 per day unlimited access. We had a great stay love the location right across the street from inner harbor attractions and connected to the mall. Upon retrieving our vehicle at check out nobody from the hotel advised that valet was not 28 dollars per day but 40 BUCKS PER DAY!! (we hadn't used the vehicle since check in). We flew back home on Monday afternoon to wake up Tuesday and realize I left my very expensive flat iron in the room :/ immediately I called the hotel was transferred 3 times to be put on hold for 33 minutes to somebody answering the phone asking me "who is this" so for the fourth time I explained what I left there and what room I was in and was put on hold again for someone to eventually hang up the line. Very frustrated I called and asked to speak to a manager of the hotel and was told they were unavailable and had to leave a message…no return call. I am a professional stylist that is now out a $165 tool for my job that I have to replace since the people who work at this hotel aren't honest enough to return the customers belongings!!!!! Every hotel I have ever stayed at and left something in the room they have notified me or I went back/called and received my belongings, never again would I stay here based on the treatment of their dishonest staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Slept like a dream”
Reviews.Author: wswilliams
Reviews.Content: While on an extended working trip in Baltimore I stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel. There are many hotels to choose from but I'm sure glad we chose this place. Can't say I've ever slept better. While first given a street view I quickly changed to an inner room that faced the outdoor courtyard. So glad I did. The bed was firm yet extremely comfortable with quality crisp white linens changed as often as I wished. The room itself was quite spacious which allowed me plenty of space to work at my computer at night. Lots of lighting. The housekeeping and front desk staff was always courteous but their waitstaff in the dining room on the 5th floor was a bit spotty. Fortunately, I was lucky to avoid the unannounced construction going occurring on other floors. Except for a couple of minor incidents, all in all my stay was quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you like the sound of constructon!”
Reviews.Author: Moochiebpaul
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel again on Priceline cheap . . . but I wouldn't now take a room here if they paid me! Been here three nights and EVERY day I was woken up by construction whether it was in house fixing something in the hallway or from the building next door. Today my wife and I were woken up at 7:30 AM. When I complained yesterday the manager claimed she would get to the source of the problem to correct it and call me back . . . she didn't call me back and the construction started even earlier the next day! I was told by the operator today one can here the noise throughout the building. I did call the manager on duty today, he simply left me on hold. I will say if you like the pounding of hammers and the sound of drills, you might disagree with my review.

Reviews.Title: “Soulless large corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: cds_SanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this hotel, it's just a giant corporate hotel with no soul. We were there to attend a conference, which also took place at the hotel. So, it was convenient for us. Otherwise, it was the typical large corporate hotel experience in a very touristy spot. We did enjoy getting to the Aquarium and the Visionary arts museum, both in walking distance. The nearby restaurants are mostly corporate chains, but if you ask around there are other places to go, there are some alternatives including little italy.

Reviews.Title: “Best Customer Service, Ever!”
Reviews.Author: jennyJerseyShore
Reviews.Content: From the minute we arrived the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. My little one started to cry in the lobby, so Parisha and Clifton came running over to help. They brought her a fresh glass of lemonade, made her laugh and helped me calm her! Amazing. I can't say enough about the staff, from Angel at the desk who lives up to her name, Derek at the door, Alexandra at the Pool, absolutely everyone we encountered was so friendly and warm. If I could give an award for best staff ever, the Renaissance would win, hands down! On top of having the best service people, the location is fantastic. It's so convenient to be able to walk to all of the attractions. And, having mall access from within the hotel, a Starbucks downstairs, an indoor pool for the kids, nice size fitness center, an excellent restaurant/bar and Club Lounge, why would you want to stay anywhere else in Inner Harbor? I certainly won't.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best and worst thing”
Reviews.Author: Goldwebco
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is right in the middle of all the action of Inner Harbor. You can easily walk to almost everything. So our first day was great. Then came bedtime. Forget sleep. Not the hotels fault, but being in the middle of everything meant a night full of police sirens, ambulance sirens, and horns. We were woken up atleast once an hour all night. And we were on one of the top floors, not even overlooking the main road. So although the hotel is nice and the workers were friendly, I won't be back to this hotel. I may not go on vacation to sleep, but being exhausted from lack of sleep will ruin your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...!”
Reviews.Author: SidKak
Reviews.Content: Right on the harbor, could not have asked for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Conference Stay, Good for Family Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Richard K
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for a conference, Wed. to Friday. It's easily accessible and they let me check-in at noon with no problem. Maybe the best bed I've ever slept on in a chain hotel. The room (King bed) was comfortable and overlooked Pratt St., the main road across from the Inner Harbor area. Whether it was the clientele or the building, I was never disturbed by other guests and hallway noise. You can hear the traffic and loud people on the street, but it wasn't a weekday problem of any consequence. If I had a single complaint it's that there isn't enough dresser space for more than 2-3 days, though the bedside tables will double as clothing space too. The hotel is adjacent/attached to a pretty forgettable 4 story shopping plaza with an equally forgettable food court. However there are perfectly suitable restaurants within walking distance in either direction from the hotel and across the street at the Inner Harbor. You're also a 10-15 minute walk from Camden Yards. If you're going to go with the family, see if they have suites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, pool and bellhop service poor”
Reviews.Author: travelphreak2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel this past weekend and enjoyed our time in Baltimore; our timing with the weather worked out well. The location of the hotel is very convenient - right on the Inner Harbor, and it's connected to a mall. There is a walking bridge above the traffic from the mall to the Inner Harbor, with more stores and restaurants. I loved the location. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. The room was nice and plush; however, there were no bathrobes or slippers, like I've received at other Renaissance hotels. The biggest disappointment was the pool. It's a nice sized pool with a nice hottub, but it was not clean. It was not filthy, but the pool deck hadn't been mopped for days, and the dirt was accummulating. There was enough towels on 2 racks the first time we went down there, but the 2nd time we went to the pool, one of the towel racks was empty. When I told the pool attendant, he said he called housekeeping to bring more. He didn't bother telling me that there was another towel rack near the hottub; for even better service, he should have moved the towels over to the rack near the door. The pool attendant didn't even pick up the used towels from people who left the pool area. There was no water at all for drinking - the fitness center is on a different floor. With the hottub being dehydrating, you would think they would have water. The pool attendant drank his bottle of water right in front of all the people, rudely, and didn't offer to help us when we asked about water. What a worthless guy. He didn't even enforce the pool and hottub rules or clean up around the place. I don't know what he is supposed to do. Finally, when we went to check out, the bell hop took our bags down, but he didn't give us a claim check; we wanted him to hold our bags so we could walk around the Inner Harbor some more before leaving Baltimore. When we got back to get our bags, the new bell hop didn't know where our bags were, and we had to go to the luggage room to point out our bags. I will not stay here again; I will try the other Marriott property in Baltimore in the East Harbor; that location is just as good, within walking distance of the Inner Harbor as well.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: elaine n
Reviews.Content: great place. close to inner harbor. across the street from the aquarium. when in baltimore i would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Altaskibum
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel and so far it is my favorite of all the Marriotts in Baltimore. The location is central to everything and it has public parking garage below so you are not forced to use the valet or walk blocks to a public garage. The parking is $28 per night, which is pretty typical these days for a city hotel. The property itself has been around for a number of years and the evelevators do show it, however, don't let that put you off as the rooms have all been upgraded and are very nice and large. The bathrooms have also been updated and are nice and clean. The only thing you need to know about the rooms is that the hotel is arranged in a big open square so some rooms are quite a hike from the elevators! I stayed on the concierge level and the concierge lounge is pretty typical for a full service Marriott. They do serve a hot breakfast in the morning and it is actually quite good. At night they have a number of food options too and the quality is pretty decent. Overall, a very good hotel. You won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Mr G
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Perfectly located overlooking the Inner Harbour. We arrived around 11:00 and were immediately given a room without waiting. No "we don't give rooms until 3:00" or "You're early, come back". That was nice. And the room was on the 11th floor (out of 12 floors) with a "full harbour view" overlooking the stern of the USS Constitution. What a beautiful view of the Harbour and the buildings. To die for. Also located adjacent to the Gallery Shopping Mall, so if you are a shopper, you can access it through the lobby. The room was first rate. Huge window wall overlooking the Harbour. Beds were some of the most comfortable I can recall. In fact, the second night I was looking forward to going to sleep. It appears that they use firm mattresses and then cover them with an inch or two of soft material. Bed linens were of top quality and cosy. There was some hallway noise and sirens of the crime fighters on Pratt Street, but other than that a good nights sleep. Large flat screen TV with the typical satellite/cable channels plus HBO. Nice coffee service, an in-drawer modern safe, hairdryer and Wi-Fi (for $`12.95 for 24 hours). Parking was a bit steep at $28 a day, but it appeared that they used public garage and they pass that cost on. For $12 more a day, they provide valet paring. I normally don't take the valet option (I'm not that old that I can't park my own car), but there were so many cars when we arrived that the idea of someone taking care of the car was too tempting. While the hotel was magnificent, I thought that some of the people could improve. While I was very happy with an early room, it wouldn't hurt the lady at reception to smile once in a while or ask us how's it going. After all, other than the valet parking guy, she is our first experience with the hotel and first impressions are hard to shake. So reception lady, relax, smile and enjoy people. Also, when we arrived there was only one person manning reception. While we were second in line, the person ahead of us had some personal issue that took more than 5 minutes. Once the line began to form, they did bring out another staff member to deal with the arrivals. But at a hotel of this calibre, there shouldn't be a delay. Also, I noticed that reception handled questions and matters that the concierge should have handled. Reception should refer such issues to the concierge and get on the reception matters. People seemed to really like room service. You could tell by all the plates, glasses and trays outside doors in the hallway. And they stayed there for some time. Not only was it an eyesore and disruptive, the aroma wasn't pleasant. I'm surprised that the dirty dishes stayed there so long as they could easily be collected at least once an hour. Also, we forgot a Europe to US electrical adapter and hoped that the hotel had one we could borrow. Most upper scale hotels in urban areas such as Baltimore normally have them. No luck, but reception happily referred us to the Hotel store. It had one, but at three times the price as that on the normal economy. Ouch! The store also sold newspapers, but would put yesterday's paper on top of the pile of today's paper. Sort of like a grocery store putting overripe fruit on top of the better fruit to get rid of it. Shame, shame hotel store. Why trash your name for the price of a newspaper? We only ate breakfast in the hotel and it was very good. Not cheap, but not that much more than outside places. And the food was of very good quality. They did incorrectly charge me for two days of internet when I only used one. I was sent a final email bill with a link to ask about the bill. Unfortunately the link doesn't work, so looks like I got stiffed for $12.95 worth of internet I didn't use. In the end, its a wonderful hotel, ideally located and luxurious. Nice people who will certainly smile more in the future if anyone reads this. Not cheap, but it had an affordable Government rate. Well worth the money. I'd stay there again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: minamoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel during the first two weeks of December because of work obligations. This hotel was very nice. I had access to the concierge lounge, and as a result was treated to a variety of breakfast options in the morning, and hors d'oeuvres after a long day of work. The people working in the lounge made sure that the food stayed well stocked, and the service area stayed clean. Kenneth at the front desk checked me in when I first arrived and was very friendly. I saw him throughout my stay, and he always provided service with a smile (which was a rare commodity in Baltimore as most of the people I encountered outside of the hotel – Baltimore residents/natives – were not smiling – but overall very rude) Dianne in housekeeping was also very accommodating. I called to request a pull out bed be brought to the room, and she set it up very quickly, and was very friendly. The view from the hotel was excellent (especially in the workout room). If I ever do stay in downtown Baltimore again for work, I will request that arrangements be made at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: traveling044
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable and friendly hotel. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view”
Reviews.Author: PAbeachroamer
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay Feb 19 with small children. Friendly and helpful staff greet you outside and in the lobby area. Great location - park and walk to everything, minutes from the aquarium. By luck we were able to check in early (before 10am), issued a room on 9th floor with harbor view. Huge plus checking in before our visit the aquarium, drop bags, freshened up and still made our 10:30 ticket time. The room was spacious and clean, the beds were extremely comfortable. Parking is a little pricey ($40 valet) but standard for Inner Harbor. We had access to the Club Lounge, which offered a nice breakfast, nightly food items and beverages. The indoor pool was adequate, small paddle boards,pool towels and changing rooms, Wifi area with tables, lounge area and large flat screen TV. Starbucks in lobby and access to the Gallery was nice. We did not have any issues with hallway noise as others have noted, our floor was quite during our stay. We look forward to our next stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JandPdineout
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable, good location, friendly staff, overpriced when compared with its competition. Skip the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Service (and a lovely room) with a smile”
Reviews.Author: LAFScarsdale
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 3 nights at this hotel as an advisor for a Model UN conference with 25 teens. The staff at the hotel made everything run smoothly. Check-in was incredibly efficient given the number of students staying there from all over the country. The rooms were spacious and well equiped with a mini-frig in each room. Location was perfect for this kind of group, as the hotel is attached to a mall and food court that they could visit during their free time. The meeting rooms were set up well and easily accessible. I also booked the restaurant for our group for Saturday night and they made up a special menu with choices of salad and entree at a reasonable price with only 1 day's notice! Thank you to all of the staff at the hotel for making our stay a pleasure. Just a couple of suggestions. More elevators are needed if you are going to host conferences! There was a real back-up at check out. And a word to the previous reviewer: Before you book a room at a full service hotel in a large city always check to see if they are hosting a conference. Thousands of teenagers do not make for a relaxing and quiet stay at any hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Ray4461
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent several days at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel at the Inner Harbor in Baltimore, MD. We were very pleased with the hotel facilities and staff. Everyone was friendly and helpful with any questions. The check-in was very fast. The room was very nicely done and very clean - my wife is especially critical in that area. We had a room overlooking the Inner Harbor and that added to our enjoyment. The hotel is right across the street from the Baltimore Aquarium and the restaurants and other attractions at the Inner Harbor. We also had use of the Club Level for breakfast, which was good - a full continental type. Parking was not cheap but nothing in that area is and this was right under the hotel. I have traveled for 10 years staying in various hotels in the US and abroad. My wife sometimes traveled with me. We would rate this as one of the top two we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: hmmsbrown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days on a business trip. This hotel was selected by my employer. First, the positives: the hotel is in a great location on the inner harbor. It is nicely decorated and clean, and the room was large. The service was pleasant. There was a better than usual selection of tv stations (I've never stayed at a hotel where I could watch hockey on the NHL network before). My employer had made special arrangements for some additional amenities, to include an in-room fridge and microwave, free internet, and complimentary breakfast. (According to the hotel website, they normally charge $12.95 per day for in-room high speed internet access, which seems ridiculous these days.) For the first couple of days, I thought I could over look the negative, which was the noise problem. Specifically, the first noise problem is the lack of sound proofing between the hallway and room. People in the hallway speaking in a normal conversational voice sound as if they are right in your room. The second problem is the doors, which slam shut behind you unless you make an actual effort to close them gently. The first two nights, this was not too much of a problem, because the hotel did not seem too full and after 10pm there wasn't much hallway traffic. But on the third evening, a huge group of high school students arrived for a conference. From 9pm-1am that night, I was treated to a seemingly never ending chorus of hallway voices, backed by a symphony of slamming doors. Earplugs failed to block the noise, and when in bed and nearby doors would slam, I could actually FEEL the vibrating "thud". I should emphasize that although these were large groups of teens, they were in no way misbehaving or being rowdy. They were simply doing what most travelers do in a hotel- speaking to their companions and letting their room door close behind them. But in this hotel, these simple actions from a large group of people were ridiculously disruptive and made for a miserable attempt at getting a decent nights' sleep. For this reason, I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone sensitive to noise. On most of my previous trips to Baltimore, I have stayed at the Residence Inn on Light St. (see prior reviews). I would continue to recommend that hotel by comparison- full kitchen, free internet and breakfast (for everyone, not just by special arrangement), and no slamming doors.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: TNtraveler1998
Reviews.Content: Quick check-in, large clean rooms, and comfy beds. Great hotel for Inner Harbor activities. Flat panel TV, large desk and sitting area was an added plus.

Reviews.Title: “Always perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Sandysjohnson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is always clean, accommodating and with awesome views! Cant get any closer to the harbor and lots of great bars and restaurants within a minute walk!

Reviews.Title: “What one expects from an American chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: degtravel
Reviews.Content: My stay in the hotel was for a company event. Everything was fine, although the gym was ver crowded already at 5 am in the morning. This meant getting up really early to work out, otherwise, no chance of running on the treadmill. Food was ok although I did miss low calorie options, it is really hard anywhere in the use to eat low calorie food..... Room was very large which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and centrally located tot he Harbor area”
Reviews.Author: WSA_IV
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for a Company meeting. Given a room on the top floor. I found the room clean and comfortable and the Hotel very quiet. There is a Starbucks located in the lobby and the Hotel is connected to a shopping area. Well located closed to the Harbor attractions and entertainment/food options. Check in/out was quick, the staff very friendly and the Hotel public areas very clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaHotelguy
Reviews.Content: Went here for a single night to enjoy the city. Very clean public spaces, and room. Not the hotels fault, but the night before the Ravens playoff game, the hallways and lobby were overrun with drunken morons who clearly had no idea that people can actually hear you when you're high fiving your drunken buddies and screaming like a banchee when they're standing only 3 feet away. The much needed sign was in place in the hallways kindly reminding people to be relatively quiet, but did little good. Aside from the goofballs, the rooms were nicely appointed, very comfortable beds. The price of parking and internet sucked, but it is a FS property within the city. Typical I guess. The guestroom door did NOT auto deadbolt as they have at other Marriott properties, and the door had no seal on it, so any hall noise came right in the room. That's the reason for the AVERAGE rating on sleep. The shops below and catwalk over Pratt Street was a nice feature : )

Reviews.Title: “Great location and well organized for New Years Eve”
Reviews.Author: ANOUL
Reviews.Content: We went to Baltimore's Inner Harbor to celebrate the New Year. The Center Club overlooks the harbor and we were going there for dinner and a view of the fireworks. The Renaissance is almost next door so it was a natural choice for our overnight stay. I think that this may have been a five star hotel at one time? If so, that's not true today, but the location, room sizes, service and cleanliness all added up to a pleasurable experience. We were as far from the elevators as you can get. That's a good thing because no foot traffic passes your door. Keep in mind that this was New Years Eve and LOTS of people were out and about. Downtown was mobbed! There was one thing that impressed us most about our stay that night. The streets were mobbed with all sorts of people, many of which had been overserved. When we got back to the hotel at about one o'clock, heavy hotel security was out front politely checking room keys before allowing access to the hotel. Well done. We got up the next morning and joined friends for breakfast at the restaurant on the fifth floor, which was excellent, then we got in the car and drove home. One word of caution....use the breakfast buffet. They have pretty much everything that you might want, including crab dishes to order, and it's tons faster than ordering from the menu. We had finished by the time the menu orders arrived. For the price, this hotel is a good choice but don't expect the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location, poor sound proofing.”
Reviews.Author: vwest11
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the hotel with my husband for our wedding anniversary. We arrived pretty late, I ordered champagne and strawberries in advance, so everything was perfect and set up when we got into our room. The room itself was nice and clean, the only downside was a long walk from the elevator which was okay with us but probably not so much with older people. Everything was great, until the next morning. The sound proofing of the room was really poor and I woke up from people talking in the room next to us, and I can literally hear everything that they were saying. After that I heard noises from the people walking in the room upstairs, and every time when someone was walking in the corridor and talking or laughing. With me being a sensitive sleeper that was completely unacceptable as we were looking for a quiet getaway and instead I only got a headache, so we had to check out early and head home, and I feel like our anniversary was ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Overlooking Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Southern MD Traveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel the night of 7 January 2012. It is a beautiful facility located in the heart of the Inner Harbor area of Baltimore. There is parking under the building which is very convenient. The staff greets you very nicely. The rooms are spacious, very clean, and well-appointed to include a small fridge, coffee maker and safe. When I received my reminder notification that my planned stay was coming up, they suggested some room service items like champagne with chocolate covered strawberries. Since we were going there to see a musical and then do dinner with a group of friends (we all live about 60 miles south of Baltimore) I thought this would be a nice touch so ordered that and a three bottle bucket of beer. Had it delevered for when we returned to the room after the afternoon show at the Baltimore Hippodrome (a wonderful theater that I highly recommend as well). The items were waiting for us upon our return and very nicely presented. The next morning we did the breakfast buffet in the hotel restaurant. The restaurant has a wonderful view of the Inner Harbor. Bottom line: This is a very high quality hotel in a prime area of Baltimore and I would highly recommend it for business and pleasure trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, very convenient to all shops and the aquarium”
Reviews.Author: smsimon
Reviews.Content: We checked in here for New Years Eve and stayed two nights. The hotel was nice but nothing to write home about. All of the employees at the hotel were very nice. From the front desk to the pool attendant we had nice experiences with everyone. The major downside to this hotel was the cleanliness of the hallways (everyones room service, dishes, glasses, and garbage sat in the hallways throughout the day and night) and the price of parking with the hotel. To use the valet service at this hotel there is a rate of $40 per day. Also, we tried to order room service late one evening but since the kitchen was closed (1215 am) they made no exception or suggestion on how to order a late meal to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Tourism!”
Reviews.Author: iowakrb
Reviews.Content: My family and I were taking a trip to the National Aquarium, and wanted a hotel where we could stay that would be close. We decided on the Renaissance, and are so glad we did! The room was very comfortable-loved the beds! Based on other reviews, I requested a room near the elevator, which was definitely a good choice. Can't imagine doing the whole circuit with all of our luggage and stroller! The pool area was awesome! The pool itself was nice, but for those who don't want to swim, there was a great lounge area with tv, couches, tables and chairs. There was even a food menu to order from if you felt in need of a snack. It was great, since we had an infant and so even though one of us needed to be with her, we could still be down in the pool area and watch our other child. We ate at the restaurant in the morning for breakfast and enjoyed the buffet quite a bit. Had it not been included in our room package, we probably would not have chosen to eat there, but it was great and we had no complaints. Speaking of the package, I'd highly recommend it. We did the aquarium package, which included parking, tickets to the aquarium, and breakfast. Based on the prices for each thing individually, I'd say we made the right choice. Something to consider, anyway. If you're headed to the aquarium, I think this hotel has the best location of any I saw. It was just across the street and down about two blocks. Great view of it from our room! Also close is the Hard Rock Cafe, a Cheesecake Factory, and the entire Harbor area. The staff was very friendly and helpful, pool was great, and room was comfortable. We'd definiely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: PaVistor19460
Reviews.Content: Arrived Friday Dec 30 for 2 nights. The front desk was very nice. Checked into a nice,clean updated room. The bed was very comfortable. The room faced the harbor. Great view. Saw the fireworks from our room. Great crab soup at this hotel. Better then the well known seafood resturants. The only complaint was housekeeping. They did not complete their room check. We had to call for shampoo,tissues and they only give you 2 towels. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for conference”
Reviews.Author: S_S
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 4 nights as part of a conference. Room was very comfy & clean. The hotel provided most of the food for our meetings and it was great. Location is right across from the harbor, a nice walk between meetings and to the aquarium. My room was very far from the elevator, so if this is a problem, be sure to request a close room, as the hotel is shaped in a square with only one way up to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: Islander_66_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention and thought the hotel was adequate but nothing special. The room was nice but nothing special. The hotel restaurant/bar on the 5th floor had pretty tepid service. The location was good and close to the harbor. Overall, it was worth the money and a nice place, but pretty ordinary overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Enough Place”
Reviews.Author: Teal E
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable bed! Housekeeping was slow to pick up room service trays, sometimes longer than 24 hours. Wifi is $12.95 a day and not very reliable - it dropped me several times. No vent in bathroom. Front desk staff was helpful. Attached mall was nice for window shopping and fast food. Hotel resraurant should be avoided at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Good loctaion, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tarheel21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here since it was the host hotel for a professional conference I attended. I had my spouse and two kids with me and the location was great for the tourist attractions. The hotel is in a mall so there is stuff to look at right near the lobby. The room was a nice size and very clean. The most outstanding aspect of this hotel was the friendly and knowledgeable staff. Considering how crowded the hotel was for the convention, I was amazed at how helpful and upbeat the staff remained. The main negative of this hotel is that I had to pay for internet access each day per device. Seeing as how my family had five devices needing internet access, this was a MAJOR drawback for us. I still can't believe hotels continue to insist on charging for wi-fi access in this day and age when just about all travelers require internet access. If this had not been the host hotel for my convention, I would have searched for a hotel that offered free wi-fi. My employer paid for my internet access but it was really frustrating for my husband to have to drag the kids to the Starbucks a few blocks away in order to use his iPad to plan the day's activities. It was also a major pain that the hotel did not even offer free wi-fi for conference participants in the meeting rooms. For $220 per night, spare me some wi-fi during the day so I can check my work e-mail on my iPad! Also, I wouldn't recommend going too far off the beaten path around this hotel. There are plenty of places to walk to right in the Inner Harbor but don't walk too far outside the boundary. We wanted to try a crab place recommended by a friend that was one mile from the hotel so we figured we would walk. Not a good idea! The neighborhood went from bad to worse in a matter of blocks and we did not feel safe at all. Needless to say, we took a cab back to the hotel after dinner. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for business trips but I would might look elsewhere for a family vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: I'm a Marriott Platinum Elite member - lots of nights at lots of Marriotts. Renaissance usually can be counted on for a good showing for the Marriott brand. Not in this case. Some details: Mouse traps in the hallways, unclean pool water that actually smelled. sink taps that spit brown rust. Perhaps they are confused with "Ramada" - that's seems to be their standard. Need to clean up their act - I will avoid this hotel until they do.

Reviews.Title: “just about perfect......”
Reviews.Author: saylynshoe
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Renaissance while attending a trade show in October. Room was delightful, staff was friendly and the Lobby Bar was a great place to entertain guests prior to dining out.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Allante1
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Renaissance Baltimore Harborplace Hotel for our anniversary. The room was comfortable and had a nice view. The front desk, knowing it was our anniversary, sent a cake up to our room while we were out site seeing during the afternoon. The lobby bar staff recommended a great Italian Restaurant named Supanos around the corner for dinner which was awesome with live jazz music and great food. Highlt recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and okay service!”
Reviews.Author: toes_in_the_sand609
Reviews.Content: We wanted to be able to do a lot of things in Baltimore and not have to drive and this hotel was in the perfect location for that!! From the hotel lobby you can enter the Gallery Mall and they have a lot of shops and a food court. You can also take the skywalk (or cross the street) over to the harbor. There are more shops and restaurants in there and of course the beautiful harbor. Little Italy is a short walk from the hotel (about 10/15min) and they have cute shops and yummy cafes/restaurants. Within a 5/10 min walk you can get to Power Plant Live. Power Plant Live has a lot of bars/clubs and places to eat. The service at check in wasn’t that great. The lady didn’t want to stop doing her “work” to assist me…so that was very frustrating. She wasn’t very warm or welcoming to us either. The valet attendants are very helpful and know a lot about the nightlife and some even had passes for some clubs at Power Plant Live. The rooms were a great size and had an extra chair and ottoman, which made it great for hanging out in the room. All rooms come with a refrigerator. We had a great weekend in Baltimore!!

Reviews.Title: “By far the best place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Raeci
Reviews.Content: We had our Family Reunion here July 2010. Don't bother to rent car. Everything is in walking distance and the clean buses are free! A 3 story shopping mall is connected to the Mall. There is a covered walkway, above the street that connects to the Inner Harbour! The hotel is excellent, friendly staff, clean rooms, great resturant. A perfect getaway for each family member!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Place to Stay, Above-Average, Not Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Spartan_79
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, helpful front desk, attentive maid service, nice rooms. I would certainly stay again, but I save a "5" rating for truly exceptional places with special and/or unique features (eg waterfall showers). This hotel is very nice, but not extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “A model of consistency”
Reviews.Author: DinEd
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel and sponsored various business functions here over the past ten years. I had been staying at other hotels in the area recently because of rates. But on this recent trip I decided to return here to see what had changed and if the hotel or service had lost it's edge. I was happy to see that it had not. Service was excellent. The public areas and facilities were spotless and up to date. The attachment to the mall and walkway to the Inner Harbor is ideal. We didn't get a chance to use the restaurant since there was 2 business meetings in house, so it was a bit crowded. The group that was in was a bit noisy and late to retire. But that is hard to control at any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back”
Reviews.Author: ZinSkier
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was helpful and courteous. The hotel is conveniently located across the road from the harbor and within easy walking or transit access to local attraction. I was there for a workshop and had all meals at the hotel. I thought the food was very good and the service was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: goneinaheartbeat
Reviews.Content: we stayed here one night and LOVED it. We upgraded to a harbor view and it was worth the extra $40. Awesome view! Large, clean rooms. It is connected to a mall (the mall was only ok).Relatively easy access to the airport. If we ever go back to Baltimore, we will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Marriott in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ben21horse
Reviews.Content: Great location at the Inner Harbor. The rooms are typical Marriott rooms but the towels are the plushest hotel towels I've ever felt. So nice. My room was on the 7th floor looking out to the west and there was a lot of street noise. Request a higher floor and/or a room facing the atrium rather than the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hammyaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 15 October through 19 October while attending a conference. Upon arrival at the front desk I asked for a room with a harbor view (if possible). They gave me a room on the 6th floor with a full view of the harbor for no addiional charge. Being right on the street made the room a bit noisy, and the "Occupy Baltimore" folks camped in the park across the street didn't help, but no real complaints. The staff were frendly and the room was clean and meet our needs. There is a 4 story mall attached to the south side of the hotel with a small food court on the 4th floor. Most of the stores are trendy and higher end shops. Across the street is the Inner Harbor Mall. We tried all of the restaurants in the place, and liked the Cheese Cake Factory the best. The bed was great, and the pillows were feather. You will probably get use to the constant sirens going up and down the street.

Reviews.Title: “nice location!”
Reviews.Author: ladyatlantic
Reviews.Content: We recently had a quick get-away weekend to Baltimore, and at the last minute picked this hotel off of the internet. The location is wonderful. The rooms were clean and well attended to. The service was excellent. We had a problem with our safe, and security immediately came up, fixed the safe, but encouraged us to take our gun with us instead of locking it in the safe. Kind of scary!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room..That's It”
Reviews.Author: csokuya
Reviews.Content: The room was really magnificent. The bathroom was pretty clean, the bed very comfortable, furniture in great condition. However, the hotel is built in a very odd way - we had a room on the non-harbor view side, and every time we went in/out, we had to walk all the way around the floor to the other side b/c there was only 1 set of elevators. In addition, the noise level that came through the door/walls was overwhelming, like there was no sound-proofing at all. The housekeeping that came by both mornings was extremely loud. In addition, the pay per day parking is very expensive in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Motadean
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the heart of inner harbor. The mall is connected to the lobby. There is a bridge that takes you over the intersection to the inner harbor. The only down side is you should pay the extra money for the harbor view because its a long walk to your room if you are on the city view side.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelerst18
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location located right on the Inner Harbor. Harbor Place, the Aquarium, the Science Center and Camden Yards are within easy walking distance. Had a room on the 10th floor with a city view. The police sirens outside can take a bit of getting used to, but otherwise a great hotel. The hotel is also connected to a mall which offers easy access to stores, restaurants, and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: FLLadydoc
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, excellent location. Fabulous view from waterfront and 12th floor - can't be beat. Walk across street to Inner Harbor. Needs double insulation ( or triple?!) windows for blocking out street noise. Difficult to sleep for those of us accustomed to peace and quiet. Taxis were immediately available. "Occupy Protesters" need to go.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: moldowlc
Reviews.Content: Warm welcoming staff. Convenient to all. Clean comfortable rooms. Ask to see your room first though. Offered a city suite, which would have been nice for business entertaining, but inner view less than inspiring. Also, upgraded to a partial waterview, as a Marriott Rewards member, so how did my colleague, who is a non-member, get a prime waterview room???

Reviews.Title: “Dependable and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jrmiranda
Reviews.Content: On a yearly basis we have been traveling to Baltimore around the end of the year. This hotel has proved dependable, extremely well located, comfortable. Excellent staff close to all the action. Our home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: tripdadNj
Reviews.Content: my family got together for our parents 50th anniversary in mid july.. the hotel, while far more expensive than our usual accomadations, was well worth the extra money. It was conviently located in the center of the inner harbor. our party consisted of 14 children from 18yrs. old to 1. we found that the second floor bridge allowed us to cross pratt st safely with the kids without worrying about traffic. The rooms were very large and clean. the pool was clean and well staffed. check-in was a breeze. Cleveland Indians in town that weekend, stayed at the hotel.skip the valet parking, and park your own car. You'll save money, and be able to access your vehicle whenever you please. This will not be possible if using the valet service.

Reviews.Title: “More or Less as I Expected”
Reviews.Author: RichFromOmaha
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights here on business. As a Marriott hotel, everything was as expected. Rooms were nicely appointed and clean. I was hopeful when I was told I would be on the 11th floor. However, after I opened the curtains, my view was disappointing as it just looked upon other windows in the building. Boring. The rooms were kept up nicely and were very quiet. Of course, there are always people who just let their doors slam at what ever hour, not caring how loud it slams. The front desk staff were courteous and prompt. The location is great as you can just cross the street to a great walk by the harbor, countless restaurants, shops, pubs, and beautiful views, especially at night. I had breakfast at the Waterfront restaurant on the 5th floor. was served promptly and the food was high quality, but very pricey. Concierge staff was not much help when I couldn't seem to contact my shuttle ride. He just pointed to a phone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Inner Harbor - location -clean rooms and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Getme2snow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back from FL, to see the sights and catch an O's game. Boston was in town and they were staying at the hotel -pretty cool seeing them come and go. Clean rooms, helpful staff, nice lounge for taking a break, and so convenient -across the street from the Inner Harbor. Would definitely stay again. Not quite 5 star -slightly worn down -but only slightly -pretty well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Darla777
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is conveniently located in the Inner Harbour which makes everything you are looking for at your fingertips. The pros to the hotel, location, location, location, they give you an option of valet parking (40.00 per night) to self parking (28.00 per night). Check in was a breeze, the only recommendation I would make is the recognize repeat customers and marriott reward customers (its a nice touch). The rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel is attached to the Gallery Mall which is very convenient. There is also a walkway to the harbour. There is a waterfront restaurant which offers a very reasonable buffet (18.00 for adults and 9 for children). My only con would be in reference to our service at this restaurant, Saturday morning was excellent, we had a fabulous waiter and the service was impeccable, unfortunately I can not say the same for Sunday. Our waiter did not exist, we were seated and no one came to help us, I complained to the supervisor who sent someone over, but he really could not be bothered getting us our beverages. I complained again to the supervisor who got our drinks for us. Unfortunately no one came back to our table, when it was time to leave I didn't know how to get the bill, so I seeked out the supervisor again. He apologized and said the bill was on the hotel for our inconvenience. So every though the service lacked tremendously one day, it turned into a positive. I would recommend the Renaissance to anyone who is looking for convenience and a nice hotel for their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: hammad413
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with some friends. Friendly people, nice surroundings, and great great location. It was everything we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: Harroo
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent the weekend here; we were both very satisfied: The price is acceptable for a supremely central location. The in-house parking deck was a godsend, as it was raining like a monsoon on our arrival. The staff were gracious and helpful in fulfilling all our requests; among other things, we asked for a quiet room with two beds (and the beds were very very comfortable!!) Negatives: the internet connection is expensive and way too slow for the price. The coffee served at the Starbucks in the lobby is VERY weak and watery -- BUT, the free coffee in packets provided with the in-room brew-it-yourself kit is the best I've found in a hotel room. [n.b., the area outside the hotel has so many dining choices that we did not use room service for meals.]

Reviews.Title: “Nice place.”
Reviews.Author: adi23das
Reviews.Content: Friendly people, nice surroundings, and great price through priceline!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Expensive Food and too Loud to sleep”
Reviews.Author: diznymom0
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel on business for a conference. The hotel itself was very nice. The doormen were excellent (I don't think I was allowed to open a door once for myself--thanks!). Check in was easy. I didn't heed the warnings on TA to ask for a room facing the Harbor and regretted it (more on that later). I checked in and then proceeded over to the kiosk in the lobby to print my boarding pass for my flight the next evening (nice touch and convenient to have the printer and kiosk there). I then proceeded up to my room on the 6th floor. I was in room 6048. This room was a king room facing the city street below. I wasn't there for the view so that was ok. The room was large, extremely clean and had ample amenities including the usual toiletries, etc. This hotel does not offer free wifi in the rooms which would have been nice for the price and caliber of this hotel (it's 12.95 if you want it). The room's heating system was excellent as I am from Florida and it was only 44 degrees outside. There were plenty of towels, etc. I placed an order from room service and it was there quickly and the food quality and temperature was excellent. I wasn't paying for it so it wasn't terrible for me, however had I been paying my dinner was $54.99 for a cup of soup, a dinner and a gingerale (note: no alcohol or dessert for that price???). The disappointing part came next. I had a VERY hard time sleeping because although I was on the 6th floor, it sounded like I was sleeping in the middle of the street below. Sirens blaring, car horns beeping, etc. There wasn't much quiet time to say the least. Overall, I would stay here again, but would DEFINATELY request a room away from the busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TechSMU
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently on business. Room was large and very clean. Cannot beat the location for visits to Camden Yards, harbor area and other sites. Lots of good restaurants nearby. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice harbor view”
Reviews.Author: tripmiss
Reviews.Content: This is a great location. It's across from the harbor and next to the Harborplace shopping center. We were there in the winter so we got a lot of Christmas shopping done. Rooms were spacious, comfortable and clean. A short cab ride from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great service. Great location”
Reviews.Author: theProfBrisbane
Reviews.Content: A breath of fresh air compared to some of the ostensible 4 and 5 star hotels in the NorthEast that do not care about their clients. This one looks after its customers beautifully. Great location close to the restaurants on the waterfront. Clean rooms and friendly and helpful staff. I will choose this one again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: StevenVA
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying at this property when in Baltimore - it is located in the heart of the Inner Harbor, and is convenient to much of what the city has to offer. The rooms are very nice, the location is great, and the staff is wonderful. I was fortunate enough to be upgraded to a corner suite - a much larger room. The sofa and chair in the room were not particularly comfortable, so I did not use them. Also, the pillows on the bed are all feather pillows, and give little support. I'm sure had I requested foam pillows, the hotel would have delivered them, but I just kept what was originally supplied. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Dream come true”
Reviews.Author: Truu03
Reviews.Content: This was a family vacation the week after Labor Day. I low-bid on Priiceline and got this room for 65% off advertised prices. They couldn't have been more wonderful. They clearly knew we were Priceline customers, but I never felt like that diminished service. Awesome! I'll go again, even if it is not with Priceline! The location was primo, the accommodations were very clean and comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful. You won't regret a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: jlg5016
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting inner harbor, this is by far the best place to stay. For the location, you can't beat the cost. The staff was very friendly & accommodating and the rooms were at the utmost cleanliness standards. It has a lovely indoor pool and the restaurant within the hotel was fabulous. Grand slam, renaissance!

Reviews.Title: “superior stay”
Reviews.Author: jerseyshoregirl54
Reviews.Content: spent race weekend (Inaugural Baltimore Grand Prix) at this hotel which was track side. Everything was excellent and surprisingly the room service food was delivered quickly, was delicious and very reasonably priced. Staff could not have been more inviting and helpful especially "Rick" one of the event managers who went out of his way to make our stay "Superior" Kudos Renaissance ! Only issue hi price for wireless internet which did not work well. Be sure to try their crab soup !

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: beynac
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights with our two kids, ages 2 and 6. We were looking for a nice hotel on the inner harbor, where we could park our car and leave it for the duration. We definitely got what we wanted! The location of this hotel could not be more perfect. Easy walking distance to everything we wanted to see. The adjacent mall is convenient. Several restaurants in close proximity. The self-parking fee actually seemed reasonable considering the location. We booked this hotel through Priceline, so I certainly can't complain about the rate. After asking very nicely at check in they gave us a water-view room, which I really wasn't expecting (but hugely appreciated) since we were one of "those" Priceline people. We would definitely return to this hotel. I would've given it 5 stars, but we had one incident where the management completely miss-communicated with us and did not follow through. I think this was an isolated incident, as most of the people we encountered were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loud room; bewildered staff”
Reviews.Author: Hamlet903
Reviews.Content: I'll say first that this hotel has some points in its favor. Our room was quite lovely: sophisticated in design, and spacious. And, if you're planning on focusing on harbor front attractions, the location is superb. In addition, most of the staff is quite friendly and all of them seem to mean well. But good intentions are just good intentions. The package we had was supposed to include breakfast, but when we got to the restaurant we found that our names weren't on the list where they were supposed to be. In order to straighten this out, we had to make a couple of trips to and from the front desk and back to the restaurant, and though it seems that they got it straight in the end (I haven't gotten my credit card bill yet, so I'm not 100% sure), it didn't leave a good taste in our mouths--and neither did the breakfast, which was fairly mediocre. More importantly, we'd specifically requested a quiet room, and were put on the sixth floor, where we listened to the music of the wedding reception on the floor below until it was almost midnight. Frankly, though, it probably wouldn't have mattered where we were put, as soundproofing was pretty much non-existent: when seated in our room, as far away from the room door as one could be, I could clearly hear the conversations of people passing by in the hall, and they weren't even talking loud. And, if you're stuck there on a night when the hotel is virtually taken over by weddings, and well-lubricated people are making merry together in the hallway, you may as well give up on the notion of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mimi47729
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to get a great deal on priceline for this hotel. From the moment we arrived at the hotel we were treated great. We were able to check in quickly and because we had arrived later than anticipated and very hungry we asked where we could grab something to eat and the hotel clerk was very helpful as to what we was open at the late hour. The room was extremely clean, the bed comfy and we were not to far from the elevator which was a plus. The hotel is conveniently located right across the street from the harbor so once we parked our car there was no need to drive. However parking is a bit pricey but what do you expect for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Alway come back here!”
Reviews.Author: angelina721
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at this hotel for about 10years and it has always been a great experience. I love how this hotel is contected to the harbor place mall and you do not have to go outside to get into the mall! My husband can be sleeping and I can shop :) This is the only hotel directly at the center of all of teh attractions at the harbor - great in teh summer and in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming staff for a large hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patricia0703
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this hotel and it was the best experience we have had at a large traditional hotel. We prefer the intimacy of small boutique hotels but decided to go with the convenient location of the Renaissance. The cheerful friendliness of the staff made this stay a pleasure. We were able to check in early without even asking, and did not stand in line for a minute to check out before a doorman came to take care of it for us. In fact, "doorman" is not an adequate job title for the staff who took care of us and treated us like family. The hotel staff not only seemed genuinely interested in making sure we were happy, they remembered where we headed out in a taxi and asked about it the next day! In addition, the room was large, the bed was comfortable with soothing linens, a small refrigerator replaced the useless minibar, Aveda toiletries were provided, and it was very quiet. This hotel is a treasure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfy hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: memi29
Reviews.Content: We went for a long weekend trip and had a great time. The hotel was very clean and was well kept. I am VERY picky when it comes to hotels (am a germaphobe) and I loved it. My husband did too. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in in a hotel. We were worried because we have been used to the temperpedic type of bed and weren't sure if ths would feel to weird after getting used to the temperpedic, but we both loved it and slept very well. The hotel staff was very nice and friendly. Anytime I walked near the front lobby, I was greeted and asked if I needed anything. Loved the location right on the Inner Harbor! We had a great view and loved how close it was to everything! Extra bonus that it was connected to a mall!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, lovely views, good service”
Reviews.Author: traveler91047
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel for 3 nights per week nearly every week from November 2010 to April 2011. First, the positives: the hotel has excellent service, the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. I only had a few special requests while I was there but I was always readily accommodated. I really enjoyed the workout room, with treadmills and elliptical machines facing windows (not the optimal view, but still nicer than a wall). The coffee bar opens very early and serves Starbucks beverages, which I really enjoyed. The beds are very comfortable, and the rooms in general are nice. Each room has a mini-fridge that probably used to be a mini-bar. I made good use of mine since I didn't like to eat in restaurants every night (though there are an abundance nearby). Which brings me to the best thing about the hotel, its location. It is directly across from the harbor, and the views - if you get a full harbor view - are delightful. The aquarium is across the street, as are many attractions at the harbor (e.g., USS Constellation, water taxis, live music in the summertime). On the downside, the hotel is pretty pricey unless you get a good corporate rate or some other deal (which I did). Also, parking is not cheap, but similar to other locations in the city. And ... this is kinda petty ... there is only one elevator bank which is quite far from some of the rooms. The hotel occupies nearly a full city block and is built around a courtyard. So, if your room is at the opposite corner from the elevators you feel like you have walked a half mile to get there. It's good exercise, but I finally started requesting a room closer to the elevators. The best rooms are the ones with the full harbor view, because they are a medium-distance from the elevators as well as the nicest.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely terrible to Otakon goers”
Reviews.Author: StaceyBla
Reviews.Content: Let me get this out of the way first, I came in from Dallas, Texas in order to go to Otakon. I thought that since this hotel had recieved high ratings that we'd get good service and nothing would go wrong. Oh boy, was I wrong. When we were checking in Thursday before the convention actually started the person who booked our room had to deal with quite possibly the rudest person I have ever seen in my entire six-year convention hotel experience. This guy continually told her the wrong amount for the room, would not work with us, was condescending as all get-out, and pretty much continued to COUNT OUR MONEY WRONG at the same time. I walked away to calm down half-way through this but I counted at least three times he counted our money wrong and no one else at the front desk would help when one of our other friends tried to get someone else to help us instead of him. It was pretty much like we were "lesser guests" because of the fact we were there for Otakon.
