I watched before we were able to check in and everyone who wasn't "convention goers" was treated with absolute respect and politeness. This is ridiculous considering we pay just as much as other people to stay in this place. The rooms were also entirely uncomfortable as the AC was spotty at best and the beds felt like I was sleeping on a slab of stone instead of a bed. Also, if we needed extra towels or anything it took at least an hour, if not more, to get any and they always sounded like we were taking valuable time away from them for doing so. This is the worst experience I have EVER had in a hotel and I will certainly not be staying here ever again or recommending it to anyone ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great customer service! !!!”
Reviews.Author: hypermom
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I tagged along with the hubby to Baltimore. He came here for a conference for 4 days. During this time,we had to use the fax machine to receive and send faxes. The front desk staff were great and patient with us in helping us. Room was great. Housekeeping was good. I love the fact that the hotel is attached to a mall and you can use the overpass to get to the inner harbor rather than crossing the street. I would come back to this hotel again. Great customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lowxr
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel at a reasonable price, walking distance to the Inner Harbor and Camden Yards. They also have discounted on site parking for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: mich821
Reviews.Content: I got my room for $85 Off priceline. The room online is $280. It was a nice clean room just like the hotel pics show. It did not have a view. They said that would be an extra $40. Parking is $28 for overnight. Its location is great. It has a walkway over to the harbor and there is shopping everywhere. I would not have been happy paying $280, but for the deal I got, I was very happy! Priceline is the way to go!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but!!”
Reviews.Author: 33833Marie
Reviews.Content: Perfect location...within walking distance to almost anything you desire. Rooms were adequate. Staff there to please. However, I believe it was over-priced. Except for lemonade in the lobby...and coffee pot in room...there was nothing else complimentery. I have stayed in many hotels...with less rates..and at least received a complimentery breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: UKlibby
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five days. The staff were friendly, hotel was nice and clean. Excellant location. The only minus is the restaurant recommendation from the concierge, we were recommended Da Nimmos and stupidly didn't check with Trip Advisor first. In future I wont be asking the concierge for advice on restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again next trip....”
Reviews.Author: newbietravelor
Reviews.Content: Delivered what I expected. Stayed on 10th floor, had a great view of the harbor. Floor was quiet at night and room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location”
Reviews.Author: DonnaB20
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect location to visit all the Inner Harbor attractions. You walk across an access bridge or across the street and you are in the Harbor. We were able to leave our car in the parking garage the whole time and walk or take the water taxi. The room was a nice size for a city hotel, was kept very clean and the beds were very comfortable. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: abounatom
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a conference and had a harbour view room. The hotel is located in a mall and just across from the inner harbour area of Baltimore so there is plenty to do and numerous places to eat. Only complaints were that we asked for new sheets for our infant's pack and play three times before they brought them and the pool was only opened mornings and evenings. Club lounge was alsO

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a mom and daughter trip”
Reviews.Author: chloesmomNJ
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here so we could could spend some time here and see the Inner Harbor. We could not have asked for more. The room was wonderful. We had two double beds which was perfect since it was just the two of us. We could see the aquarium from the room when it was lit up at night which thrilled her to no end. It was all she could talk about! The location is very convenient as far as getting to the inner harbor. We didn't go anyplace else since I didn't have a car and don't actually walk too well, so I can't speak to location in regards to Camden Yards or Little Italy or any other area. There is a mall connected to the hotel which is convenient if your forget something but also adds to a bit of foot traffic and makes getting around a little confusing. At least if you come in the wrong door and didn't realize you were in a mall :-). All in all we had a wonderful stay and would definitely stay here again if we found a good deal. My daughter is already planning our next trip to the aquarium!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us and U2!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy6284
Reviews.Content: When I got great tickets to U2 concert, came to TripAdvisor to find a place to stay. Realized we had enough Marriott rewards points to stay here for the night, so booked it. When we pulled up, were met and asked if we wanted valet parking. Since we did, they unloaded the vehicle for us, took the car, and brought our bags to the front desk. We were there a bit early (NEVER know what DC traffic will be) and I was a bit disappointed the room wasn't ready. BUT, they took our cell #, stored our bags, so we went across the street to the harbor. Found an Irish bar & grill and had great lunch -- we figured would be too hot at the stadium to eat. Just as we finished lunch, phone rang. Our room was ready! Then the surprise! Seems when we checked in a King room WAS ready, but the lady at the desk noticed we had been upgraded to a suite, which was why she had us wait. OMG! The suite was huge! 8th floor, corner of the building, with views of the harbor! PERFECT!!! We had plenty of time to settle in and rest up before the concert. Even though I am asthmatic and the heat index was 101 that night, my dh and I had no problems walking from the hotel to M&T Stadium. Even return walk to the hotel was great! MUCH cooler and the Baltimore police department were well prepared for the 70,000+ crowd! I don't enjoy cities, but I would return to Baltimore. So, we get back to the hotel after 11pm, and they too, were prepared for the crowd. Was nice we didn't have to hunt for our room key to get into the lobby...they just kept personnel on duty for us. Since our suite not only had king bed, sofa, chair and dining table (seating for 6, not just a little bistro area!), I ordered room service for breakfast. Food was great! I was sceptical when they said it would be delivered in 25 minutes or less. But in less than 20 minutes, we were enjoying a wonderful breakfast. Really wanted some time to enjoy the harbor area and they had no problem with our car and luggage staying there until we were ready to leave. Enjoyed the aquarium, did some shopping, went back to that Irish bar and grill, then headed back to go home. Our car was out front already! Our bags were quickly delivered and placed in the vehicle and valet even helped us get out of the area! Again, I don't care for cities. We usually stay in national parks areas or small towns. But with the treatment we received in Baltimore, I would return. Curious as to the price of that room! Thanks to the TA Baltimore experts, we had a PERFECT stay!

Reviews.Title: “Cute and great location”
Reviews.Author: TravelinUndertaker
Reviews.Content: I am from the area and this hotel was used because I was doing a job in teh downtown area and I didnt want to go home after ever long evening. So, I stayed here and I was not disappointed at all. The rooms were super clean and the value was pretty good. Depending on where your rooms was located depended on the view. I enjoyed the downstairs area and the small bar for cocktails after 7. The Gallery is not what it use to be years ago but never the less its there for shopping. They make you pay $12 for internet a day and that sucked.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel poor service”
Reviews.Author: Ftclunchbox
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and price was not horrible. The waterfront restaurant is good, and the hotel is in a great location. Downside staff was rude at check in, and whenever you had a question they did not know the answer and offered no alternatives. Has business center but rips you off at 3 bucks per minute to use computer. Internet was over priced and for what you pay should be included.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and location”
Reviews.Author: queenofthedamned
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have never traveled to Baltimore and I was searching for a good hotel near Camden Yards so that we could walk to the ballgame. There were several hotels in the Marriott chain which I love but none seemed close to places to eat etc. We chose the Renaissance Harbor since it was close to all the harbor attractions. The staff was outstanding and the hotel was always secure and safe with visible security people. My husband is a runner and was concerned about where he should run; the security guys were all about giving him a good 5 mile run thru the harbor area. This place was close enough to walk to Camden yards with the rest of us crazy Yankee fans. Just a beautiful hotel and locations

Reviews.Title: “Fit for Everyone”
Reviews.Author: joenodaker
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were concerned when we checked in for a Saturday night stay. We came to Baltimore to have dinner with friends and enjoy the Baltimore Harbor. But when we entered the hotel, we saw that it was the headquarters for a bunch of athletic teams in town for a softball tournament. They tend to be late-night, room-hopping party animals. Then too, we saw by signs in the lobby that the hotel was hosting the graduation party for one of the city's high schools. Oh boy. I told my wife we might end up driving home to get some sleep that night. But I expressed my concerns to the lady behind the counter and she said "not to worry." We ended up with a beautiful room (I had a low, pre-paid rate that didn't promise me anything but a bed to sleep on) on a quiet floor and with the exception of all the excitement in the lobby, we would have thought we had the hotel to ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorII
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel. The rooms are modern, clean, and comfortable. There was a small refrigerator in the room. Maid service was good and we didn't experience and issues during our two night stay. There is a Starbuck's on the first floor as well as a lounge. The restaurant is on the fifth floor, but we didn't eat there so I can't comment on it one way or the other. The location is great. The hotel is located adjacent to a smal mall with shopping and food. Across the street is the harbor along with shops, sights, and eating establishments. Valet parking is available, but there is a parking garage under the hotel which is convienient. They charge $28/day which can be added to your hotel bill. By the way, I booked this hotel through Priceline and got an awesome deal (less than half price). What a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: DavidandKim
Reviews.Content: We were in Baltimore for my husband's conference and stayed a couple of extra nights. Positives: Front staff very nice. Housekeeping was great-they were all very friendly and our room was very clean. Great location. The exercise room was stocked and nice. It is convinient to the inner harbor. We also went to the Orioles game and it is just a few blocks from the hotel. It is attached to a small mall. Negatives: It is like a maze getting to our room-not close to the one set of elevators. It is very loud-there are large gaps under the doors and so any noise in the hall is loud in your room. A flap on the bottom of the door would really help. There was not any concierge services-when we asked at the front desk for directions, etc.-they just gave us a map, but didn't outline anything, etc. A lot of hotels have a running/walking map-but not here. On the Saturday night we were there something happened in the harbor, so there were tons of police out and the hotel evidently did a lock down for security-which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Priceline. Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CynthaDelTorro
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 13 - 16, 2011. We bid $100/night on Priceline for a 4star hotel in Baltimore's Inner Harbor and "won" a room at the Renaissance Harborplace. We didn't realize it until we got to our room that we had been upgraded to a corner suite ($350/night when booked through the hotel online). Score! TIP: It pays to be super nice and friendly when you check in. I don't care how long you've waited in line or what kind of day you've had. When you check in be friendly, use the hotel employees names when talking to them (that's why they all wear nametags!) and if at all possible be amusing. We've received numerous upgrades just be being funny and friendly to the staff when we arrive. Being a corner unit the windows spanned two entire sides of the room which was very nice. The view was of the city not the harbor, but considering what we paid, no complaints. It was quite spacious with a separate sitting area (wall mounted flat panel TV ,couch, 2 chairs, large leather ottoman and two end tables) and wet bar/kitchenette (microwave, coffemaker, sink and fridge). The sleeping area was large (king size bed, desk and chair) with another television and another refrigerator in the dresser unit. The bathroom was large and the shower had good pressure. The unit was clean throughout. It was a great room and I think we would have been please with a regular king room as well. Other Positives: the location is the best available (fantastically convenient to everything in the inner habor.) spacious clean rooms, room service food is good and sometimes great (try the jumbo lump crab omlette!) and food arrives when they say it will. Decor is modern and pleasing to the eye. Negatives: Our suite was very very far from the only set of elevators. If mobility is a concern specify a room close to the elevators. The lobby bar not open as much as the hotel literature said it would be. We had a drink there on Friday, but were not able to on other days when we posted hours stated the bar would be open. (We did not venture to the bar in the restaurant which was probably open at those times). Also the hotel conducted a test of the fire alarms at 8:30 am on Monday. Guests were given no notice and most of us evacuated using the stairs when the announcements told us to. When we reached the outside and made our way to the front of the hotel a security apologized, to us it was a drill and said we could return to our rooms. Kind of irritating. I'm glad it wasn't raining. If you are there and the fire alarms go off at 8:30 in the morning, you might want to try calling the front desk before you hike down 10 flights. :) Overall a very positive experience. We would consider staying there even if we can't ge a Priceline discount in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beware tech savvy business traveler”
Reviews.Author: drkraven7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for business. Since both of us are in the computer software industry, and are tech geeks by trade, we tend to travel with several mobile devices i.e. laptops, netbook, tablet, smartphones, ereader. Upon booking this hotel we were aware we would have to pay a daily internet charge of $12.95. Much to our disappointment that charge was per device, per connection type. That meant if we used the internet on my laptop by firstly connecting to the ethernet cable at the desk we were charged the $12.95. However if I decided to work away from the desk and attempt to connect via wireless, from the same laptop, I would again be charged another $12.95. Or when I finished using the internet and my husband tried to connect to the internet using his laptop or another device (other than my laptop) we would have again been charged even though we were not using the internet at the same time. Knowing how this technology works, and being aware that we are living in the year 2011 where even cheap hotels can offer free internet, both my husband and I found this policy ridiculous. When my husband called the night time front desk representative to clarify our understanding of the policy, the hotel employee was not only unapologetic but rude with my husband. We called the customer service of the parent company, Marriott, and the representative was very polite and tried to help us by clarifying the policy with our hotel's front desk. She must have reached the same hotel employee because the customer service rep called us back to inform us that the employee had hung up on her after telling her that that was the policy. Overall, I could say that the hotel room was nice and comfy (albeit not as quiet) as many other guests on this site have mentioned, and that it is conveniently located to many attractions, shopping, and restaurants, However, given our trip was for business purposes and we found ourselves inconvenienced by outdated internet policies and unprofessional customer service, our stay was definitely not worth the high price tag of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BA2011
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location, great beds, incredible views of water, food was very good... Loves the Starbucks in lobby and great buffet brunch

Reviews.Title: “Awesome room with a great view of harbor!”
Reviews.Author: ptprincess
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night here on Mother's Day May 8'th. We had one of the nicest and biggest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. We chose this hotel because of the location next to the Harbor and also because we had a free night voucher due to the fact that we are Marriott rewards customers. We were leaving the next day for Miami from BWI. Our room was on the 10'th floor, corner room with an awesome view of the harbor. I must say when we went on to Miami to stay at the Ritz Carlton on Key Biscayne, I was rather disappointed in that room compared to the Renaissance. I would highly recommend this hotel. The bed was super comfy!! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Got bitten by a TICK after waking up the next morning”
Reviews.Author: MKSHJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my husband and my daughter during the Easter weekend. We planned to stay for two nights. After the first night, the morning I woke up, I found a tick on my back. My husband had to get the tick out of my skin. I was very upset. My husband went to the lobby, complained to the manger and showed him the bug. The manager took the bug away said he will show it to their pest control guy and offered us free breakfast. My husband rejected his offer and cancelled the second night. We moved to the Hilton nearby which is much cleaner, cheaper and quieter. I do not recommend this hotel, even it is in a convenient location. But with all the noises at night (people just come back late at night), the 'much washed/used and should have been thrown away' pillow cases, it is definitely not worth it.... (we stayed in the 10th floor)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but $$”
Reviews.Author: doreenwol
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, but expensive midweek. Not sure how anyone could complain about the rooms (ours with 2 queen beds). Traveling with teens, if one of the hotels just a few blocks from the harborfront had free breakfast and a pool, we would have been just as happy (but they were sold out).

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Geddylou
Reviews.Content: Took a two day trip to the Inner Harbour and stayed here. Made a Priceline offer of $100.00 per night for a 4 star hotel in the Inner Harbour Area and were surprised to have it accepted considering the rooms were $229 per night booking direct with the hotel. The only negative was we were not able to get a harbor view room without paying an additional $40 per night. We passed. The room was clean and modern. Walls were thin as was the door. You could here people clearly as they walked and talked in the hallways. It quieted down after 9pm. The location is perfect. A short walk to everything you could want to see or do. The Aquarium is just across Pratt Street and the Inner Harbour has many activities. Boat rides, museums and activities for the kids. Parking is a bit pricey. $26 per day for self park and $36 per day for Valet. It was added to our room charges. All in all it is a great place to stay that in centrally located and offers good value if you can price line it. Internet was an additional $12.50 per day. Felt that should be included for a hotel in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, not a great value.”
Reviews.Author: mmrbluewater
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent traveler and I stay at a wide range of hotels both in the U.S. and internationally. I always like to qualify my reviews so that other potential travelers know where I'm coming from. When I travel for business I'm usually staying at high end chain hotels, that's the case with this review. The Renaissance Harborplace is a decent hotel, the rooms are comfortable and roomy and the staff was helpful and cordial. They provided extra feather pillows upon request and the bed/inens were plush. That said, at over $300 per night I've come to expect more from a hotel. The room service food was just ok and the fare at the hotel restaurant was equally mediocre. To be honest this hotel felt like a regular Marriott that the management polished up a bit rather than a high end establishment top to bottom. I've recently stayed at St. Regis, Loews, and Four Seasons at a similar price point and had a much better impression all around. One thing I neeed to mention is that there is only one elevator bank for the hotel and the place is huge. I was on the opposite corner of the hotel from the elevators (room 9068) and it literally took me over three minutes just to walk to my room. If you end up staying here I would recommend asking for a room closer to the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoloLadyWashingtonDc
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore for a medical appointment and chose the Renaissance for its proximity to my physician's office. The staff was very nice, parking was convenient and the room was clean and comfortable. My room was on the front of the hotel. The view was wonderful. My only complaint was the noise level from the street. It seemed that someone was doing some type of work outside, possibly one of the merchant's from an inner Harbor shop. After the work was finished, all was quiet and nice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, but not a good place if you rely on the Internet!”
Reviews.Author: Moochiebpaul
Reviews.Content: Staying here the week of March 30 and what a disaster! First, I asked for a quite room and I was put in a room next to a large industrial fan that was very loud . . . one of the rooms offered to me to move to was on the other side of the same fan! This is a problem for me because I have nerve damage in both of my ears and being next to constant humming noises causes me discomfort, others may not care. After about 45 minutes or so, I finally was given a quite room. The bell man was great in helping us deal with all this, but I cannot say the same about the person who checked us in or the ones on the phone who assured us of a quite room. The hotel offered us no compensation for the inconvenience caused by all this. Also, I should say the comfort of the room is well above average and has a really good bed. Unfortunately, I also had a huge problem with the Internet service at the hotel. For one thing, it is pretty slow and that is frustrating. Second, and this can be a major problem for anyone if interruptions in your Internet service is an issue, you have to renew the service every 24 hours and without warning it just stops. There is no option to have the Internet service for multiple day use. It turned out this was a disaster for me given I rely on doing auctions over the Internet for a living. I had a group of bids to place at 9:59 PM for an auction that closed at 10:00 PM and what happened? The Internet shut down without warning and I had to renew the service . . . and given how slow the Internet here is, that took two minutes and by then the auction was closed and I no longer could place my bids. As a result, I problem lost a few hundred to a couple of thousand dollars in potential profits. Hopefully the hotel will fix this as more-and-more folks rely on the Internet. I will say, if what bothered me wouldn't bother the reader, this is otherwise a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for a good conference”
Reviews.Author: Aethelred
Reviews.Content: This is a very large US-style conference hotel which I enjoy once in a while, and this was one of these occasions. Conference facilities were nice, the rooms very large and refurbished but bathrooms with a distinct 70s or 80s touch, bars and infrastructure okay. I had an extra large room that looked at the atrium, which was actually very conducive for the conference. The a/c system could be improved and the wlan was not always stable. Friendly front desk staff, good car to the airport. The pool was tiny, crowded, and altogether so unappealing that I turned back and had a walk instead. Altogether, a good but not stellar experience, hotel-wise.

Reviews.Title: “Large yet not Grand”
Reviews.Author: freindobill
Reviews.Content: Went for an over over night getaway on the inner harbor with my wife The location was excellent, and the inner harbor is awsome. The hotel lacked charm for me. Large, with a check in line and many convention folks milling around. The new lobby is toned in oranges and browns as is the room. I lived through orange and browns in the 80's in Holiday Inn's. Took my wife for a nice meal at the Water Table.. It was empty on a Saturday Night at 07:30. Food OK, view great. $22 self park. I will try else were on the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Andy99
Reviews.Content: Got a great conference rate. Arrived four hours early and checked straight into my room. Clean and spacious, only issue from my perspective being poor door soundproofing with huge gaps around it allowing corridoor noise to enter the room. Late checkout was easily arranged and the Bellhop arranged for limo transfer to BWI for a good rate. The limo arrived on time and made for a more pleasant experience then a cab.

Reviews.Title: “katherine @ the front desk is x-tra amazing...the pillows suck”
Reviews.Author: itmustaben
Reviews.Content: i was in town for the night with my wife ! and katherine @ the front desk hooked it up. room 11002. an executive suite. full harbor views, big a*# table and couch , wet bar, the works. she deserves twice her pay . she was friendly, polite, engaging and more than generous. BUT...im very picky about my sleep. its a good thing i didnt plan on getting any. the pillows were too fluffy if that is even possible. no neck support @ all. and even being on the 11th floor did not help with the outside noise. it was terrible, and all night long too. being directly @ the inner harbor has its advantages. but certainly not for sleeping. I LOVED THIS HOTEL, AND KATHERINE TOO!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: rwm531
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for President's weekend. The hotel was in a fantastic location on Pratt Street. The front desk staff was kind enough to upgrade us to a waterfront room. The bellmen were kind enough to help us when we needed to keep our bags until we left at the end of our stay. The only complaint that I have is the there is to much space at the bottom of the room door (approximately 2 inches) which allowed one to hear people passing in the hall. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but incompetent staff”
Reviews.Author: Catbert10
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel every week since 1/3/2011. This hotel has the most incompetent billing department and late night front desk staff of just about any Marriott property that I have stayed in. Twice I have been checked into the wrong room. The first time this happened I was awakened at 1:00 in the morning by security trying to verify my identity. I still have a no show charge on my CC due to the hotel's mistake. Last night I was given an already occupied room. Otherwise the hotel is OK for a Renaissance and has a fairly nice gym.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: MJ525
Reviews.Content: We took a quick two night trip to Baltimore a couple weeks ago. It was our first getaway w/out the kids. We stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace. This is a beutiful hotel in a great location. Right across from the water. short walk to all of the fun spots. There is the gallery mall/shopping attatched to the hotel. Plenty of nice spots to eat and drink w/in a two minute walk. I suggest a 15-20 minute walk to the Fells Point area in mild weather. in cold weather it is worth a $8 cab ride. Check out The Horse You Rode In on Saloon if you go. Nice spot. Rooms at the hotel were nice and well appointed. We had a partial harbor view which was fine with us. Our room also had a view of ships, the Hard Rock and much more. Renaissance beds are always the best. One small complaint about the rooms is the front door. there was a lot of space between the door and the frame. most notably at the top and bottom. This allowed light in and some noise from the hallway traffic. Not a huge negative but one none the less. It was not just our room. I took notice while walking past rooms. Other than that it was a nice stay. Staff was nice. If you are flying, i recommend a $34 cab ride from airport to the hotel. It took about 15 minutes. The supershuttle is another option. It is cheaper if you are by yourself. However you ride with other people and it stops at several hotels. So you can add an additional thirty minutes to your trip from airport. If there are two of you, the cab is the way to go. Often you will find private vehicles parked out front of the hotel. The hotel has contracts with them and depending on the car could be 25-35 dollars. Also there is a computer in the lobby of hotel just for airline check in. Very nice to have. Enjoy if you choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTraveler18
Reviews.Content: My fiance just returned from an overnight stay at this lovely hotel. We frequently visit Baltimore and have stayed at almost every other hotel at the harbor, this was by far my favorite. We got a really great rate on the room and then we received a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite that was HUGE!! The view was amazing. My only suggestion would be to put King sized beds in the suites, that was kinda weird. When we got to the room it had been recently cleaned and some cleaning supplies were left in the room. We called down to the front desk and they asked us if we wanted to change rooms and we said no, so they brought us two glasses of wine instead. Security in the hotel is outstanding, customer service is phenomenal and the FULL BLOWN MALL was my absolute favorite!! I will definitely stay here again when I visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location -- overpriced”
Reviews.Author: mark w
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night as a "get away" weekend. The main thing this hotel has going for it is the location -- directly across from the Inner Harbor area, however, there are a LOT of hotels which are nearby and which cost much less and are comparable in quality. We had a harbor view room and the view is very impressive. The room is the same size as a standard size discount motel and the bathroom is certainly not "luxury" -- plastic shower curtain, 4' between sink and tub/shower, etc. The furnishings were an upgrade from a discount motel, but not on par with a luxury hotel. Restaurant was extremely overpriced so we ate elsewhere. The hotel is a short cab ride to Little Italy or Fells Point and in good weather woudl be an easy walk. Parking is $26 extra and there is really no way to get to the hotel except by car. My biggest complaint was that they don't provide complimentary wifi in the rooms to guests. They have wifi, but it's $12.95 extra per day, although it is free in the lobby and bar area and they provide free wifi in their discount chains. We enjoyed our stay, but next time, I would stay somewhere else. There are a lot of options in the area which are nicer and more accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Ehh, could take it or leave it.”
Reviews.Author: debonair8
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was not overly impressed with this hotel. The staff at the front desk was mediocre and the not terribly welcoming. The bellmen were so sweet though. The restaurant was an AWFUL mess...they were understaffed, had to wait for 30 minutes to get food after ordering (note: we have a 2yo and a 4yo) and then, to top it off, the package we got said that it included a "Buffet Breakfast for 2 Adults" on the blue card but when we checked out, the front desk lady said that we couldn't go over $38! I should point out that when we were seated for breakfast the hostess said that since they didn't have the buffet available that day, we could order "anything" off the menu. So, we did. And it came out to a few dollars over the $38 but seriously, did the front desk staff really need to have me waiting to check out for her to charge me an extra $2 bucks for breakfast? So, for this type of thing, I wasn't impressed. I do have to give credit where credit is due. The first room they put us in was across the hall from a noisy party. They moved us to a comparable room very quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful all around”
Reviews.Author: kdcoleman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Years Eve. The lobby is beautiful. The staff were so friendly and professional. Everyone we saw greeted us. Check in was so fast an efficient and this was a busy night for the hotel. The location is absolutely wonderful. The elevators are clean and large. The rooms are modern, very clean.. Our bed was sooooooooo comfortable. Breakfast was great. The food is very good, the fruit fresh and waffles soft. The view of the harbor is great from the resteraunt. Everyone was just so friendly. We were so hung over and every staff member we saw wished us a happy New Year. This si where we sill be staying any time that we come to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good convention site”
Reviews.Author: Navy_Lady
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous stay! Had been to the other Baltimore Marriott, and this one is even better. On top of a shopping center and directly across the street from another, plus the waterside location overlooking the harbor ... what more could you ask for? Well ... you could ask for great service, and they have it. Nice rooms, and they have it. My room directly overlooked the Constellation and the Harbor, and I had a fantastic view over the entire harbor from the Hard Rock and Aquarium to the convention center and college area. Rooms were ample with good amenities. Don't need to bring your toiletries or hair dryer, as they have shampoo, conditioner, lotion, and soaps all from Aveda. Personally, I don't like the Aveda lotion because it's runny and doesn't absorb. There's an in-room safe and coffee maker (under the TV in the cabinet). The bottle of water is $4.00, so you might want to get your own from one of the nearby stores. Nice flat screen TV is good and has plenty of channels, and I particularly like remote controls with a sleep timer. There's a pool and a business center. The boarding pass printer/computer was on the blink, but the gal behind the desk printed off my boarding pass for me. I did check in late. Because it's in the middle of the holiday season and pretty cold in the area, there aren't many tourists. So ... as luck would have it, the bar and restaurant closed early. But I walked across the street to the Irish Pub on top of the shopping center and had a glass of white zin with the bartender who was very nice. One con during this stay: because of the sparce number of guests, they put us all in rooms near each other. Thus, one night I had two screaming kids next to me and the next night I had a bunch of 20-somethings having a party in their room. The walls are thin, and the corridors are long and conduct/amplify sounds. So, you'll want to be sure that you have an outside room away from the elevator ... it will be worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: ennekube
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Baltimore and had the pleasure of staying at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel. The room rates were extraordinarily reasonable for a conference hotel ($125/night) and the hotel room was quite spacious and comfortable (incl. a desk, bed, and armchair). The hotel was conveniently located: within walking distance of two different shopping plazas, numerous restaurants, the National Aquarium, and a very large Barnes & Noble (complete with its own aquarium). The wifi was complimentary and worked quite well. The business center was expensive, but included a wide range of services, so was usable in a pinch. I would recommend this hotel for those looking to explore this part of Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel...but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: CoraleeMT
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful! Several restaurants, coffee shop and mall located right in the hotel! Plus, it's right across the street from the harbor, which means the aquarium, Hard Rock Cafe, Dick's, Cheesecake Factory, Tapas, etc. Fortunately my company paid for the room though, as its a bit pricey. The Brookshire suites is across the street from this hotel, so still int he neighborhood and access to the mall, but a 1/4 of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Less than stellar...”
Reviews.Author: nappieb
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this hotel attending business meetings. It's certainly nothing special but manages to disappoint in most areas! The front desk clerk was abrupt and curt and not at all welcoming to a traveler who had just braved severely delayed flights due to winter weather problems. I was not given the option of refusing a morning newspaper and so had to be guilty of wasting paper and natural resources when one was delivered every morning. The hotel is arranged in a large square formation with about twelve stories looking down and surrounding a courtyard. There is only ONE bank of elevators, meaning that you have a long walk from the elevator to your room if you are not on one of the arms of the square adjacent to the elevator bank. It seems criminally negligent not to have built another elevator bank opposite the existing one which would result in everyone's room being at least 50% closer! The usually ubiquitous "Guide to Guest Services" was not found in my room and instead had been replaced by a card with room service choices. I found this annoying because it so happened that I had a number of questions regarding the hotel's amenities. As usual in hotels that fail to attend to details, the batteries in the TV remote needed changing. Also, for some reason my cell phone signal seemed to be very weak despite my perch on the 11th floor. I have two cell phones and both the Sprint and Verizon signals were not good (?) My room was not cleaned or serviced until after 4 pm regardless of the fact that I left the room at 7:30 am each morning and didn't return until about 3:30 pm or later. On discovering that my room had not been serviced, I retired to the bar each day and worked on my meeting files and presentations to kill time. I would much rather have done this in my room! When I used the business center I was dismayed to discover that the "free computer use for airline check-in" apparently did not include the cost of using the printer to print a boarding pass! Nickel-and-diming seems to be a trademark of substandard hotels like this one!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: anonymousPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference held at the convention center in (about a three block walk). Check in was easy and desk person was very pleasant. Our room was on a side street, but we were still able to see part of the harbor. We were relatively close to the elevator and it was quiet. The only negative (besides the price and no free wifi in the rooms) - the buttons on our phone didn't work and we never could get the clock set correctly. I mentioned this at the desk and someone was supposed to come up, but no one ever did. All in all, a very nice place to stay. Location is top notch for Inner Harbor activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great harbor view”
Reviews.Author: smileycuteness
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled to get a harbor view room. We had comfy chairs that we could sit and watch the boats go by. Great location. Great hotel bar at the restaurant. Bed was very comfortable. I expected a little more specialness to the room and bathroom however being a Renaissance hotel so I was a little disappointed there. Seemed like any other Hilton, Marriot, ...

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Accomodating !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fisherman066
Reviews.Content: My eldery father & mom stayed here for two nights due to the proximity to Johns Hopkins Hospital where he was meant to have out -patient surgery. The ENTIRE staff went way beyond what was expected in terms of catering to his every need! The operations manager measured the height of the beds for him, the door men let me leave my car at the entrance to the hotel numerous times through out the day while I shuttled him in and out (which sometimes took 30 minutes or more), the front desk patiently went through all the previous days receipts when he thought there was a discrepancy on the bill (he was wrong). The conceirge floor (12) was beautifully equipped and the lounge offered food & drinks w/o the hassle of going out for meals. While I normally think of this property as an upscale business hotel it truley impressed me by the versatily & helpfulness of the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Professional, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: marydTexas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace for a business conference in July 2010. The conference was actually being held at the Marriott Waterfront, but I didn't book there in time and the Renaissance was the overflow. In comparison to colleagues' rooms at the Marriott, the Renaissance rooms were much more spacious, the furniture was more confortable, and the hotel amenities were better quality. Also, unfortunately for those at the Marriott, there was a big water main break and they had to evacuate the hotel completely for 2 days! So I lucked out by staying at the Renaissance. The staff worked hard to insure we were kept up-to-date with any news/changes about our conference schedule. Service was quick and professional, check-in and check-out were quick and easy. There are always delicious, refreshing naturally-flavored waters in the lobby, so if you have to wait in line a bit before checking in you can enjoy a cool drink. The hotel restaurant is decent quality, and the bar is modern yet comfortable. I would definitely stay at the Renaissance again if I travel back to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: melshin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated. It is attached to the Gallery and across from the harbor. Our room was quite comfortable and well suited for 2 adults and 2 children. Loved the Aveda amenities! Hotel staff were friendly. Breakfast at the Watertable restaurant was not so good. The hotess and wait staff were pleasant but the food (buffet) was below average.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, but they seemed a bit overwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: artistgonebad
Reviews.Content: Maybe I stayed at a bad time. I checked in around 2:00pm on a Sunday and was told that my room was still occupied, but that they hoped to have me into a room by the evening. This wasn't a great start to things. The hotel was packed from a few events over the weekend so I wasn't surprised when I was told the room was still full. My conference was starting and so I headed of to it for a few hours and didn't pay the room issue much mind. I returned around 5:00 to find that a room still wasn't available but was told that they thought that housekeeping was celaning one and that it should be ready shortly. I managed to do a little work in the conference area for another hour or so and finally I had a room. The first thing I noticed was that there wasn't a coffee machine in the room. Heck, even the little coffee shops in the hotel and adjacent mall were not open. I was settled in around 7:00 or so and as it was now raining I decided to order a sandwich and cup of coffee from room service rather than going for a walk. The person who answered the room service line gave me a long sigh and told me that room service was going to be **at least** 1:45 minutes for a coffee and sandwich. I wasn't going to eat at 9:00 so I had a granolla bar and called it a night. A little after 6:00 the next morning I was hungry and really in need of a cup of coffee. Room service supposedly starts at 6:00 however when I called none bothered to pick up. I called a few more times for a few more minutes and still none would answer. I went downstairs hoping to find some coffee somewhere but 6:00 am is apparently too early in this part of the world. Finally one of the staff asked if he could help with anything and I asked if coffee was available anywhere in this hotel. He asked me to wait there and a few minutes later he returned with a fresh cup; just like that, the stay improved. I gave a good tip (as deserved!), but I regret that I didn't get his name to pass along to the management. Back in the hotel on Monday night I was able to more fairly assess the hotel as I was not anxious about a room, had found a coffee shop down the street, and even room service came through. The room was clean, the bed comfortable, the desk and work area were nice, and there were a ton of channels available on the TV. The little bar on the ground floor was a nice place to grab a beer that evening and watch some football on Monday night. Overall I have to blame my experience of Sunday night/Monday morning on what I guess was a booked-solid weekend at the hotel. Once things settled down on Monday night it operated as normal and efficiently as most other hotels I've stayed at. It's clean, modern (not in a funky way, but in a new facility way), and some of the staff are really good people. I wouldn't avoid it the next time I'm down there but I wouldn't say this was any better than a host of other hotels around the harbor (I've stayed at a few of them).

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable and proffesional”
Reviews.Author: rosgo
Reviews.Content: Staff always address you by name. Rooms that overlook the harbor have a very pleasant view although you do pick up street noise. Inside rooms much quieter by no view. The staff is EXTREMELY accommodating. So much so that I could think I am at Mom's House. Close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “As always, a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: emstraveler349
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business this time, but personal other times. It is a pricy hotel but well worth it. Its within a 1 minute walk of the Inner Harbor and in the height of bustling Baltimore. The hotel is safe, staff is friendly and assistive and it has a mall attached to it with common and nice stores and a couple of small eateries. The restaurant and bar is ok to go to, little pricy menu. Great for conference and personal stays. It has suites which may be beneficial if you have a large group where you can fit a view and split the cost. Hotel room is clean and roomy and up to date, not a complaint to be had.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff is Friendliest Around”
Reviews.Author: susan624
Reviews.Content: Everyone from the doormen, valet, front desk attendants, room service, workers riding in the elevator and maids were the friendliest group of people I have seen in a while. They made our stay very comfortable. The location is ideal for all the restaurants in the inner harbor, the aquarium and camden yards. The $36.00 a day parking fee is a way too much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Harbor Location..expect noise”
Reviews.Author: QuickTripOct02
Reviews.Content: Great Harbor location right across from shopping and all the Harbor activities. Was convenient to everything. Room was comfortable and spacious. We left for the day and didn't realize that someone had been in our room to "turn the bed down". It would have been nice if they had told us so we wouldn't be shocked to see that the things we left out were moved. Went to the Orioles game (a good WALK). Apparently there is a city bus next door but 2 police officers and others couldn't tell me where to catch the bus or where it would take us. We walked about 5-6 blocks to Camden Yards...a good walk! We were on the 12th floor which was nice, but our view of the a/c units and the building and city blocks leaved something to be desired. I really wasn't concerned at first since we were gone all day, but when we did arrive after walking back from the game, I realized that the windows or insulation didn't block out ANY noise. We heard sirens all night, heard and saw a fight outside our hotel, heard and saw a police office assisting with a wrecked vehicle. So we are in the city, I got it. However, at 12:30 am I heard a DRILL outside our door. Seems that the key didn't work 2 rooms down and maintenance was drilling to REMOVE the door. Poor guy that had his belongings inside the room. Restless night of sleep between the sirens and the drilling, even though the bed was quite comfortable (noise was the worst). Breakfast in the morning was expensive, but very nice. GREAT views overlooking the harbor. Would I come back? I will probably "hotwire" a 4-star next time. I figure it couldn't be any worse and it might be better!

Reviews.Title: “Very solid choice in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: AiredaleTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very solid choice. The location is perfect - right across from the Harbor, down the street from Little Italy and near everything else you would want to do in Baltimore. The staff is very friendly and helpful - especially the bell men and the concierge service. The conference area was recently updated and looks great. The catering was consistently good - even better than a Ritz where I recently attended another conference. My room was very clean, updated and well appointed. The bed was very comfortable - and, I had a nice angled view of the Aquarium and Harbor when I was in bed. The fitness center is good - could use a few more treadmills. Finally, the bar/restaurant on the 5th floor is very nice - updated with great service and 3 star food offerings. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to families and business travelers. You can't lose if you can get a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “Ok. So so service. Very much convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: nyeze
Reviews.Content: Short stay for business. Checked in 10pm, left 6am so didn't spend a lot of time at hotel. Service was so so -- at check in, the guy didn't say a word. No mention of what time the restaurant closed. How was you trip. Where are you coming from. Nutta. No biggie but a little warmth would have been nice. I always get a king sized room and when it's not available they usually let me know at the front desk. They give me a room that's feels like a mile away from the elevator -- ok so i checked in late and maybe those are the only rooms left, that's ok but having treked all the way i walk in to see two double beds. Point is no personal touches. Very much operates like a convention hotel for big groups. I like Marriott brands -- Ritz, JW, Marriott, Courtyard. Unfortunately never had an experience with Rennaisance that was up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: EinWI
Reviews.Content: Just got back from this hotel for business and it was a nice hotel, just across the street from the harbor and a lot of things to do it is also attached to a smaller mall with great shops for shopping! If I had to I would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Decent considering holiday weekend”
Reviews.Author: ContinentalBreakfast
Reviews.Content: Let me first start out by saying my fiance is a platinum member and we decided to use points for a last-minute quick getaway on Labor Day weekend....I don't think I would have paid the $300+/night otherwise considering the only time we spent in the hotel was to sleep for 7-8 hours a night. (We lucked out & had awesome weather & spent every minute we could outside.) I wasn't sure what to expect since we were using points, but upon check-in, we were given the club level floor on the 12th and since the lounge is not open on weekends, we were given vouchers for breakfast at the hotel for Saturday & Sunday mornings (up to $40 each day - enough for 2 buffets each day.....we would not have eaten there if not for the vouchers. Who needs $23 eggs??) We only ate there Saturday as Sunday morning there was a huge wait to get in & we didn't have the time. We walked right in though on Saturday and the food was delicious! Everything was clean in our room. It is a long walk to the elevators but it helps keep noise down. We heard nothing either night. There were several weddings there that Saturday night and they put one of the bridal parties up on the club level floor (12th flr)...we expected the worst and when we got back from our night out at 12:30 am, the noise was loud with an apparent after-party going on in several adjoining rooms. We were down another hall though & didn't hear them from our room but did feel sorry for any guests staying in closer proximity. I was a little leery about this hotel reading other reviews, but I took all the recommendations about parking & locking up valuables & followed them all & we had no trouble. There were a lot of police & security personnel around at all times - whether due to recent instances mentioned in other reviews or just the increased volume for a holiday weekend. There was even security that walked up & down the different floors - made me feel better. Any staff we encountered were very helpful. Overall - you can't beat the location.....we lucked out & had a nice, clean room, got upgraded for breakfast & had no parking issues so that made it an enjoyable stay. If I had to shell out the money though, I'd probably stay elsewhere for less - there are several other places (some Marriotts) still within decent walking distance to the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: SimonAtl
Reviews.Content: This is he first review I've ever written as this was probably the worst hotel stay I've ever had. The room was not cleaned properly (my breakfast from the first morning was still in the room three days later and the bed was not made on one day), there were exorbitant charges on my bill that I was not informed of at the time (parking of $72 per day) and the staff were so rude (one put the phone down on me and the other would not allow me to speak to the manager) that I almost moved out and went to stay somewhere else. Needless to say I will never stay at a Renaissance hotel again and I would warn everyone not to stay at this one ever.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ReviewableName
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Hotel is a large high end establishment right in the heart of the Inner Harbor. From a location perspective, you really can’t do any better than this hotel. The lobby, rooms and corridors were all lovely; the beds very comfortable. The staff was uniformly polite and professional. Food at the Watertable restaurant was a little too pricey for our taste, although the breakfast at The Ground Floor Cafe & Bar was not unreasonable and well prepared. There is a nice indoor heated pool which we found quite relaxing. Negatives for the establishment included a $24 per day parking fee and a $12.95 per day internet fee, if you wanted to go online. (Indeed after doing the math, I signed up for a smartphone with 3G internet access. I decided it was a better use of my money. If the Holiday Inn, Hampton Inn, Panera Bread, Starbucks, Wendy’s and McDonalds can provide free internet, you wonder why the management at Marriott cannot figure out how to do the same thing.) These annoyances were offset by a reasonable room rate obtained through my job. Despite my screed, this was a wonderful hotel and I would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves in this hotel- Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: vmeister40
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a regional meeting with my company. Upon returning to my room in the evening, all but a few items had been stolen from my room. I called security and they promised me that they will do a full investigation and get to the bottom of who entered my room and who stole my stuff. Well, Here we are a week later and the claims adjustor from Marriott/Renaissance just called me and said that they have no proof that their employees stole my items and the state statute says they have no liability for my items. She even had the gall to tell me that I should have put my items in the hotel safe. They stole my car keys, house keys, ID, credit cards backpack and clothes. Based on the morons that ran security at this hotel, its clearly an inside job. they have no surveillance cameras except in the common areas and the hotel is connected to a mall where anyone can wander in from. Stay away from this hotel. Criminals are in cahoots with the employees there and neither you or your stuff is safe in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Too pricey for what you get.....Stay at the Intercontinental”
Reviews.Author: OutAndAboutForFun
Reviews.Content: Way overpriced! Had to complain the first day because we found the sheets were never changed from the guests the day before. Front desk apologized but never attempted to make amends. Bar was nice but not much to choose for appetizers. Restaurant breakfast was awful. (Don't order the buffet!). After the second day stopped eating there and ate out. Amenities (shampoo, etc.) only replaced once in 5 days.. Probably the highest priced hotel on the harbor. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, Comfortable bed, Great View”
Reviews.Author: booklover52
Reviews.Content: We've stayed twice, both times in June, on weekends, to watch baseball at Camden yards. We purposely chose a hotel a walk away from the field so we could get in a bit of exercise. It wasn't so far away as to be daunting and it was close enough to be an enjoyable stroll, even in the heat. The location cannot be beat-- excellent restaurants are down the street (Capitol Grille), shopping mall just outside the hotel, and aquarium and harbour across the street. Each time we stayed the room was immaculate, spacious, and modern with comfortable bedding. I'd recommend spending the extra to have a a room looking over the harbour-- really magical to look out over the sailing boats. Quiet is important to us and our room on the 12th floor was just that. Even though we noticed many groups and families at breakfast and in the elevators, the noise didn't transfer inside our room. Our one dinner in the hotel was surprisingly delicious and the breakfasts were also good. The front desk is efficient and bell captains did a great job of tagging and storing our luggage on checkout day while we were at the game. We asked for a taxi one night to go to Little Italy and the bell captain had one lined up in less than two minutes. If you've checked out and have a later departure, the ground floor has many comfortable seating areas where you can relax between activities. Cons? After trying Shirley's during our first stay, we decided to forego the hour-long wait and go in-house to breakfast. The wait was just as long and the service was brusque; it was obvious our waitress was over-worked and over-loaded with tables. The front desk was efficient but not welcoming. Although we've experienced friendlier reception at other Baltimore hotels, the room amenities, location, and services at Renaissance Harbour makes it our favorite Baltimore lodging to date.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, lack of amenities, high price, and thanks for the screaming kids.”
Reviews.Author: md02geist
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel during the final weekend in July, with my friends. We had a room on the 7th floor with two queens. CHECKOUT / CHECK-IN / INITIAL IMPRESSION: The hotel seemed clean, and the staff seemed relatively knowledgeable. However, the person at the front desk took several minutes to see my name on the reservation that I had made, despite the fact that they were staring straight at it. There were multiple names on the reservation, and I was nearly told I could not check in until he finally noticed my name in big letters right on top of the reservation. Chalk that one up to being tired I suppose, I understand. Next I was informed that my debit/credit card would have an amount of 100.00 held on it for incidentals. I have never been to a hotel where this was done before -- always, there was a card on file for incidentals that would be charged as thing were taken. To automatically assume I'm going to drink 25 bottles of overpriced water over the weekend is insane. Whatever, I went with it. Needless to say, we did not use a thing, and yet my 100.00 has not been returned to my card yet. I'm still working on that (came home three days ago). Upon checkout, my card was AGAIN charged without being told until after it was charged for our parking. I had cash in my hand prepared to pay the guy, and he walked off and came back and said "Okay, we charged your card for xyz amount that you owed for parking." Fine, it's not like I couldn't afford it, but the obliviousness of the fact that I had 80.00 in hand cash and was trying to hand it to him directly was almost enough for me to want to scream. The staff is, to say the least, incredibly unhelpful and lacking any sort of politeness, tact, or apparently common sense. One night I was even carded the moment I walked in the door for my hotel key, as if they would deny me entry to my room if I wasn't currently holding one (I don't doubt for a second that they would have either). For the record I am not a teenager, I am not a suspicious looking person, and I was not drinking. So they had no possible stereotype / bias to even profile me on, as if my whole goal was to sneak into a Baltimore marriot at 2am? Please. VALUE: Prices were abhorrent here. -20 oz. sodas were nearly 3.00 at the in-hotel cafe located downstairs. -On-site parking in their garage is 26.00 per day, per vehicle, even for hotel guests. -Room rates started at about 300/night. The worst part was that for your nearly 300 a night, you don't get hardly anything. What you'll get is one king or two queens in a CONNECTED room (yes, this plays into the story later...). What else you get / don't get: -No available wi-fi or hardline internet in the rooms. You can pay 12.95 a day to recieve it in the conference / business center, but you will not be able to get that signal from the higher floors (I tried). Even the roach motel down the street from me has wi-fi...get real Marriott. Free wi-fi is only available in the "lounge" area, which is directly connected to the main entrance, elevato area, and check-in area. No walls to create any seclusion whatsoever, just a few tables and a few couches in the main lobby. -No mini fridge or ice bucket was provided. -The "beverages and ice" room actually only had ice in it...no beverages or even beverage machine to speak of. -An archaic iron and ironing board were present, but there was no microwave. -There are probably less than 25 channels on their TV (which to their credit is a large, relatively nice flat panel). -Walls and doors are paper thin, I could hear every single word people in adjoining rooms and in the hallway were saying, clearly as if they were in my hotel room. So say goodbye to privacy. -No continental breakfast is included. THE STAY: The beds were pretty comfortable and I slept very well, though the fact that I was utterly exhausted at the end of each day was probably helpful in that regard. Around 8am Saturday morning (we finally crashed around probably six hours prior) my brother and I were awoken by screams of children playing in the room next to us -- screaming to their parents "ONE TWO THREE FOUR TIME TO WAAAAKE UP" and then continually trying to open the door that connects the rooms. Thankfully after that morning they apparently checked out, as no more screaming children were heard. The fact that high dollar hotel rooms like this connect, particularly when we didn't request any sort of thing, is ridiculous to me. I shouldn't be able to hear screaming children, nor worry about them trying to open the door into my room at 8am. What if the door was unlocked? I can't blame the hotel for how other people's children act -- but I can sure blame them for the lack of noise control and access doors between rooms. OVERALL: I have stayed in high dollar, big name hotels. I have stayed in cruddy, bottom tier motels. I've stayed in everything in between. Thankfully, we are Silver (once gold) members and burned points to stay here -- because if I'd paid cash, I would be out nearly 1000 dollars plus parking to have had this awful experience. I was infuriated with how poorly this hotel was run and managed, how awful the customer service was, and how lacking in quality my room was for the level this hotel is SUPPOSED to be at. I would never ever recommend this hotel to someone, nor will I be staying there again. This was one of the worst hotel experiences I've ever had, and the only part that I'm happy about is that I didn't have to pay full price for it. I wouldn't be upset if this was a 100.00 a night place. However, this is a prime example of running a cheap cruddy hotel in a decent location and charging primo dollar for it. I've stayed at other hotels in the area and this one is FAR inferior to them.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: oothoonceleb
Reviews.Content: With a sleek and inviting first floor, the Renaissance hotel is a hub of activity while maintaining an intimate feel. The front desk staff offered great service and even allowed us to check in early morning after seeing our wary children. The room was clean and offered a beautiful view of the skyline. The hotel is conveniently located near all major attractions. While parking was a bit pricey, we were able to enter and exit the hotel on multiple occasions with one standard fee that allows parking for up to 30 hours. Bertha's was a quick drive, as well as Faidleys, and the aquarium is within walking distance. Hotel dining was not as extensive as we would have wished but the kids' breakfast meals offered a large quantity for a very small price (under $6.00). This hotel adequately met our expectations; if there were "magical touches" that would offer each guest a sense of the Renaissance trademark, this hotel would be a must visit in MD.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate Hotel with a great location !!”
Reviews.Author: TomMcMenamin
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend (7/24-7/26)down at the Inner Harbor and decided to stay at the Renaissance via a couple different friends suggestion. We arrived around noon time and although we were a few hours early for check in and the hotel seemingly at capacity due to a couple large conventions in town, we had NO problem whatsoever in checking in early. The two ladies at the front desk could not have been any nicer in accomodating us and asking us if we prefered two beds or one, Harbor view, city view, etc. and letting us know that both were available at that point in time. The bell hop ad the luggage in our rooms in a matter of minutes. We were on the 7th floor right around the corner from the elevator, so the complaints of too much walking due to the fact of their only being one area of the hotel with elevators was unfounded for us. We also heard zero noise due to the elevators either. Our room was immaculate and very modern. Very nice 42" LCD Hi Def Television that kept us abreast of out of town baseball scores. Nice fridge that kept all of our water cool. We both slept very well and found the beds to be extremely comfortable. We only ate at the hotel one morning and found the breakfast to be good, but a bit pricey. We both went with the breakfast buffet and I believe the cost without tip was $38. The biggest selling point of the hotel in my book is the location. Directly across from the Inner Harbor (literally 150 ft.) 4 blocks from Camden Yards, 4 blocks from Little Italy, A water taxi ride to Fells Point and the pickup point is directly across the street. I don't think you could find a more convenient "home base" for a stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible elevators”
Reviews.Author: jlcnova
Reviews.Content: Only one set of elevators for a huge hotel with a huge conference going on!!! One elevator blew up so they had to turn off air conditioning in all hallways !! Elevators looked like the tower of terror. Staff lied about elevator situation and ac!!!

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Area/Reception/Lobby Very Noisy & Housekeeping Oops”
Reviews.Author: justlucy123
Reviews.Content: The newly renovated front desk/reception area/lobby is beautiful. The service was great - we were offered cold drinks while waiting in line at registration. The only problem is the very loud music from the bar/restaurant down the hallway. It was so loud we could not conduct a conversation (business) with the receptionist. She had to repeat herself most of the time as we kept asking "What?" Too noisy. We finally got to our room and started checking it out. When we opened the shower curtain to check the bathtub, it was full of dirty linen/sheets from the previous occupants. I guess, housekeeping forgot to take the dirty laundry out. Our new towels are already neatly stacked on the bathroom counter. Other than the things mentioned above, we did enjoy our stay. This is not our first stay here. The room was beautifully furnished. The employees we met throughout the place were all very friendly and respectful.

Reviews.Title: “If location and luxury is what you're looking for, here it is.”
Reviews.Author: EarthRider
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff. Beautiful hotel without any "snootiness." The Harborview rooms are exceptional. Great breakfast buffet. Right in the heart of the Inner Harbor.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: juliejoyce
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Renaissance hotel while visiting for a Red Sox game. This hotel is in prime location for everything! We walked to the water taxi in the morning, explored the city, had lunch and then walked over to Camden yards in the afternoon. The rooms were large, clean and very modern and the staff was informative and helpful. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant and would probably skip that next time - it was quite pricey and it wasn't that great. I would instead opt for Miss Shirley's down the street - which was FABULOUS! The only thing they could improve on would be to offer free parking and possibly to turn up the AC a bit (this seemed to be a Baltimore thing though as none of the restaurants or stores we went into really cranked the AC either). Neither would deter me from staying here though. I will definitely be back to Baltimore and would not even consider staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Staff very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: PR_Travel_Diva
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay while at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel for the US Navy Symposium. I found all of the staff very helpful and courteous. The rooms were nice for the money. Large flat panel TV, nice toiletries and a comfortable bed. The location was convenient for dining and shopping. The water taxi to go to different parts of Baltimore is right across the street. Like all big cities, there are bums and transients, most of whom are harmless. I did notice a good police presence in the area, since it is a tourist spot.

Reviews.Title: “A+ hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tatertot73
Reviews.Content: We have a great stay at the Renaissance Harborplace in Baltimore for Mother's Day weekend. We travelled with 2 toddlers and the rooms were large enough to open 2 pack-n-play cribs with room to spare. The staff was great, always available and very polite. Rooms were clean and the rates are reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: blr5004
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a last minute trip to the Inner Harbor and got this hotel through Expedia. The location was great, literally right across the street from the inner harbor and connected to a mall. We walked to Little Italy for dinner. The walk was about ten minutes and it was very safe. Speaking of safe, the hotel had two police officers standing by the doors after 9pm. The room was spacious with newer furniture and flat screen tv. The king bed was comfortable although the pillows could have been better. Our room did not have any special view but we were ok with that. Unlike many other reviews, I did not have a problem with other guests’ noise (maybe we were lucky?). It is true there is only one location for elevators so you might need to walk a little if you are on the side opposite from them. We used the indoor pool and hot tub once. The pool was filled with screaming kids but we were not too bothered by them. There was a lifeguard, but she wasn’t really paying attention to the kids jumping and diving even though it clearly said not to. We also liked the patio area outside of the pool. Nice to sit outside and relax. Like others, I agree that parking was a little high but I guess that is the price you pay for being so close to the inner harbor. We did not eat at the hotel’s restaurant but did go look at it, it looked nice. The hotel staff was friendly and even brought my boyfriend Band-Aids when his shoes were causing blisters within a few minutes. Overall, I would stay here again but only if we got a good deal. I am someone who would walk an extra 5-10 minutes to save some money. On a sidenote- if you are planning to go to the inner harbor and are thinking about going out at nightime be aware that things close early. By midnight on a Saturday the restaurants and bars (even ESPN Zone) were closed. However, it is still nice to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Best Renaissance I've Stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Dharmabum87
Reviews.Content: Not that I have stayed a a ton of them. When Renaissance was independent they were spotty. Since Marriot took them over, the consistency seems to have improved tremendously. This place rivals any Westin or Park Hyatt. All the rooms seem recently renovated. Mine had new furniture and a flat screen tv, and fridge. The rooms are spacious. The beds are really comfortable with great linens. Really no complaints regarding the room. The bell staff is also great. Incredibly accomodating and helpful. I asked if there was a good chinese place nearby and the guy basically walked me there (it was just across the street but he wanted to make sure I crossed in the right spot because folks had been hit crossing that street). My only complaints were: 1) the walk from the room to elevator is like half a block at least, and 2) they wouldn't even consider giving me a late check-out (even as a Marriot rewards member). Also, I was traveling on business so was less sensitive to this, but the place is really expensive for Baltimore. It's probably not the best value in town. But I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service over New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: dnumgis02
Reviews.Content: During our trip to Los Angeles the other day, my girlfriend asked me which hotel I've enjoyed the most this past year. Without hesitation I said the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel in Baltimore and she immediately agreed. The front desk concierge was extremely helpful from helping us check-in due to such a busy night (New Year's Eve) to additional amenities. Due to my Marriott Platinum status we were upgraded to a splendid concierge level room overlooking the harbor. The wine and cheese Platinum arrival gift was superb. All in all a perfect stay during such a hectic time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: klee723
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an awesome location right on the Inner Harbor and if your lucky enough to get a view of the Harbor, you wont be disappointed. The rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated. The bed was so comfortable that we overslept by two hours one morning. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There are lots of restaurants and nightlife in walking distance and there is even a mall connected to the hotel. We will definitely be staying at this hotel in or future trips to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE GUESTS - no help from the hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: KQS
Reviews.Content: Recommendation: Put all Wedding guests on one floor AWAY from all other guests!!! We were in for a quick trip - great place, clean, comfy, awesome views (which we paid EXTRA for)...Went to bed, woken up by yelling, banging on doors, laughing, etc...not once....over 6 times. We called the front desk - THEY DID NOTHING! They knew who the people were, did nothing. We literally got up, threw our stuff in our suitcase and high-tailed it out of there - will look to stay in a different hotel next visit...not happy! Oh - and PAY for internet. We stayed at the Courtyard and it was FREE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Safety concerns”
Reviews.Author: MFasano
Reviews.Content: On the first night some sort of loud fight erupted outside our romm at 3 AM. The second night we were accosted by an aggressive panhandler while in the lobby bar. We reported to hotel security, They were entirely unsympathetic and treated us poorly. The wireless internet, which cost $13 a day, worked for about 50% of the day. Staff was unconcerned when it was reported to them. The lobby is loud and uncomfortable. Speakers blare unpleasant music at all hours making reading or converstion very difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - middle of the road hotel”
Reviews.Author: Weary Travellery
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Harborplace Hotel is ideally situated if you are planning a lot of activities in the downtown Baltimore area - it is right across the street from the Inner Harbor area with its loads of shops and attractions, and within walking distance of many other nearby attractions. That said, it makes pretentions of being a 5-star hotel, but only a total fool would pay the 5-star price for this place. The front desk staff is very good, check-in and check-out were painless and quick. The undergound garage rate is one notch below extortion, yes, and you are well advised to lock anything you want to keep in the trunk - this IS a big city and the criminals DO know where the tourists and all their toys hang out.
