The rooms are adequate as far as size goes. Furnishings are generally up to date, the bed was comfortable (if anything, they go overboard on the pillows), and the expected extras are in the bathroom. Big minuses are a hefty $12.95 per day charge for internet access, no exhaust fan in the bathroom and rather dim lighting in the mirror there, and a paucity of free channels on the flat screen TV. A smaller minus was the coffee maker, that was cleverly hidden behind the ice bucket in the cabinet under the TV. The biggest downsides are room location and noise - there is only ONE bank of elevators for the entire hotel, so long waits can be common, and since the hotel is laid out in a hollow square, be prepared for a lengthy hike if you room is in a far corner. Of greater concern for many might be the noise. The walls are thin, and you will hear almost every conversation and TV program of your neighbors; the corridors also carry sound quite well and loud, late night groups can wake up an entire floor as they make the long trek to their room. Contrary to some reviews, I did not find the fifth floor restaurant horribly overpriced, but then I wasn't trying to feed a family. There is a huge variety of restaurants within walking distance, but the view from the Harbor Place restaurant can't be beat. I can't say the same for the ground floor coffee shop, it always seemed either overcrowded, understaffed, or both. Although the lobby is nicely appointed and furnished, very loud background music makes it almost impossible to have a normal conversation (maybe that was intentional?) All in all, I stayed there because I had to. Would I stay there if I had the choice? Only if I got an exceptionally good price on the room, to cancel out the exorbitant parking price and lack of free internet.

Reviews.Title: “superb last minute getaway for spring break”
Reviews.Author: terri9160
Reviews.Content: We booked our two nights through priceline and were thrilled with our room and the service at the hotel. We were able to check in early and were treated as if we payed full price for the room. We used the pool each night, the room was spotless, room service was quick and the food was very good. The location of this hotel is amazing. Right across the street from the harbor and only two blocks from Port Discovery. We will certainly book this hotel in the future. We were VERY happy with our last minute trip!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience rectified”
Reviews.Author: HRPM
Reviews.Content: I am happy to report that after contacting Marriott corporate, who in turn contacted the management at the hotel, our situation received satisfactory resolve. We were given a free night (points added to our rewards account to equal room we had stayed in) and were told the staff has received training and will continue to, in order to not have our situation happen to another guest.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible business center overwhelmed the positives”
Reviews.Author: LotsaTraveling
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a number of positives and I had enjoyed my stay there on prior trips. I have to travel to Baltimore frequently and have often chosen this hotel before. But based on my most recent experience, I will not be staying here again. On this occasion, I chose this hotel only after verifying that it had a business center with computer access, as I knew I needed to submit information by the morning of my departure and I didn't have my laptop with me. The desk clerks told me when I called that the business center had free computers and that it was open 24/7, so I was surprised when I discovered that the computers charged 49 cents a minute for general internet access. Since I arrived at the hotel after midnight and was already in an exhausted state, I'd planned to spend about 20 minutes to submit my information online and then get some needed rest. Unfortunately, the state of the computers in the business center made this impossible. Although there were 3 computers, each was very slow, sometimes taking several minutes to refresh a page (all the while charging 49 cents a minute). On several occasions, in the middle of entering my information, the computer rebooted itself spontaneously. This meant that I had to rescan my credit card and re-enter all of my information. The help desk staff for Showcase (the company that was in charge of the computers) were unable to assist and claimed that the computers were working OK. The front desk at the Renaissance tried to be helpful and sent up their engineer very promptly, but he was unable to do anything as the computers were controlled by and owned by Showcase. By 5 AM, after spending hours trying to get my information entered, I decided that it was a losing battle and that I was better off taking a late penalty and get a few hours of sleep rather than continuing to struggle with the business center computers. [I should also note that I had to spend another 20-30 minutes on the phone the next day with my credit card company who was convinced that Showcase was submitting fraudulent charges on my credit card. In addition, I spoke again today to the Showcase representatives about the fact that my credit card ended up being billed for all of the charges even though the initial help desk person said that 5 of the 6 distinct charges would be dropped.] Based on this experience, I would recommend steering clear of any hotel business center that uses ShowCase services. In other respects, my hotel experience was mixed. The desk clerk staff were very friendly and welcoming as well as trying to be helpful. I was given a room that was a very far distance from the elevators, as is true of many of the rooms at this hotel. So anyone with difficulty walking should specifically request a room that is near the elevator. The hallways and room smelled a bit musty but this was subtle. The room was otherwise nice and the bed was quite comfortable. The hotel location is an excellent one, right across from Harborplace and close to excellent dining choices. I had no trouble with parking though it is expensive as others have noted. In sum, there are many options for lodging in Baltimore in the vicinity of the Inner Harbor and, although I've liked this hotel in the past and it has a number of positives, I was totally alienated by my experience with their business center and will be staying elsewhere in the future.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay..”
Reviews.Author: Trinity524
Reviews.Content: I loved it. My father and I stayed in this hotel before taking a cruise out of Baltimore. Very comfortable and great location. Service was lacking in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Don9992
Reviews.Content: We spent President's Day Weekend at this hotel after booking it on Priceline for $65. The room was large and the bed was very comfortable. My wife wasn't fond of the decor. As was mentioned earlier, there is a rather puzzling lack of drawer space in the rooms but that didn't bother us on our short visit. We had two real complaint about the room itself: - The level of noise from the hallway was unacceptable. The sound seems to resonate through the long hallways. - The chairs were not especially comfortable, although we're, perhaps, spoiled by our La-Z-Boy chairs at home. One strong suggestion we will make is that one should ask for a room near the elevator. This is a very large property with only one set and a traveler could wind up with a considerable walk to his room. Naturally, the main selling point is the location. A bridge of Pratt Street connects the hotel to the Harborplace shopping and eating facility. As was mentioned in another review, the Watertable Restaurant in the hotel is quite expensive and, with alternatives like Phillip's within easy walking distance, there's really no reason to pay their prices.

Reviews.Title: “Our first Anniversary at the Harborplace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: turndowntone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our first Anniversary and it was also Valentine's Day and President's Day weekend. We booked through Priceline and got a rate that was better than most Motel 6's so we were already excited by that. We arrived at the hotel around 4pm (check in time) and were greeted by a valet who instructed where to go to park the car (we decided to self park because it is $10 a night cheaper). It took us about 15 minutes to find a decent spot so be prepared for that. We made our way to the front desk to check in and were helped by Danny. I asked Danny if he could move our room to a harbor view room and when checking he said they didn't seem to have anything available. I explained to him that is was our anniversary and I would really like to make this stay a special one. He then proceeded to check again and was able to fit us in a partial harbor view room that looked directly at the WTC and Hard Rock cafe. I was pleased with this and while we waited for the door keys a gentleman brought my wife and I some hot chocolate. There are four elevators for the hotel and we were a short walk around the bend to our room. I will say that I never felt like I waited too long for an elevator. Because we had chosen the harbor view room we had to take 2 double beds which was fine for reasons I won't discuss here ;) but the room was very clean and the decor was nice and modern. TV was HD flat screen and included HBO and HDnet as well as basic programming. The bathroom was decent enough with the shower having plenty of water pressure. The beds were comfortable enough if not a bit too firm. There is a mini fridge in the room which housed a 12 pack of Orange Crush easily but probably couldn't accomodate much more. This hotel is literally connected to a 4 story mall! Something we didn't realize until the first morning we woke up and were looking for something to eat. You can walk from the lobby through a door and boom you are in the mall.. Pretty cool I must say, although I think it accounts for why it took so long to find a parking spot as the hotel and mall share the space. We were checked on by the housekeeping lady during the day and were given fresh towels. Later that night I approached the front desk after returning from Power Plant Live and asked Danny about late check-out. He and another employee were in a conversation before I came up to them and they jokingly said it would cost me $100 bucks! After a few laughs he went ahead and allowed us 2pm check out. Great job Danny! I was sure to fill out a comment card for him and drop it in the comment box. After all, good service deserves to be recognized. We checked out around 1:30 the next day and that was a breeze as we only owed for the parking. The $100 for incidentals that was held initaly dropped off my credit card the next day (it took 2 weeks almost at the Sheraton in Philly!) and I was wished well and asked to return soon. Overall my wife and I were happy with our stay and would do it again, especially at the price we received. We didn't feel treated any differently because we booked Priceline or any of that jazz. While it wasn't all that different than my stay at the Sheraton I will say that the location is beyond great and the mall connection is very cool. We will return to see some of things we missed during our short stay!

Reviews.Title: “View second to none, but you pay for it.”
Reviews.Author: Bmikel13
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to save money this is not the place for you. If you would like a spectacular view of the harbor do not look any further. There are the minuses (paying for parking, the $15 bottles of water in the room, etc.) but if you can get a harbor view room you will not regret it. The rooms are not spectacular themselves but they are well kept and clean. The hotel is huge and be prepared for a walk if your room is not near an elevator door.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing worked.”
Reviews.Author: lovelyrita52
Reviews.Content: I also enjoy all Marriott brand hotels, stay often and am often pleased. I stayed at this hotel recently. Yes, it is in a great location. But soon after entering our room, we found out our TV didn't work. It wouldn't even turn on. We dismissed that because we weren't there to watch TV. When we came back late in the evening and tried to call the front desk, there was a deafening beeping in the phone that even the front desk agent commented on. On top of all this, I didn't sleep at all because every 5 minutes there was a loud bang in the heater which at first I thought someone was breaking in our room! I relayed this information to two front desk agents in the morning, that the TV, phone and heater didn't work. There demeanor was sympathetic but not accomodating. I received a 'sorry' and still had to pay the $200 for...nothing.

Reviews.Title: “SRA Annual Meeting”
Reviews.Author: josespike
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore for the annual Society for Risk Analysis meeting which was held at the Hotel. The room was great. It had a very large flat screen tv and many high definition channels. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room was quite and nicely decorated. I had an issue with the bathtub draining properly but someone fixed it before I even asked. Location was perfect right across from inner harbor and the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: MattyBsouL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here last year during Thanksgiving weekend and decided to do so again this year. We were pleasantly surprised that they kindly let us check in at noon since we were already in the area. Our room was very spacious, clean & quiet. We love the close location to the Gallery Mall and many other restaraunts and shops that are so close by. Since this hotel is right in the middle of the action, the lobby/elevator area can get pretty loud at times, especially when kids' football leagues are staying there! However, none of this mattered when we were in our room, and the hotel was well prepared for the crowds. The parking garage takes a little while to figure out, and like every other garage near the harbor, parking is expensive. It is also a very good idea to take all GPS units, iPods, etc out of the car when you leave as they are "hot" in this city and the reason for most car break-ins. Once again, we highly enjoyed our stay and appreciated a very friendly and helpful front desk staff to get us checked in and out so smoothly. - Matt

Reviews.Title: “parking”
Reviews.Author: Lana_Phila
Reviews.Content: We left or car in the garage next to the hotel's parking lot - this is a few levels garage . We paid $19 per day (the price switched to the next day at 4 am). Also, if you go to a Baltimore aquarium, you can print a Parking Certificate (Baltimore Aquarium website) and exchange it on the $3 discount ticket at the Information desk which is located on the 2nd floor of the Aquarium. I forgot to bring the certificate so that they gave me the discount ticket without the printer Parking Certificate. That garage is cheaper and it is right next to the Hotel's garage. Hotel: The room was large and the accommodations pleasant. Nothing outstanding. It was clean. The water pressure was only adequate. The location was ideal in proximity to the Aquarium, etc. Pool: there was a football team which occupied the pool from lunch time up to the end of the day. these kids were 10-11 year old but they were even in the whirl pool... we checked the pool few times, hoped that they had some schedule and would go to sleep at 9pm... but nope... they stayed until the pool closed. Also, the pool ran out of towels. i believe that the hotel has 4* only because of location. 3* would be more applicable. I booked the hotel thou Priceline website (name your price) for $77 (about $100 with taxes)

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of yours gps or radars at this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Papichulo69
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the weekend and left the car at the valet parking( charge me $38 a day for parking) Someone stole my GPS and the hotel is not responsable if somebody break in my car but yes the hotel is responsable for charging the money paid about $76 for parking( this is ridiculos) SOmeone at the hotel submit a claim but I never heard back from them and it has been over 2 weeks already. The strange part was noone broke any windows. it was somebody that works at the hotel or the guys at the hotel left the car unlocked. the only good thing abou this hotel is the location otherwise is not a 4 star hotel and everything at the hotel is pricey and the service is not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, Great Beds!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel1506
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace with a group of my friends. We all decided we wanted a hotel with a great location, centrally located. It would be easy for us to take our kids and be able to be in walking distance of what we wanted to do. You can't beat the location, we had a harborview room and all our rooms overlooked harbor. What an amazing view, we never wanted to close our curtains. It served its purpose, we couldn't have been any closer, just a short walk to aquarium and port discovery. I had no problem with my room it was very clean but my girlfriend had a little issue with the cleanliness of her room. Beds are incredible, that was the best night sleep I had in a long time. The kids loved the indoor pool and it kept them busy for a bit.The attached mall is also a great convenience. I am a Marriott Rewards member and stay at Marriotts all the time. We chose this hotel due to location, I don't know if I would make the same choice again. As much as I liked the view, it is a bit pricey for those traveling with children. It depends on what you are there for, the breakfast included in other Marriott chains makes it easier if you plan on being at the local attractions all day with children. A trip to the Renaissance with my husband would probably more appropiate. All in all, I had a great time during my Baltimore trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, great rooms, service?”
Reviews.Author: marian13
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Friday evening for a conference and went immediately to the front desk. BTW, a taxi from BWI was approx. $36 and on the way back -- flat rate of $30. Patrice was working the front desk and upon check in, we provided her with our Marriott Gold Card and identification. The gold card seemed useless to her because we were given a room on a lower floor and she even seemed to question our harbor view room (as if it were a mistake?). As a business traveler, my husband enjoys the perks he gets especially with Marriott. This was a new upgrade in status for him and he should have received an upgraded room with access to the club/concierge lounge (free continental breakfast in the morning) and late check out. None of those things were afforded to us on this trip. That aside, the hotel is perfectly situated and the room itself was fantastic! Loved the large flat screen TV, huge closet, and the bed was one of the best I have ever slept in. Never heard housekeeping in the morning and when we ran out to use the fitness center, the room was cleaned up on our return. Housekeeping was moving like lightning down the halls and doing a spectacular job, not something I see a lot of these days. The bathroom is a little outdated and could use a facelift. The tub has a shower curtain and the tiles are somewhat dated. It was strange to step UP to get into the tub and I still don't know how my 6' tall showered. There is a hairdryer available, which is put in a wire basket on the bathroom countertop. It takes up space and is just ugly to look at. The fitness center was the highlight of this hotel. Large with more treadmills than one would normally see and they were clean and modern! There were also a few elliptical machines and stationary bikes as well as weights. Towels and water were available and disposable cups were made from vegetables -- talk about green! Best of all, if you happen to forget your headphones, they have free ones for you to take. They are individually wrapped and available by the towels. A nice touch for business travelers. Each treadmill had its own television and although there were a lot of people in the gym, it never felt packed and never smelled or felt stuffy. I wish other hotels could take notice and do their fitness centers like this one. Restaurants: When we arrived on Friday, my husband checked in for his conference on the fifth floor and on this floor the hotel's restaurant, Watertable, is located. We did consider going here for dinner, but after reading the reviews on Urbanspoon.com -- we decided to pass. The fifth floor of the hotel is actually connected to the adjoining mall, but there aren't any restaurants other than Sbarro, McDonald's, Starbucks, and I think Manchu Wok. Across the street were a few more options and since we were tired and didn't know the area, this worked for us. In this building is Cheesecake Factory, Pizzeria Uno's, and an Irish pub - Tir Na Nog. In the daylight we discovered far more in the area to do and places to go eat, so please don't limit yourself to the overpriced hotel choices. A short walk in either direction can take you to some great places, including Little Italy. Checking out on Sunday, I called down and asked for a late checkout and was told I could check out at 1 pm, standard response. I waited in the lobby for my husband to finish up and noticed a few burned out bulbs and The Ground Floor Cafe & Bar was understaffed and unimpressive. They have great furniture in the lobby including large tables where you can sit and work if you have to wait. A big turn off was the people who chose to sit on the couches, take off their shoes, and place their feet up on the sofa as if they were at home. C'mon people -- this isn't your home! Overall, the location was the biggest selling point of this hotel and I might stay again in the future because my expectations would be lowered. Not the worst place I have ever stayed at, but certainly not the best. I think if we would have gotten our benefits for being Gold Members, I might have felt differently.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: ranjet
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline. Arrived for check-in at 2pm, asking about harbor side room. The front desk cheerfully offered one, but it was not ready just yet, so opted for a courtyard room. Not much to look at, and luckily it was close to the elevator. I can see some people complaining about the walk, as the hotel is huge. Room was very spacious, and clean. Ipod docking station, and pull out clothsline in shower were great to have. Large 42 in LCD TV. Housekeeping responded promptly to a request. Beware, they start knocking on doors at 8 am, so even if your do not disturb card is out, you will still hear the banging next door.Pool was fine, not as cold as other "heated " pools usually are. Hot tub had a hand written Out Of Order sign, but I think the lifeguard just put it up since there were alot of kids around. Another guest told me it was working the day before. The floor by the pool is very slippery, and 2 kids fell pretty hard, so be aware. Great fitness center. Plenty of modern machines, and free weights. The location can't be beat, with the inner harbor across the street. Science Museum, Aquarium, Littly Italy all a short walk away. Parking was $26 with in/out privliges, standard for the area. I would definately stay here again, even at the rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “OK. could of been Better”
Reviews.Author: njsurferx
Reviews.Content: Beautiful entrance, until we were sent to a two queen bed when we requested a King. There was this kicking sound in the ventilation system that kept waking us up during the night we got a free breakfast for that which was nice aleast of them. BE CAREFUL they will charge you if you open up the waterbottle which stands right next to the TV. Its 4.00 dollars if you open it. Its a smart snatch. The refrigriator was empty, had to pay for wifi, free wifi in the lobby, but did not work in my laptop was not connecting. Overall I was not to happy with the hotel but still had a good time, everything like the aquarium and science center and mall are all walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in great location but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: drichrx
Reviews.Content: As a Marriott Gold Rewards member, I have stayed at a lot of Renaissance Hotels and love them. This hotel is certainly met my expectations as a hotel and is in a great location (middle of Harborplace) as well. The staff (front desk, club room, restaurant, bell hops) were excellent - were some of the best I have encountered. The room was clean and ample in space. The bed was excellent. The room however, lacked drawer space and the furniture was bulky and unusable.. The club lounge was great for the evening reception but poor for breakfast (no hot entrees) and the business center in the club lounge was poorly stocked (no ink in printer cartridge, no scissors, etc.). Nonetheless, I found my stay enjoyable and highly recommend this hotel.. .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: carriewly
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very big rooms, excellent location right on the harbor. Very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A good deal through Priceline.”
Reviews.Author: inspiredmama
Reviews.Content: First trip to Baltimore. Needed a place to stay close to 1st Mariner Arena as I was there for a concert. Did a lot of research and decided to try Priceline. Got a great deal of $70 per night for Fri/Sat stay. At that rate, the Renaissance Harborplace is perfect, but there is NO WAY I would pay $199/night(which was the going rate through Marriott.com for my dates) As a matter of fact, I wouldn't pay over $100 a night. The location can't be beat. Connected to the Harborplace Mall(which was a bad thing in my case...lol) across the street from plenty of eateries and attractions. I took the light rail from BWI to the Convention Center stop. The hotel is within walking distance from this stop, but I took a cab for $4 bucks since it was raining. One thing I was afraid of booking through Priceline, was that I would be treated differently, which I was. My only request was for a King size bed. I was not concerned with location, floor level, view, etc. I was given a room with two doubles, and on a Friday early afternoon was told there was not one King size bed in the entire hotel. I knew that was flat out just a lie. But at $70 bucks for a $199 room I didn't care about it too much. The cleanliness of the hotel overall is very good, however the room itself was not would I would call 4 star. The walls are very thin. We could hear everything going on outside the halls and in the rooms If you like Sushi, I highly recommend Endo Sushi across the street. EXCELLENT service, Sushi and Sake! :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very convenient for business or personal”
Reviews.Author: AnBrPe
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Baltimore Harborplace Hotel could not be in a better location for business or personal travel. Inner Harbor is right across the street and the boat shuttle to Fell's Point is a two-minute walk from the hotel. There is a mall attached to the hotel--not the greatest shopping but it is quite convenient if you forget something for have an hour to kill. The rooms seem to be newly renovated, everything was attractive, clean and modern. The conference rooms were very nice. All in all, a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: TXRangers
Reviews.Content: Beautifully redecorated since we were last there a year ago in hip art deco. Service requests were responded to immediately. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average room.”
Reviews.Author: TSUAGD
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel for $75 on Priceline. We well worth the price, but, I would have been disappointed if I had paid the average price, which is about $200 a night. No big complaints, but it was a very average property. The pros: Can't beat the location- adjacent to the Galleria Mall, directly across from Harbor Place. Hotel staff friendly and welcoming, pleasant lobby and bar with coffee shop. Hotel shop has amenities you might need. Room was clean and had very comfy beds, nice TV, in room coffee and a small fridge. Reading lights attached to the beds are a nice tough. The cons: The hotel is huge, and you can potentially have a LONG walk to your room. Not an issue for us, but for those with mobility issues ask for a room close to the elevator. The room was absolutely clean, but a bit too standard for a "luxury" hotel. $12.95 internet access fee- highest I've seen in a long time and I travel a lot! Thin walls- easy to hear those in the hall. Bring your earplugs. Just a picky thing, but the Marriott Website amenities listed bathrobes and jetted tubs but our room didn't have that. I think this hotel has "Priceline" rooms- ones that are not up the rest of the hotel standard. Again, I left feeling like we got a great deal for the price, but, would have been disappointed if we'd paid the average rate. If you do pay a standard rate, make sure you ask for a room with the amenities you want (view, etc.) there was nothing special that stood out to make me want to come there again.

Reviews.Title: “Robbed in the hotel garage-Security major issue-Looks like it happens often”
Reviews.Author: Geri0
Reviews.Content: Hotel was fine until we left for breakfast and came back to our car that was parked in the hotel parking lot was broken into. Someone must have been watching us because it was a targeted theft of a laptop bag. Nothing else was stolen including our suitcases and other expensive items. Security is terrible and like another reviewer said they will not take any responsibility for your belongings in their garage. Our car was alarmed and had darkly tinted windows. Glass was leading to the hotel elevator. Then they told us that if we had used their valet parking they would have had some responsibility. Turns out that is not true either. Find a different hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and nice views”
Reviews.Author: Outinthemiddaysun
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting. Excellent location right opposite the waterfront and a very comfortable hotel (we also went into the Marriott Waterfront, and we all liked the atmosphere, decor and poistion of the Renaissance better). Plenty of shops and restaurants both within the next door gallery, and over the road on the harbourfront. It is a big hotel, with lots of business meetings and congresses going on, and I suspect it could be a bit impersonal if you were there on vacation. Check-in was fast and efficient. Lifts were fast and large. Rooms are arranged in a huge square, and I had to walk for ages to get to mine - it was fine, but just meant that I had to allow an extra 5-10 mins to get anywhere. If you have limited mobility, you'd be well advised to let them know in advance, so that you can get a room nearer the lifts. Rooms were HUGE - big lobby area with wardrobes, marble dressing stand and general suitcase dumping ground. The wardrobe had an iron and board too, very useful. Not quite enough hangars though (only 6 for a double room), had to phone and ask for extras. The bathroom was off this lobby, and was a standard hotel size, with marble countertop, underslung sink etc. The bath was good and the shower was excellent. Plenty of fluffy towels. No robes or slippers though, even though I asked twice - I'd normally expect these in this class of hotel. However, with so many rooms, the maids take forever to get round them all, and my room was not cleaned until after 3pm each day which was a bit irritating. Then the main room, which was also of a really good size. The bed seemed quite high off the floor, but was extremely comfortable, although 12 pillows seemed slightly over the top. There was a fridge (no minibar), TV, and a good sized desk with internet connection. However, I had to phone technical support to get the internet to work - apparently the wireless had gone down and no-one else had bothered to report it. Odd. The $12.95 cost for 24 hours was reasonable, and once paid for, the wireless connection could be used anywhere in the hotel, so that was quite good. There were plenty of electrical sockets, although it took me a while to work out that they were incorporated into the lamp bases, rather than on the walls. The rooms were pretty quiet for such a large hotel although there was a little bit of traffic noise and the air con was not the quietest. No breakfast included with the room, although there is a Starbucks in the lobby that sells cereals and muffins. We elected to walk to Miss Shirley's, about 2 blocks along on the left - huge pancake and waffle menu, an excellent recommendation by the concierge. We also ate dinner out. However, we had lunch on the fifth floor during our meeting, and everything was of a good standard with a reasonable amount of choice. The meeting rooms were well set up, and the staff here was extremely helpful in organising room layout, catering, electrics, projector etc. The business center was OK, but the cartridge in the printer had run out, so we either had to go down to reception to get things printed, or get a card to let us into the 10th floor where there was an executive suite with another printer. Despite promising to fix the printer on the fifth floor, it didn't happen in the 3 days we were there. The pool was lovely, and the fitness center was apparently also well set up (so my collegaues told me). There are also ice machines and laundry areas on each floor, which was extremely useful. Overall, I liked it and would stay again, mostly because the location was ideal, being right across the road from the aquarium and other activities. However, just a few minor niggles that I would not have expected from this quality of hotel, and which stopped me giving it a 5.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Room, Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: witzami
Reviews.Content: My two teenage children stayed at the Renaissance Baltimore Harborplace Hotel for a couple days and nights at the end of our east coast vacation. The room we stayed in was newly remodeled with all modern conveniences. The room had a spectacular view overlooking the inner harbor . We also found the service to be friendly, timely and very helpful with finding things to do in the nearby area. The hotel has a very nice pool area and exercise room included with the stay. We found the pool and exercise equipment to be in great condition. The Camden Yards baseball park is also in walking distance and we were able to attend a game there during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: pilot08
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nigths and was very pleased with the room. Very spacious and the bed was very comfortable. I couldn't give it a full 5 stars because of 2 downfall. First is if you had a room facing the inner section, you'll be facing the pool/garden level which is nothing more than just grass. Second is that the room i was in was a far walk from the elevator. It felt like I had to walk a mile from the elevator to the room. Otherwise, the hotel is right across from the inner harbor where most of the activities are.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Party”
Reviews.Author: hicksw
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very enjoyable stay at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel. We were there for my company's holiday party and decided to stay over. The room was beautifully appointed, the king size bed was quite comfortable and we enjoyed the large flat screen TV. We didn't require much from Guest Services but they were more than willing to see to our every concern when we did call.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Stay”
Reviews.Author: JuneauVirginia
Reviews.Content: This was the first stay for us and from the time we checked in until we left it was perfect. The bellman, room service and housekeeping staff were very professional and each greeted us with asking this question, "How was your stay?". The room was very comfortable and very clean. I even received a small bag of amenities from housekeeping. The hotel is located in the Inner Harbor so everything is in a short walking distance. We did not want to leave and because of the staff and hotel we will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Rene
Reviews.Content: I accompained my husband on a business trip to this hotel. WOW! Terrific location...and we were fortunate enough to get a harbor-front room. We had beautiful weather when we were there, so the view was always spectacular...day and evening. I will have to say that the cost of the in-room Internet was a concern. Since my husband checks his computer all hours, it made sense for us to have it in the room....but the cost could be a major factor for someone traveling for pleasure. The parking cost also...we had not rented a car this trip, so that was not a concern. Our room was lovely and spacious. Very comfortable bed and adequate "stretching-out" room. The bathroom was a little small, and the lack of a full-length mirror was something I missed. We did not go to the pool or fitness center nor order any room service. All in all, the location was great and convenient to everything in the harbor area. We took the water taxi's for a fun relaxing time. Everything that we wanted to do just seemed a few steps away. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - what a view!!”
Reviews.Author: MommySawdust
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a weekend in Baltimore, Maryland and this hotel was the perfect location. It was directly across from the Inner Harbor. When we checked in we were upgraded to a partial Harbor view. The room was clean and plenty large for my family of 4. The small refrigerator was great for the kids. Our room also included the breakfast buffet at the the hotel restaurant. We ate breakfast each morning (the food was delicious and plentiful) overlooking the harbor. There was also a nice sized indoor pool that we used each day. I would highly recommend this hotel, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. With small children who get tired walking, this was the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: JennyRick
Reviews.Content: I planned a trip to the inner harbor for my boyfriends birthday and was not sure where to stay- the Renaissace Harborplace was perfect. It was clean, comfortable, centrally located -I have no negatives to report. We did stay in a harborview room which I would strongly recommend. I am not sure I would have enjoyed the room/view if I was facing the pool or another buliding, etc. The pictures on the hotel's website are exactly what the hotel/room looked liked like. Ask for an upgrade, the hotel was very accommodating!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, some negatives”
Reviews.Author: dimitri7777
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with family. Room 11051 which had view of the courtyard and pool. Took kids to pool, no towels. Lifeguard thought problem was someone else's because housekeeping had been called. Eventually found towels outside pool room where they had apparently been dropped off, without advising the lifeguard. Geez, nice service. Parking is outrageous at $36 for valet service, $28 to self park! Also the rooms are not very soundproof. But other than that, this is a fine hotel with location that can't be beat if you want to be centrally located to the inner harbor. And you don't even have to step outside to go shopping, the hotel is connected to a mall.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: yorkshireus
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in the most central place in the inner harbor - choose this hotel. The hotel however seems to project little personality and is a little souless. Buffet Breakfast adequate but not outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Toton-traveller
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location right in the inner harbour. Stayed here to go to the American Idols gig at the 1st Mariner Arena which was within easy walking distance. The inner harbour area of Baltimore was great, although we took a walk up to Mount Vernon one day and a wrong turn took us into some pretty rundown areas, which was a little scary with the children in tow, even in broad daylight. I would do a bit more research next time and stick to the tourist route. Having said that I loved Baltimore and would go back. The hotel itself was great. Lovely spacious rooms. We were lucky enough to be on the concierge level and had complimentary breakfast, which was very good. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Only one real downside was having to pay for internet connectivity, although they had free wifi in the lobby, and a pc and printer setup for online flight check-in. Unfortunately for us they were doing road works right outside the hotel during our stay, and it was really noisy in our room, but it wouldn't put me off staying again. It was a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Great City!”
Reviews.Author: themadzins
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Baltimore Inner Harbor and the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel. The hotel was is a perfect location to all the sights and areas of Inner Harbor. I managed to secure a fantastic rate on Priceline for this hotel. My room was 8108 and had a partial harbor view. At checkin I requested a full harbor view but the only available room was a double so I opted for the king instead. The room had two chairs and ottoman. There was a desk and chair as well. The furnishings were lovely. The bed was super comfortable. The bath was pretty standard but there was good water pressure. The shower curtain was on the curved bar so that is a big plus. In my opinion, this should be standard operating procedure for all hotels! The AC worked great as it was a warm summer weekend in Baltimore! I left my room rather late one afternoon and did not expect it to be made up upon return but I was pleasantly surprised! It was completely serviced. The lobby is nice, the coffee shop convenient. The access to all things Inner Harbor fantastic! The staff was very accomodating and pleasant. I will definitely stay again at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, well-appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: proscribe
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here in late June with wife, daughter and several other families with kids to do the whole Baltimore Harbor weekend thing. The great location makes this hotel worth considering. It's within walking distance of the Aquarium, inner harbor shopping district, ESPN sportszone, restaurants and Camden Yards. It has an upscale feel without being overly plush. There is a coffee shop in the lobby that brews Starbucks, and is a good place to get a quick bite in the morning. It's also attached to an upscale mall if you need to shop for something. The rooms were nice, modern and clean. The service was solid. Our package included aquarium tickets and a buffet breakfast, which had just about everything you'd want: waffles, eggs to order, plenty of side items, fresh fruit, etc. and a nice view of the harbor. The hotel has a small indoor pool, plenty big enough for kids to blow off some steam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wvlibra
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, convenient to harbor, great conference rooms; requested & received a room near the elevator with a harbor view. I got a partial harbor view which was wonderful. So gorgeous at night. The elevators numbers and announcement system were not working properly. The automated voice would announce Floor 5 when you were really on Floor 10. The numbers would show incorrectly on the lighted pad inside the elevator; it caused a few chuckles with people getting off on the wrong floors. All four elevators were doing this! Restaurant was so expensive that we did not try it. Walked to Inner Harbor restaurants which were excellent. Took a water taxi ride one evening for about 1 1/2 hours. Met a wonderful boat captain who gave us a ride on his last pick-up. Learned he was from our home state of West Virginia. Loved the fact that the hotel is nonsmoking. Beds were sooo comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and outstanding location overlooking Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: carrotop
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in this centrally located great hotel across from the Inner Harbor and the Aquarium. The only unusual aspect of the hotel is that some of the rooms are a long walk from the elevator, our's was only 10 rooms away. Everything is within walking distance, restaurants, entertainment, water taxi, aquarium, and Camden Yards. The best method to get to the Inner Harbor is to take the light rail train from BWI Airport to the Convention Center stop and then walk about 5 block to the hotel - taxi service is also available from the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: NJ-Kathryn
Reviews.Content: We requested early check in, when we arrived check in was a breeze!! The hotel was so clean and beautiful. And as an extra bonus we were given a room on the 12 floor. The view was soooooooo beautiful, esp at night. All the staff were so nice and helpful, we had valet parking, and used taxi service to get around town. The staff arranged for a taxis. The room was perfect, I cannot think of one complaint or improvement. We also visit the Greek Festival at the St. Nicholas Greek Orthodox Church off Eastern Avenue, which was a blast. I certainly will use the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location BUT noisy”
Reviews.Author: happylinny
Reviews.Content: We got there by taxi around 1 pm and our room was ready-no problem checking in early. The hotel smelled wonderful when we walked in (floral or like scented candles?). The room was very large and clean and beautifully decorated. The location is great;easy walking distance to the pier, aquarium, mall, etc. The only problem was the noise. We were in a room NOT facing the harbor(it was a street view-ok with me ). BUT there were trucks and motorcycles and the road had beenunder construction so mthere were metal plates on the street. Even on the 10th floor, it sounded like a train was constantly passing!!! There were also LOUD screaming people in the halls at 2 a.m My husband called and complained and it quieted down. It is a hotel in a city and it was our first trip to Baltimore so we may have had the same problem in nearby hotels. Overall the hotel was VERY nice, a good value, and my daughter enjoyed the clean indoor pool they had, too!

Reviews.Title: “Great except for the $26 parking charge per day!!”
Reviews.Author: cbelle304
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with everything about this trip, except nobody mentioned there is a parking charge to park your car at the hotel. I have never paid to park at a hotel before. Twenty-Six dollars a day can add up when you do a 3 night stay like we did. I asked my gf to merry me at the Harbor and we will never forget that night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: clocoboogie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the Renaissance and was pleasantly surprised. Check-in was easy, room was spacious, and our room overlooked the harbor. The only negatives: a naked drunk guy knocked on our door the first night around 1am and when we called the front desk security escorted him back to his room. Thank god!! We also ordered room service via the card and placed on our door knob but never received it.

Reviews.Title: “Close to it all!”
Reviews.Author: suzq22
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel.Since my stay was part of a conference, the rate was set at a good value. The best thing about this hotel is it's location--it's within walking distance to all you need in Baltimore. It is centrally located in the Inner Harbor; about a 5 minute walk from the convention center. Check in was friendly and quick. We had requested two double beds and that was honored. Colleagues had three to a room and a roll out cot was provided for the third person in their room; the cot also was not your typical roll away flimsy mattress type cot. The rooms were nice and comfortable. The room had a flat screen TV and an iPod docking station/radio. The room and bathroom were clean. The bed was comfortable. Complaints about construction were not noticed. The lobby was modern and clean. The hallways all had new carpeting. However, there were very long corridors and the walk to the room from the elevator was long. The gym was small but adequate. My one complaint was that you could hear everything that was going on in the hallway including doors slamming. The valet parking was $36; if you parked it yourself it was $26 and the front desk gave you a pass card so that you had unlimited access to enter and leave the garage as often as you liked. We had two very nice dinners out; one in the inner harbor/little italy area: a D.C. Chain- Lebanese Taverna; and one in Locust Point- Wine Market which had an outstanding wine collection/ shop attached to the restaurant where you can buy and bring to the table for a corkage fee. Overall, the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel was a nice stay in a comfortable, roomy hotel that is in the Inner Harbor and close to the Aquarium, convention center and restaurants. I would recommend for anyone going to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “It was my worst experiance”
Reviews.Author: zuzualbatal
Reviews.Content: This was a nightmare, first we requested a harbor view and we were assured not once, but twice that we will get a harbor view….but when we got to the Hotel they said; “Yes you requested it but we didn’t guarantee it for you”…and they gave me a room facing construction. Then the pool was also unavailable because of renovations and they told us that they can send us to another hotel to swim….which was extremely inconvenient.. and we were not notified by this renovation before doing the reservation. They had the coffee machine locked in a closet and we found it the 2’nd day of our stay…and although we repeatedly requested tea bags with the coffee tray….that didn’t happen except in the first day. Over all the experience was bad, bad, bad….. and the management of the hotel were not helpful. I will never stay there or recommend it to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “It was just ok...had higher expectations...”
Reviews.Author: Saysum
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of other Marriotts and this one just didn't make the cut. I stayed here for a conference (at the convention center) in May. The cruddy weather didn't help either. Here is my review... Hotel/Location: This was one of the plus with this hotel. It is centrally located in the heart of the Inner Harbor. It is connected to a Mall and short walking distance to eateries. It was about a 10 min walk to the convention center. The hotel looks old from the outside, like the rest of Baltimore. The lobby was tastefully decorated and had free Wi-fi (for 1 hr per day). Check in was a breeze Room: It was a typical Marriott room. The king bed was really comfortable. There was an ipod docking station which was nice. Nice big HD tv. I also had a fridge and nice in room safe (big enough for my computer). However, that was about it. According to my other friends that were staying in there, they didn't all have a fridge. There was no stationary. There was no book or folder that explained the hotel amnenities. Housekeeping was nice. There was a bottle of water for $4. In room coffee was typical (horrible tasting). No wine opener. Bathroom was typical and had decent water pressure. Amenities: There was a nice bar (closed kind of early) and restaurant. I was looking forward to taking a swim. However, the pool and all of the 7th floor was closed for remodel. No one informed me this at check in. I found out when I took the stairs to the abandoned 7th floor and got chased away by construction workers. The connected mall was kind of cool. Also free Wi-fi was nice. All in all, this is an average hotel that is located in a nice location. I got a convention rate so that was nice. Don't expect luxury and you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great staff, Poor construction...”
Reviews.Author: janetatevet
Reviews.Content: I arrived Thursday for a conference. The doorman, concierge, and front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful. Nice lounge with tables and comfy sofas for relaxing or working while waiting for collegues. I asked for a 'view room' and was graciously accommadated. I think that was my mistake. The inner harbor in Baltimore is a very active, energetic city. The Renaissance Hotel is directly across the street from all of amazing things Baltimore has to do. The View--Amazing--- you could see the old ships, the street performers,the water taxi, sailboats, the aquarium, the power house, the old Domino sugar sign reflecting gorgeously on the harbor waters, the cute water dragons that the kids and adults alike paddle throughout the inner harbor and fabulous restaurants... It was a 3 minute walk from the conference center. A 5-10 minute walk to a amazing evening activity of a Orioles baseball game (even though we lost!!) (Oriole fans are fantastic, welcoming and love their city!!).. The hotel though wasn't made with any sort of 'sound protection' in mind. After a full day of being at the conference and enjoying what Baltimore had to offer the noise continued. The constant noise of the the cars going by, the many many fire engines/police/ambulances going by everyday with their alarms on high. I guess there is a really great hospital nearby and this hotel is by their 'flight' pattern.. The windows and walls need sound proofing. The wedding downstairs on Saterday night sounded really great but when we're not invited and its past midnight then either offer a bottle of wine to the people above you or just do slow songs.. So my opinion. When you go here. Get two rooms. One with a view and the other one on the other side of the hotel where you can sleep!! Enjoy Baltimore!!

Reviews.Title: “An exceptional change to an extraordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1lazypuppy
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed there after a four year absence and I can't tell you how much I was impressed. Not only was the service as crisp and attentive as I remembered but the new sleeping room was extraordinary. From the comfort of the linens to the quality of the room service I was truly impressed. I travel three to four times a year and stay mostly at quality downtown hotels and this one clearly met my criteria. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Beware of Booking!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tfam91
Reviews.Content: I'll start by naming the negatives which I can say were only a few. First BEWARE at time of booking that they can not guarantee you a room with 2 double beds. After driving for 3 hours, we get there and they do not have a room available as requested with 2 double beds, only a king and would only allow 1 rollaway. I have 2 teenage sons, where was I putting them? Them suggested one sleep on the floor! After telling the front desk how upset we were, they offered us an upgraded room with a king on the 10th floor, harborview. We took the room and the view was awesome. BUT the rollaway NEVER arrived and all they had left was a small cot!!!! After about 8:00 pm after we again had to walk down to the front desk to complain about the bed NOT arriving, they siad that there were NUMEROUS cancellations and we can have a choice of rooms now with 2 double beds, all waterviewm no extra charge! Not sure how they can explain the big change in 4 hours but that room should have went to us in the first place! UNREAL! Also if you get a harborview room, be prepared for LOUD SIRENS ALL NIGHT LONG! The firehouse is right around the corner. Now the positives were that the location couldn't be any better and the view was spectacular. Camden Yeards is a 10 minute walk with plenty of police around so you feel safe. The rooms were VERY clean and the towels were clean and fluffy. The beds were also clean and very comfortable with the exception of one of my sons having to sleep on a cot! We had newly upgraded rooms so I can not speak for the other rooms. Our carpets were very clean and the room had an awesome 48 inch HD flat screen TV with in-room movices for a charge of 13.99. The staff couldn't be any more helpful though and the front desk really tried hard to accomodate us after we complained a bunch of times about forgetting the bed, etc. The guy at the front desk, Mike, even helped us when our car wouldn't start and validated our parking ticket at a lesser price. Valet parking is 35.00 a day whereas if you park in the garage ad take the elevator up yourself, you can pay 25 per day and a bit cheaper if you have it validated at the front desk. I would stay there agin without hesitation even after the initial aggravation. I paid 179.00 for a harborview room but if you can get it cheaper, it is still a nice place, especially if you like the fact that there is a mall attached to it and a direct walkway to the harbor itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: tubalusa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old (like everything else in Baltimore) but it left some good impressions. I went there to see Virgin Mobile Music Festival and it was the only hotel with 4 stars for affordable price. Other hotels increased their prices during this music event. I didn't really like my room because it seemed huge and it wasn't enough furniture or something. It was a feeling of emptiness. Service was great. Friendly employees and they was always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: onthemove222
Reviews.Content: Great down town location, and the hotel is modern, comfortable and clean. One big negative is the parking - it's $26 per night even if you.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: a80r
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to stay at this hotel, but it ended up disappointing me and my boyfriend on several levels. First, parking was $38 per night which would have been fine had we known beforehand. Luckily there was parking available on the street (metered). Second, the shower was dirty. There were someone else’s hairs all over the bottom of the shower along with the soap holder. It was disgusting. Next, the hotel was unable to accommodate our request for a king size bed. Now, I realize it is a ‘request’ (which the lady at check in rudely explained), but we were staying there for Valentine’s Day and instead of having a romantic room, we had a room cramped with 2 queen size beds. Lastly, starting at around 7am there was a very load buzzing noise coming from the wall. At first I thought it was an alarm clock, but we concluded it must have been a pipe acting up in the wall. It made noise for 5 minutes at a time nearly every 20 minutes until we checked out. Some positives are the location (right on the harbor, walking distance to everything), the hotel bar (open late and tasty drinks), and the price we received off priceline ($75 per night I think). Although there are some positives, the negatives definitely don’t even it out. I definitely would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Tired Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: medicalalert
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is in the perfect location - directly across the street from the Inner Harbor - very close to restaurants and the National Aquarium. The hotel lobby is modern and upscale -fairly comfortable. The guests floors, however, are a different story. Although there is apparently some renovation going on in the hotel (noise and dust abound), my large room had very worn adn stained carpeting, and the hallways were unacceptably dirty - I passed the same food, cans, wrappers and trash throughout an entire day - before, during and after the houskeeping staff were on the floor. The hallways show lots of wear and tear. Warning - there is a fair amount of nopise from other rooms adn from teh street. I expected a cleaner, more up to date environment for the rate I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: npm
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but the best part is the location: steps from Harborplace, the aquarium, and just a short walk to most attractions. Even though we booked at a highly discounted rate on Priceline, they gave us a room with a harbor view. Pleasant rooms, and nice service, although they forgot my request for a crib and I had to call again. Note that parking is quite expensive; you can save $20 or so by parking a couple blocks away in a cheaper lot.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: knzett
Reviews.Content: I was in Baltimore with my best friend for a girls weekend and decided to "play it by ear" in regards to where we were staying Saturday night. We got our room on Priceline.com and it was perfect! The most comfortable mattress and pillows and very cozy lobby. Will definitley stay there again! knzett

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nashvegas999
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location! Directly across from the Harbor and attached to the mall! Restaurant had a great crab cake sandwhich! Hotel has recently renovated and looks fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “***Completely Unacceptable*** A good location isn't everything !”
Reviews.Author: Ber778
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for my Christmas Party which was held in one of the Ballrooms. The floor we stayed on was apparently undergoing renovations as evident by the plastic carpet protectors and boxes of floor tile lining the hallways. After our party we returned to our room at about 3 am and went to bed. At 8 am workers in the room immediately next door began cutting floor tile on an electric saw and mixing grout with an electric mixer. My wife spoke with the manager, Alezia Johnson, who stated that the construction was beyond her control. We asked for a different room and were told the hotel was full. We asked why we were not told about the construction at check-in, and told that it was not their policy. We were told that the construction started at a "reasonable" hour for a Saturday morning and that ‘maybe we should have gone to bed earlier!’ At that point we refused to pay for the room by withdrawing authorization for the charge. Our credit card was charged anyway. This is being disputed with American Express. Construction is a fact of life, however, it seems like common sense to put a few buffer rooms between the construction and the guests, and if, as in this case, the workers will block the hallway with tools and construction supplies, they should have closed the floor for safety reasons. The only thing more appalling than the noise at 8 am was the manner in which the management handled the situation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Located and Fun Hotel for a Solo Traveler on A "Weekday" Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: lonelyplanetboy
Reviews.Content: True! It's a large business/convention hotel...like in any city, I'm sure just like wherever you come from..... only slightly boring, but so is every convention hotel in the country.....but it doesn't really matter 'cause it's the location that makes this place great! If you are exploring Baltimore for the first time solo and without a car, you really should stay here.....from here, you can explore anywhere near the inner harbor on foot or by water taxi! Just hop on an Amtrak train bound for Baltimore and when you arrive at the station, take a taxi to this hotel and your solo adventure will begin You can explore this amazing city, check out historic Fells Point, and eat some amazing local food! I walked everywhere along the inner harbor by myself and was never bored! I saw and did so, so much....this hotel was a great base to experience this historic city like a local! Sorry normal people, but Baltimore is a great city for solo travel..... even if you visit it in the off season! Did it matter to them that I wasn't dragging a family with me or carrying a laptop to a meeting somewhere and looking corporate? No. it didn't. Who cares?The staff is very nice here. The lobby is modern and hip. The rooms look like they came from the 1980's and are large, simple and clean. But there's a whole city out there to explore, so you just need a comfy King bed to sleep at the end of the night to rest, a cool TV, and a clean bathroom like they have here. And you'll be great!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TANGERS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance with a special rate for people using Johns Hopkins Hospital. We had two conecting rooms with my 90 year old Mom having outpatient cataract surgery. The staff could not have been friendlier or more effficient. From the greeter in the lobby to the bellmen to the warm room service staff to the concierage - they were all marvelous. We did not use the restaurant, choosing room service for most meals - good food. The 6 AM breakfast we needed arrived right on time. The new beds were very comfortable with comfy fluffy duvets. All in all they made a stressful few days a lot easier.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJFisherChic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a mini-work vacation at the Inner Harbor Hotel and it was Great!!! The conference center within the hotel is great, plenty of food, drinks and coffee throughout the conference. The room was super comfortable....the bed was FANTASTIC. I am very picky about hotel beds and this was one of my favorites. The down comforter, sheets and plenty of pillows were just right!!! The location was second to none. Right in the heart of everything. Did I mention the mall that is 'on property' !?!! Great stores and a walkway to all the happenings across the street right on the harbor. Wonderful!!! All of the staff we encountered were super helpful and just made you feel at home. A five star experience. you must go!!!! May be pricey--but really is worth it. The Inner Harbor & Fells Point are great destinations..... We can't wait to return and will surely stay at the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennmelzer
Reviews.Content: The highlight of this hotel was the bed....it was so comfortable! It's in a great location, right across the street from the inner harbor, and the rooms are large. Overall, great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bobbjo77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the labor day weekend and really enjoyed it. I think it has the best location of any hotel in Baltimore (directly across the street from the main harbor attractions) and most things were within walking distance. The staff was fast and helpful (especially the nice Filipino man at the check in desk), and the beds were comfortable with tons and tons of pillows as far as the eye could see. I liked the turn down service and chocolate mint, getting tucked in like that is a level of service and hospitality that I am not used to. The view was amazing and only surpassed by the beauty of my wonderful girlfriend. I would stay here again!! I wish they had hotels like this in Kansas, I like how you east coasters live!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: bobbyjoe77
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the labor day weekend and really enjoyed it. I think it has the best location of any hotel in Baltimore (directly across the street from the main harbor attractions) and most things were within walking distance. The staff was fast and helpful (especially the nice Filipino man at the check in desk), and the beds were comfortable with tons and tons of pillows as far as the eye could see. I liked the turn down service and chocolate mint, getting tucked in like that is a level of service and hospitality that I am not used to. The view was amazing and only surpassed by the beauty of my wonderful girlfriend. I would stay here again!! I wish they had hotels like this in Kansas, I like how you east coasters live!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: janie51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the Labor Day weekend for 2 nights, 3 days. The hotel is perfectly situated and our room 8024 had a fantastic view of the Inner Harbor. The room was spacious, clean and properly stocked with towels, etc, and had a very comfortable bed and six pillows. Most of all, this hotel had the best staff ever. From the valet, bellhops, front desk, concierge, chambermaids, restaurant and chefs, and anyone who worked on the property. Everyone was there to make certain you had whatever you needed and to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Whoever hires for this hotel is to be complimented. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: SUPERMOMBX
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for a conference. the room was large for the 3 of us. the location was great, across the street from the inner harbor. if you don't want to eat breakfast at the hotel u can eat at Johnny rockets down the street or there is a place that called something like 24 hour breakfast. they were closed on sat. morning when we left. the gym at the hotel was great. I would also recommend the Walters museum. Some have posted that it is a 15-20 minute walk but it is uphill. We took a cab both ways and it was inexpensive. (it was raining)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: dmw8000
Reviews.Content: This 4 star hotel has a location that can not be beat. The room was large and the bathroom was very large. For a 4 star hotel, however, I was not impressed. The lobby was not impressive, nor was the room decor. Very middle of the road. Our room smelled of smoke, and we were told to have the ionizer brought in we would have to vacate the room for an hour. The set of elevators was not enough to service the entire hotel. Many times we would have to wait for the second or third elevator to come just so we can fit in it. Additionally, the elvators were not air conditioned. If you can get a great rate, its worth it, though, for the location alone. The staff was friendly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding place if you can find a deal”
Reviews.Author: bamt08
Reviews.Content: If you are visiting Baltimore's Inner Harbor, it's be tough to beat the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel. It's a first class hotel with first class service and accommodations. It is expensive. I got a good deal via a Marriott Rewards member email. Note that valet parking is $36 a night as of this writing. Yes, that is competitive with other hotels in the area, but it's still outrageous. Some self serve public parking garages in the area are $7 for over night parking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: BenMTampa_FL
Reviews.Content: Took a side trip to Baltimore from DC Stayed on July 2nd for 1 day. Paid extra for a Inner harbor view which was fantastic. the hotel was steps to the inner harbor & a reasonable walk to Camden Yards. Service was great and the room was nice & clean but obviously not a new Renaissance. Did not appreciate the $36.00 valet parking fee. The front desk recommended the Blue Sea Grill which was disappointing. Overall it was up to expectations. Don't miss the Aquarium!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location to explore Charm City”
Reviews.Author: Aurora_Guy
Reviews.Content: If you want to explore the Baltimore Inner Harbor, get away for a weekend and a ball game, or visit family and friends in Charm City, I suggest you consider the Renaissance Harborplace. Located across the street from dining and shopping at Harborplace on the corner of E. Pratt Street and South Street, it's hard to imagine a more convenient location. The hotel is fairly modern with a nicely decorated lobby. The staff checked me in quickly and with a smile. The property shows signs of wear and tear in some quarters (e.g. hallways and elevators), but overall it is nicely kept. My room on the 12th floor was large and comfortable with a huge flat screen TV for entertainment. The small-ish Ground Floor Cafe and Bar is fine for a quick drink or a cup of joe, but it's not a cozy place for an intimate evening or sensitive business discussions. I only had the brunch at the Watertable restaurant on the 5th floor ($20), so I can't say much about dining. Brunch was standard fare with fresh waffles and eggs available to order. With so many wonderful food choices nearby, take a walk unless you're in a hurry. I spent two weekend nights there in mid-July at a discounted rate and would consider it again at the same price. It's a Marriott rewards category 5, which is about right in my experience. If you don't get a discount or a package deal and you can only book at full rate, think about another hotel. You have several top-notch hotels in the Inner Harbor area with perhaps better value at that rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: ENBB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had a wonderful “weekend getaway” in Baltimore, and one of the reasons why it was great was because of our stay at the Renaissance Baltimore Harborplace Hotel. We had a room on the eleventh floor overlooking the inner harbor. If you are going to stay at this hotel, you must get a room on a high floor that faces the inner harbor, as it will make your stay much more memorable. What views! The hotel is the closest hotel to the harbor and all of its attractions, being right across the street from it. The location is one of the reasons we decided to stay here and our decision to do so was the correct one. All of the attractions, shops, restaurants and sights are within easy walking distance. Orioles Park at Camden Yards, where we saw a baseball game, is an easy five block walk from the hotel. Other notes: The hotel charges $10 a day for internet use (wi-fi free in the lobby, though). In the room, I was able to find other wireless connections for my laptop, so I didn’t have to pay to use the hotels connection. Our room was clean, large and well appointed, but it could have used a nice comfortable chair. I do know that some other rooms had a comfy chair, but not ours. The hotel did provide binoculars for your use in order to take in those views from our eleventh floor room – nice touch. We had a flat screen TV and, as an unexpected added plus, a small refrigerator. Other plusses: a nightly turn-down service (with chocolate mints) and bath robes. Check-in was quick and easy. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. Self parking was a bit pricey at $26 a day (we had two cars which made it even more expensive). The coffee shop in the hotel lobby was very convenient for a quick breakfast, but other options are really close by (Starbucks). The hotel is attached to The Gallery shopping mall (some upscale shops). Other stores are just down the block (Filene’s Basement, Barnes and Noble, Best Buy . . .). We dined in several of the inner harbor restaurants during our stay: we recommend Phillips (great crab cakes!). Street noise was noticeable at night, but that was not a problem at all. It just made the area seem more vibrant and alive – there was even a wedding reception on the USS Constellation that Saturday night (we could faintly hear the DJ’s music). All in all, we had an absolutely wonderful time in Baltimore and would highly recommend the Renaissance Harborplace – but be sure you get a room on a high floor with a view of the inner harbor.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: barbos111
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in five years at Renaissance Harborplace. We had requested early check-in at the time the reservation was made, but truly did not expect our room to be ready when we arrived shortly after noon, but it was. Check-in was quick and efficient, the staff courteous and professional. The hotel has had some updates since we were last there, all noticeable improvements. The beds at this hotel are the best I've slept in, the accommodations clean and my request for extra towels at the time of reservation was fulfilled. The Watertable Restaurant is nice, but this was the only part of our stay which did not live up to expectations. While the staff there was as friendly and attentive as before, the breakfast buffet was not as good as we remembered. The restaurant (formerly called "Windows"), seems smaller, the tables closer together. Although there was a large variety of foods from which to choose, there didn't seem to be quite the number of choices from our prior visit and the fresh pasteries were not all so fresh. We were really disappointed by the restaurant and unlike our prior visit, did not feel the $40.00 tab for two buffets and drinks was worth it. All in all, though, our stay was pleasant. If you're planning a trip to Inner Harbor, you can't get any closer than this. The hotel has a walkway from the attached Harborplace Gallery to the Pavillion on the Harbor across the street. Both times we've been to Inner Harbor, we've parked our car upon arrival and never went back to it until we were ready to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Food”
Reviews.Author: jp5o
Reviews.Content: Had a great time last week at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel. I was there for a conference and took my wife and infant son. The staff was exceedingly helpful. They went out of their way to be of assistance to us. The staff at their restaurant "WaterTable" was superb as well was their food. When my infant son started to cry, the manager and our waitress were so thoughtful and kind. Also, their crab cake puff appetizer was out of this world. To top it all off, they surprised us with a champagne toast delivered to our room for our Anniversary. Great service!!!!

Reviews.Title: “All that glitters is not gold....”
Reviews.Author: YorkCountyPaFamily
Reviews.Content: We hadn't been to the inner harbor for at least 15 years and thought it would be nice to take a quick overnight getaway to see some sites, in particular, the Nat'l Aquarium. We were looking forward to showing our son the sites. So we booked at the Renaissance Harborplace for one night, purchasing the Nat'l Aquarium package, which advertised including free parking, 2 tickets to the aquarium, and free breakfast in the brand new 'Watertable" restaurant. Check-in was fine, albeit chaotic, but to be expected for a bright, sunny Memorial Day weekend. We requested early check-in and our room was ready early, so it was nice to unload luggage and park the car, and get settled in. We also requested an extra Aquarium child ticket and the front desk was able to accommodate us, which was great. I recommend a hotel package (several offer packages) or buying your aquarium tickets online ahead...do not wait in line to buy. You'll only get tired and frustrated. We had our tickets from the hotel and walked right into the aquarium. Lots of people and street performers on the inner harbor. In the afternoon, we thought we'd try out the pool at the hotel. It was fine, but small, and even at the dinner hour, was quite crowded. After swimming, we selected M&S for dinner, only because the wait wasn't so long. But while it was very pricey...most reasonably priced entree was meatloaf for $16, to NY strip steak for $32, the food was terrific. We had the mahi mahi blackened and the fried shrimp dinner, and both were excellent! We recommend the twice-baked apple pie for dessert. The wait staff were accommodating and friendly and kept our iced tea glasses filled. Nice atmosphere for couples as well as families with children. We recommend it. The hotel is not on the water as it is portrayed in its advertising, but it is a close walking distance to everything.
