Not the clean, shiny harbor place it used to be though....lots of trash, and loiterers (be prepared for all kinds of people), and the faint smell of stale water everywhere you walk. We did request a harbor view room, but we didn't get one. Instead, we got a view of the inside of the attached Harbor Gallery Shops mall. No big deal as the room was comfortable and clean. Beds very comfy. Bathroom very clean. However, the night of our stay, there was a wedding one floor down and rooms facing the shops could hear the blaring music. I called the front desk once to ask when the music was going to stop as we had children trying to sleep. Music stopped at midnight and we finally settled in for the night. But we were awoken again at 3:35 AM by the fire alarm, and that scared our 9-yr-old. Thirty minutes later, after some confusion, it was determined that a guest had pulled the alarm, and no need to leave the hotel. Needless to say, it wasn't a very restful night after a day of walking and site-seeing. The next morning, we woke up and looked forward to a nice, free breakfast in the brand new Watertable restaurant. But when we went down to breakfast, it appeared as if only one item was on the menu for breakfast, only one cashier/order taker at the counter, and only one family having breakfast. We opted to check the shops or eateries at inner harbor; however, none were open for breakfast at 9 AM Sunday morning. Cheesecake Factory would have been a good choice, but they don't open until 10 on Sundays. We opted to have the valet bring our car, packed up, checked out, and drove to another breakfast restaurant on the way home. All in all , we don't think we got what we paid for, and we probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: andreiuta
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location you’d hope for Baltimore. It is not right in the harbor as some of the pictures listed on various websites may suggest, but it is in walking distance of all the happenings, great restaurants, the Aquarium, and basically connected to a pretty nice mall. I love shopping so this was just very convenient, for spending a few hours. Also, the selection of restaurant is so big that you can find food for absolutely any tastes and budgets within 10 minutes walking. I would also assume that the proximity of the Aquarium is a plus for family with children: we had the closing night dinner there and I can say this place is a must see for anyone, not only for kids. The room was clean and spacious, and everything worked as expected. We arrived at lunchtime, along with 100 other tourists, so the check in process was a bit slow, but there is nothing I would hold accountable the hotel for. My room had a nicely sized sitting area, and the work desk was a bit aside from the bed which made working at late hours a bit less difficult. However what I didn’t like about the place was the fact that the Internet was not free. You’d expect that once you paid $250+ for a room, something as little as the Internet was included. Yet we’ve been charged $10 a day, and here comes the worse part, for a service that we didn’t use. And this wasn’t a mistake made on my bill, because the colleague of mine I traveled with was charged the same thing, although she didn’t even bring her laptop with her. We both complained about this, and had the charges taken off. The day after I got back to the office, I submitted my expenses sheet, when my boss asked me about a $60 charge that I didn’t even noticed. I called the hotel, and it turned out that I had been billed for a dinner for two although none of us even ate at the hotel restaurant. The hotel representative opened an investigation, and a week later they called me apologizing for the mistake. However, I found a bit disturbing the fact that they made two mistakes on the same bill. I would say that this a good hotel, although based on the experience I had with them, I would think twice before returning there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: marcbo111
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Sat. night. Booked through priceline, got a great deal. Hotel was very clean, hotel staff was more than helpful. Stayed with my wife and two kids. Perfect hotel to see the Aquarium and Inner Harbor sites. So conveinent. I read alot of reviews on travel destinations and am always a little concerned. Don't be with this hotel. Book it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the Harbor or Johns Hopkins”
Reviews.Author: singinintherain
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were initially disappointed that we didn't get a harbor view room, but since we had a terrific rate from priceline, that isn't anything to complain about. The room was very nice--we always look forward to the comfortable Marriott beds with their cushy comforters and thick mattress pads. This hotel is a bustling place that hosts many business functions. It is, however, also a great place for the leisure traveler--the location is terrific--cross the street, and you're on the harbor or in the mall that fronts the harbor and contains several restaurants (Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza, a sushi bar, tapas restaurant, Irish pub). A short walk in different directions offers you various cultural or shopping options. The hotel itself has a free wireless internet connection in the lobby only; the room connection is $10 daily, but with that comes free local and long distance calls -- something I didn't realize until check out when I came across that bit of info in the book in the room. We had stayed at the Marriott Waterfront the preceding month, which initially appeared to be the better hotel. There are trade-offs, though, that ultimately led us to prefer the Renaissance: the coffee shop downstairs, the free internet access in the lobby, pleasant & eager-to-please personnel, convenience to many harborfront attractions & restaurants, a liveliness about the place -- the Marriott Waterfront was much more subdued. The Renaissance is connected to the Gallery mall--accessible on the 1st & 5th floors--other reviewers had commented that that connection compromised their feeling of safety. We didn't feel that way at all; all areas of this hotel are teeming with personnel and there is always a very safe feeling. We stayed here for 6 nights when my husband had surgery at Hopkins--a $10 cab ride & 15 minute ride away. One night, I returned to the hotel alone at 11 P.M. and there was so much activity and such a presence of staff that I felt extremely safe. The staff at this hotel truly seems to enjoy working here. Aside from that, being in this hotel minimized the feeling that our world was being turned upside down with a serious surgery. I know that is not the experience of the typical traveler, but many travel to Hopkins for its medical excellence, and it is nice to balance that experience with a stimulating harbor location and a lively hotel that also offers you luxury & quiet. We did not use the pool, but it & the whirlpool appeared very nice; the exercise room was open 24 hours. We'd return here in a heartbeat, even with the $26 daily parking charge. All told, we preferred the location to that of the Marriott Waterfront, and the personnel here were genuinely engaging--something we hadn't anticipated but truly enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem in Charm City...”
Reviews.Author: 1blkhny_va
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel over Easter weekend 2008. I booked the room using a Marriott Rewards voucher directly on the Marriott website with a preference for a high floor. We were welcomed by an attentive and courteous front desk staff upon arrival and to our surprise a beautiful corner room with an EXCEPTIONAL view awaited us. The hotel's views are truly spectacular!!! At night, we were dazzled by the glittering lights of Baltimore's Inner Harbor and during the day, the view of the water was breathtaking. Our reward included breakfast for two the next morning and the hotel's room service was quick and efficient. We ate an exceptional breakfast in (the most comfortable) king size bed while still enjoying the views of the city waking before our eyes. We will DEFINITELY visit this gem in Charm City again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Natsomom
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed here 4/18-4/21 and we loved it. The location was perfect, we had two sunny days & two rainy days & staying so close to the harbor made it easy to sightsee even in the rain. Everything is an easy walking distance (Aquarium, Camden Yards, Port Discovery, shopping, Little Italy, water taxi, street entertainers & many restaurants). The view beautiful, clean room, comfy bed & a wonderful breakfast each day. We had a package that included breakfast each day, try to get it because it was well worth it.. Staff excellent & efficient. We will be back to Baltimore & this is the place to stay from what we saw...

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: Meredith05
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I headed up to see the O's play in Baltimore this past weekend and decided to splurge and spend a night at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel. It was expensive on our budget, but we booked a water-view room w/ a king size bed. The view was beautiful, the room was clean, and the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in! Check-In was easy, and with the harbor right there we were able to walk right across the street to have dinner and lunch. Camden Yards is also within walking distance. The whole area is exciting, and we had a memorable weekend. We will be staying here the next time we go into Baltimore for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “What a place!”
Reviews.Author: GandT-n-WV
Reviews.Content: Our first time to the "Inner Harbor", we loved it. This Hotel is THE location, fantastic views, much to see and do, lots of history and the chef at this Hotel knows his stuff. If you have never been to the harbor you must go, we came here by luck, we were in DC and decided to see something else and WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Harborplace is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IkeEtown
Reviews.Content: We loved our time at this hotel. We got a great price through Priceline.com; I wouldn't have wanted to pay the rack rate. The hotel was clean; the rooms were comfortable, they had nice soaps etc. The bed was very comfortable with deluxe bedding. I liked just having one king sized bed rather than the two regular or queen sized beds you usually have in a hotel. I never need two beds for just my husband and me. I have read a lot of comments that the walk from the elevators to the rooms can be too long; our room was about as far from the elevator as you can be and I didn't find the walk all that daunting. It may be a long walk for people with small children or the infirm/elderly. Parking was costly. But we loved being right in the middle of the attractions at the Inner Harbor. Everything was very clean and nice and the staff was friendly and helpful. I would stay here again, with the help of a good rate from Priceline.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: travelgrrlnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Baltimore Harborplace Hotel on a business trip. I got a great rate of $99/night off Priceline. This is a great hotel! The hotel is about 15-20 minutes from BWI (depending on traffic.) It is easy to find. Valet is $36/ night. They were very efficient. I only needed a 5-minute warning to have my car brought around. The best thing about this hotel is that they don't make you feel inferior because you booked on Priceline. The front desk had my room ready and all of my virtual requests (extra pillows and extra towels) were in my room when I arrived. They also left a cute gift bag with a toothbrush, toothpaste and a comb. The pillows and the towels were wrapped in pretty ribbon...I thought it was a nice touch. They said they were out of water view rooms, but I got a room on the 11th floor (the hotel has 12 floors.) Room 11009 faces a courtyard and is still a nice view. It is certainly better than some hotels where you are looking at rooftops. The rooms are very large for a downtown hotel. The beds are very comfortable. The linens are a very nice quality and I love all their pillows. The seating area and the work are very roomy. The whole hotel feels as if it has been re-done and well maintained. The bathrooms are a nice size and the water pressure was great. The towels are a nice quality. They do not provide robes. The stock the regular Renaissance Lather products. I personally really like products...especially the Lemongrass soap. The closets are a nice size. They do not have safes in the room. Room service is served until midnight. The selection is very good and the prices are reasonable. There was a old refridgerator in the room, but it was not stocked. I'm assuming this is something that will be replaced in the near future. It didn't match the rest of the hotel. The free wireless internet worked great. As others have said, if you are visiting Baltimore and want to say on the Harbor...this is the place. It is directly across the street from a Cheesecake Factory and a California Pizza kitchen. It is a short walk to the Aquarium. For business travels...you are also set. The staff was very helpful and I found it an easy place to work out of. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: kabkao
Reviews.Content: Overall, a wonderful stay. The Renaissance has the best location at the Inner Harbor. The room was well appointed and the bed was very comfortable. Check in and out was fast and service was extremely friendly. The concierge was very helpful and polite as well. We never passed a staff member that did not greet us, even in the hallways or elevators, and every staff member went out of their way to make sure that our stay was enjoyable. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Location”
Reviews.Author: Flantastic-Four
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 returning to Baltimore for our fourth time. We like this hotel the best for the location and access. Kids can walk around the mall, connected to the hotel lobby and walk across the street on the walkway versus crossing the street. Pool is nice, you can get a cheap breakfast downstairs. All in all we have consistently been satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Inner Harbor, convenient to Camden Yards”
Reviews.Author: akd07
Reviews.Content: I stayed on a business trip last year. The hotel is in a great location in Inner Harbor - adjacent to a big mall and across the street from the harbor with musicians, shopping, dining, etc. It is a short walk to the Baltimore Convention Center and also Camden Yards. The lobby and check in area is comfortable and inviting. The room was clean and very comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Westportia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance for a girlfriends' weekend. We requested 2 adjoining rooms, and they were ready upon our arrival. The rooms were clean and comfortable (beds are great). Room service came quickly and the food was good. We asked for wine glasses, and they came within minutes. All of the housekeeping and room service staff were friendly, polite and prompt. The lobby is pretty (modern), and there is a little "deli" with Starbucks coffee in the lobby. The pool was clean and nice. The hotel is attached to the mall via a walkway. We had a fantastic dinner at Pazo Restaurant in Harbor East (a short cab ride from the hotel). We picked the chef's "tasting" menu, and it was wonderful. All in all, I am surprised by the lukewarm reviews and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Uninspired”
Reviews.Author: pugsnbugs
Reviews.Content: Thank goodness I only paid $85 a night through priceline.com. Why is this hotel rated 4 stars? It ought to be a 3 star. On the plus side, the staff was polite, the bed was comfortable, and the location was good. On the flip side, due to being attached to a mall, just about anyone can walk through the hotel, guest or not. While smoking outside, panhandlers, people handing out religious pamphlets and people who needed a cigarette swarmed me like bees on honey. The neighborhood is full of lousy chain restaurants, where is the local flavor? I recommend the Marriot waterfront on alicianna. fells point and little italy shopping and dining are a closer walk, and a much more luxurious room. Some traveling tips- don't pay $30 for a cab to/from the airport. get supershuttle for $10 if you find an online coupon, and Light rail is walking distance and $1.60.

Reviews.Title: “Great NYE Experience”
Reviews.Author: BrlDsguise
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on New Year's Eve and thought it was great. Right across the street from the Inner Harbor our partial view room looked directly at the aquarium. The staff was very friendly especially at the lobby bar where we went for drinks after midnight. Room furnishings and hotel decor was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jamesoz1
Reviews.Content: Great location,good hotel. Rooms clean and beds comfortable.Staff very helpful.Location on the harbor can't be beat.Pool area nice too(though a large group of kids made it unusable). Irksome that they charge extra for internet,calls,etc. I got this for a decent price,but probably wouldn't stay here if I had to pay anywhere near rack rates.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: eirol
Reviews.Content: This hotel was DEFINITELY NOT a 4-star hotel, as promised and advertised. The front desk staff was polite and helpful. However, the amenities, or lack there of, were very disappointing. Considering it was supposed to be a 4-star hotel, the furniture and decor in the rooms were a little outdated and there were stains on the window curtains. During the first night of our stay, the toilet in our bathroom broke and parts had to be replaced. Maintenance came up immediately within 5-10 minutes to fix the problem, which was a plus. Housekeeping left dirty pillowcases laying around in our room after everything was changed and there were even dirty pillowcases laying around in the ice vending machine room down the hall. I was even more upset to see bums walking through the lobby around 10 o'clock at night. Where is security? Elevators do not require guest cards to get on, so random people can get on the elevators, which made me feel very unsafe after numerous encounters from "panhandlers" outside of the hotel and surrounding area, especially within Inner Harbor. No visible cameras in elevators or throughout the hotel considering the very high crime rate in Baltimore. If you are looking for a place where you can feel safe, clean, and comfortable, this definitely is NOT it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: MisstheDogs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the WE of the Army/Navy game; thus, the hotel was very crowded. First, I was very impressed before I even checked in. I called the concierge a week before to get restaurant reservations. He offered to make reservations for me while I was on the phone. The place he recommended was excellent -- exactly what we were looking for. Check-in was quick and efficient and we got the type of room (i.e., king bed) that we'd asked for. The room was larger than your typical hotel room. The furnishings were a bit dated and uninspired. Unmemorable is the word that comes to mind. Bathroom was functional and standard-sized-- nice amenities,nicer hairndryer than most hotels. Bed was OK -- one side sagged a bit. Wake-up call was prompt. Breakfast room service was timely and the food was quite good. Delivery person was very pleasant. There is a coffee shop in the lobby -- service is very slow but people are nice and coffee was good. Elevators can be a bit slow when it's crowded. Also, although insulation between rooms is excellent, you can definitely hear everything that goes on in the hallway (probably due to a large space under the door). So, if guests come back to their rooms in the early hours, you'll hear them. We had the basic room -- overlooked other buildings and a street. If you want to have a harbor view, you'll pay extra. Probably not worth it in the winter, but may be desirable when it's light most of the day. Hotel is very close to all of the Inner Harbor activities and walking distance to lots of good restaurants. It 's about 20 minutes from M&T Bank stadium or Camden Yards -- an easy walk. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for business and leisure travelers and I would stay there again. It's not exceptional (and can be a bit pricey during major events), but there were no major drawbacks.

Reviews.Title: “NO working television + double charge=Bad Experience!”
Reviews.Author: cakegirl_7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married in Maryland, and stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace on our wedding night. Imagine my dismay when, first, the concierge informed us that our room had "two twin beds!" (this after we specifically requested a room with a king or queen bed). They managed to correct this, and we were given a room with a nice harbor view (one of the few impressive points in our experience overall). However, we found that we could not watch a single television program or even a movie due to problems with Marriott's Direct TV feed. The hotel staff attempted to compensate for this by giving us a free breakfast---which, admittedly, was excellent---but did not rectify the television problem at all. Furthermore, and what's worse, we were CHARGED DOUBLE THE FARE! A total of $632 for one night's stay! Absolutely appalling. When I contacted customer service about this, they promised they would refund the charge, which they have not done (it's now six days later). I cannot understand a $350-night hotel not having a working TV; I cannot understand the hotel not at least compensating us some portion of the hotel charge for this; and I certainly cannot understand being charged twice for an overall annoying and disappointing stay. THUMBS DOWN in every sense.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Updating Wouldn't Hurt”
Reviews.Author: RedSabre
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel stay in our hometown to complement a splurge dinner out (at Charleston), so I booked via Priceline. After over a week of striking out, I did finally get the Renaissance the day before our arrival, but at a price barely below what was available on the Marriott website -- it was clear this was a big convention weekend, and 4-star properties were packed. I stayed in this hotel within the first 5 years it opened (when it was the Stouffer Harborplace), and now -- 15 years later -- it doesn't appear as if the rooms have been updated all that much. In fact, the enamel was chipping off our tub and the surrounding grout could have used some refreshing. Likewise, the carpet, upholstery and wallpaper border looked a bit tired. The decor, too, is a bit blah and uninspired -- not what I expect to see at $300+ night in B'more. That much said, the room was spotless, all amenities in place (love the "Lather" brand soaps), and the bed as comfortable as we've come to expect. Room service breakfast was timely and generous. And the public areas of the hotel are quite striking. I have no problem recommending this hotel as a good, business class hotel in a superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel..”
Reviews.Author: Glamourfish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Renaissance hotel for ou first year anniversary. It was a beautiful weekend. The hotel was very nice. My father in law gave us the hotel room using Marriott points. When we got there, they had upgaded our room to a conceirge room. It had probably the MOST comfortable bed that I've ever slept in. Beautiful clean room with turn down service. We went to the aquarium which was packed even for a Sunday. Also went to Philips for dinner. Got there just in time to miss the long line that began behind us. I think there was some kind of prom type event that night because there were kids everywhere! Philips was great. Food was excellent but a little pricey for the amount of food you got... Also made good use of the water taxi which was really fun. At night, we decided to take a horse and carriage ride around town. Night quiet ride through an italian village type area. It was cool to be able to look inside the restaurants as we rode down the street. It was like a movie scene. All in all it was a great time. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Falcon03
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel three times, all on business; spent a total of three weeks on the property. I really love the hotel and plan to stay there on any future visits. The location in great...right in the Inner Harbor and within walking distance to all the downtown sights. Phillips is not to be missed for the best crab cakes in the harbor. Their gym is the best I've seen at any hotel. They have a few treadmills, Precors, free weights, weight machines, etc. There is a Starbucks in the lobby bar and another in the mall, which is attached directly to the hotel through the lobby. This is a nice feature if you're into shopping and don't want to walk the streets at night on your own. The breakfast in there newly renovated restaurant was excellent. It was about $20pp for the buffet, but the food was awesome. Overall, two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreggNJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 8/25 & 8/26 and had a great time. We paid $78 thru Priceline. Check-in was quick and we were given a room in the inner courtyard on the 11th floor. The 12th floor is the club level rooms. Our room was spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was clean and there were nice toiletries. We did not have any problems with noises from other guests or outside. Parking is a ripoff but it's comparable to the other hotels in the area. We bumped into Tori Hunter of the Twins in the elevator so I guess if the players are staying there it must be a good hotel. The hotel is across the street from the water and in the center of the action. It is attached to a large mall that covers several blocks and is connected by walkways from the hotel. We walked to Camden Yards in about 20 minutes. If you are into baseball, check out a game and also do the stadium tour. There is also a sports museum next door and the tour leader said that it was recently ranked as one of the top sports museums in the country. ESPN Zone, Hard Rock Cafe, and the Power Plant are within a 10 minute walk. We did not use the pool but it looked great for kids and when I checked it out at 10 p.m. there was still a lifeguard there. Although I didn't use the exercise room (always plan on it but never fit it in:), it was better than most of the ones I''ve seen in hotels. There were plenty of bikes, tradmills, and stairmasters with individual TVs attached to each. There were also 5 or 6 weight machines and a full array of dumbbells. The only meal we ate at the hotel was the breakfast buffet. It was $18 but all you can eat and the quality was excellent. I had one of the best omelettes I've ever eaten and the waffles were also excellent. We ate brunch ~ 10:00 and it filled us up until late afternoon. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tpapi
Reviews.Content: Our family recently returned after a one-night stay at the Renaissance Harborplace and were very happy with the overall quality of the hotel. We secured a Priceline rate of $150 for the night which was a good value considering the rack rate of $269 at the time of our reservation. That being said, I have read reviews of those who have gotten the room as low as $85 during certain times of the year. You just have to get lucky with the bidding. First and foremost, the location is excellent with the Gallery Mall Shops connected to the property and the Inner Harbor & Pratt Street Pavillion directly across the street. You have direct access via a skywalk although there is not much in the way of handicapped accessibilty. Our room was large and clean with our bed being extremely comfortable. Housekeeping arrived and was quick to clean our coffee pot once we reported that it was dirty. As a result they comped us our parking and phone charges without us even complaining. We thought this was extremely courteous and professional. The pool area, located on the 7th floor, was well maintained and staffed. One interesting note is that we learned from the bellmen that the hotel grows all of their fruits, vegetables and spices in a gated area next to the courtyard. Like most of the hotels in the area, the hotel has a large homeless population that congregates outside on the street. We did not have any problems but should be noted in the interest of safety. This was our first time back in over 8 years and we enjoyed ourselves. While not as nice as the larger and newer Marriott Waterside, it's a better option than your other four star options, the Hyatt and the Intercontinental. We would definitely stay there again and recommend it to other leisure travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: jcrosby
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Harborplace. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Easy walking distance to the museum's and the aquarium. A ten minute walk to ESPN Zone and the Power Plant. Only about a fifteen minute walk to Little Italy. If your there to catch a game it's an easy walk to Camden Yards and the Ravens Stadium. The hotel has clean, decent rooms, a small pool and is connected to two malls. The in house restaurant "Water Tables" is excellent having great food. great views and friendly staff. The fitness room is excellent. The only negative I can find with this hotel is long elevator delays. I have read some reviews raving about the Rusty Scupper restaurant located acrss the harbor (about a twenty minute walk or a quick water taxi ride). Don't bother....overpriced and over rated! The seafood (other than the crab of course) is over rated in the entire Baltimore area. Stick to New England for quality seafood! I would stay at the Harborplace again and recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent price”
Reviews.Author: pams3150
Reviews.Content: Got a great price on Priceline--$77 per night. Most other people we talked with paid something in the area of $279. The hotel location is perfect, right in the middle of the Inner Harbor. We checked in at 10:00 am and received an inner court room with two double beds. Would have preferred a room with a view, but getting into a room that early was worth the viewless room. The inner harbor is pretty, but there is really very little to do in Baltimore if you are planning to stay more than 2 days. The shopping malls are full of empty storefronts and most of the restaurants are parts of prominent chains. The hotel was great, recently refurbished. Service was very good especially from the doormen. Only the conceirge was a somewhat disagreeable. He was surly on both ocassions I approached him with a question. The hotel has an excellent fitness room and the pool area is clean The hotel restaurant is cold and impersonal and does not quite fit in with the rest of the hotel decor.. For the price we paid, we could not have asked for more. In fact, the cab ride to the hotel was more than half the price of the room. Baltimore is a nice location if you are touring the DC area.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: Wanderers123
Reviews.Content: Family from Dublin, Ireland. We stayed in July 07 for two nights (2 adults, two kids10, 12). We arrived about 9.00p.m.. On check-in, desk staff was just about interested. We went to the hotel restaurant for dinner - very slow service. Room very comfortable - but noise on the corridor. Had to queue (with many others) for 10 minutes to be seated for breakfast next morning - when seated, again slow service. To be fair, restaurant had been recently opened but I would expect a hotel of this reputed calibre to manage. I asked concierge to book a nearby restaurant which she did while I was at desk - unfortunately when we got to restaurant - no record of booking - not a little embarrassing.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: YorktownTraveler411
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and came to Balitmore July 18-21 for a conference. The location of the hotel is absolutely perfect - allowing you easy access to the Harbor and many other venues of downtown Baltimore. The hotel itself is beautiful - but still undergoing renovations in some areas. My room was spacious and extremely comfortable - exactly what I would expect in a $200-$500/night base rate room at a Marriott. Of note is that internet access is an additional $9.95/day - just irritating in a world where I can have free access at a Holiday Inn Express. If your room is on the 12th floor, you have access (using your room key) to the Club which provides continental breakfast, beverages, hors d'oueuvres, and dessert. Rooms are quiet - there is an Anime conference in Baltimore this week and many, many loud costumed participants. My room, situated mid hall, has been virtually silent. There is a nice pool and direct access to the Gallery - 5 floors of shops adjacent to the hotel. The Harbor is directly in front of the hotel. BIG problems: I arrived late Tuesday night after working and traveling all day - was booked into room 12068. As it was late, I did not explore the room until after checking email and calling home. 15 minutes after the bellhop left, I headed for the bathroom which I found in dissaray and wet - clearly uncleaned from the last user. There was a wet towel on the bed and the mini bar had been raided as well. The bed itself was in order except for the towel. I called the "Delighted to Serve" operator who appeared to not believe me, but assured me she would send house keeping. 20 minutes later, I made a second call asking for a new room. 20 additional minutes later, I got John, the night supervisor who had my room changed immediately and provided me with a $38.00 credit for breakfast during my stay for my trouble. It was now nearly 2am. Needless to say, I did not sleep well. Crystal glasses in the bathroom were the next snafu - one of which slipped from the granite countertop into the sink and shattered. My request for cleanup was minimally met - they got the glass out of the sink, but did not check the countertop for shards so it was still hazardous when I returned from my day of conferencing. Friday brought my lunchtime visit to Windows - Watertable (Marriott's award winning restaurant). I went in anticipation of a great meal, only to find the service absolutely unacceptable: long wait for initial contact from waitstaff, disregard of request for tea without lemon (3 times), no offer of bread, etc. I asked to order from the dinner menu in order to get the famous and requisite Maryland Crabcake and was told I could at a cost of $32 for a single crabcake. Fine. I expected the extras afforded to a dinner priced entree and was presented LITERALLY with a crabcake on a white rectangular platter. I had requested salad, which came seconds before the entree - undressed. Another salad came with the crabcake - again mixed greens from the bag - nothing more - no dressing. Bread was again requested and I was informed that it had been used by the large party which arrived about 15 minutes after I did. Long story short - Crabcake and cold bread - $32.00. I did give extensive feedback to the restaurant manager and by the end of my comments (like above) I had 7 people listening to me and an offer to return for dinner - gratis (I declined). When I arrived back to my room yesterday afternoon - I had a bottle of wine and a fruit/cheese tray and an apology. This was very, very nice until I realized that there was a very small, live baby cockroach wandering on the dish of fruit and cheese under the plastic wrap. Alrighty. This morning I awoke in anticipation of my breakfast - using the credit provided 3 days ago. Of course, I had to greet room service in my PJ's because the housekeeping staff took my robe yesterday and did not replace it. My bill for 4 days is $983.06 - not including the breakfast I hope will added and then removed from my bill. Parking is $25.00/day - I did not use. Cab fare to BWI airport is about $35.00. It could have been great - but it wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel with the Best Location”
Reviews.Author: PurpleHayes
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in the middle of everything in Baltimore, this is the place. Across the street from the inner harbor, the Aquarium and the Hard Rock Cafe. Great views. Walking distance to Camden to watch the O's. Top notch staff and hospitality. And a 3 story mall adjoining, you never have to leave the building. Lots of great eating for all budgets across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: GypsyWife
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Marriott, although my friends booked through Priceline and were able to get a much better price. What sold me on this hotel, besides the Marriott name, was its location. We came down for the Antiques Roadshow and added extra days to make it our vacation. Right outside the hotel was everything we wanted to do and the Convention Center was only two blocks away. The staff from front desk to housekeeping were wonderful - polite and friendly. Our room was large and the beds comfortable. Even my picky 16 year old liked the beds. The bathroom was large, plenty of towels, and nice soap and shampoo. I usually don't bring the extras home, but this time I brought the soap and creme rinse by a company named Lather. The room was clean. We were on the 12th floor and enjoyed the benefits of the Club Lounge, but had no view to speak of from our side of the building. I loved the decor of the lobby, clean and modern. We didn't need to use the internet. One night though we were going to watch a movie, but our remote wouldn't work the menu. Just as well we probably would have fallen to sleep. Next visit though I think we'll stay closer to the Fell's Point area and yes there is a Marriott there also.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Kelton
Reviews.Content: Outstanding! This was our second time staying at the Baltimore Harbourplace Renaissance. The room was a very large king. We were allowed to check in early (11 am) and were even asked if we would prefer a high or low floor. The housekeepers clean the checked out rooms first in the morning and leave the rooms of guests that are staying for later in the afternoon (our room was made up late in the afternoon every day), but this was great for us because we didn't feel we needed to rush out. Also, that is probably why we could check in so very early (five hours early). CLEAN is very important to us, probably our single biggest concern when traveling. On this the hotel gats an A+. The room was clean with very nice white linens. The housekeeping staff actually CLEAN he rooms - we even saw carpets routinely being shampooed, not just swept. Amenities included an indoor pool, hot tub, and sauna. A nice workout area. Nice bath products, too. The lobby is nice (but the restaurant is under renovation). They provide ice cold lemon/lime water in the lobby which is great when you return from the heat and humidity that is Baltimore in the summertime. Fresh lilies make the lobby smell great. The staff was also very friendly. We were always greeted with smiles, doors opened, and a polite "hello" in the hallways. The location is perfect for families and people who want to "see" Baltimore. The hotel is directly on the water, just across from all the tourist hotspots. From here, the water taxi can take you to other neat areas, including Fort McHenry and Fells Point. I wouldn't say this is a five star star hotel only because it lacks a spa, and the restaurant and bar are under renovation. Other than that, the hotel is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service, Some Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Tim2458
Reviews.Content: I really would have liked to have given this hotel a four rating instead of three, but there were a couple of things that prevent me from doing so. First, the positives: as everyone has said, this is one of the best-located hotels in Baltimore, across the street from Inner Harbor and attached to a four-story, somewhat high-end, indoor shopping center. We were upgraded to a harborview room on a weekend with tall ships sailing in and out of the harbor. Even number rooms in the 02 to 20 range have this view -- beautiful. The staff could not be more polite or accommodating. When I stood on line a little too long to pay my bill, the concierge came over to apologize, take my bill, and correct a $90 error. The room was large, well-furnished (except for an armoire that should have been replaced because of the chips and nicks in it, even though the hotel is undergoing a total makeover), and the bathroom amenities were all top notch. The workout room is rather small and the pool is a bit of a hike from one end of the hotel to the other. I didn't mind because I walk everywhere, but someone with children or an older person staying in a harborview room would have some walk. On the real negative side, dining options are limited in the hotel. The restaurants are undergoing renovation, so breakfast is served in one of the meeting rooms -- buffet only, nothing off the menu. The buffet was standard fare and fine. Room service breakfast was very bad -- greasy eggs and home fries not befitting a hotel of this stature. Fortunately, there are many wonderful restaurants close by the hotel (recommendations at the end of this review). The one thing that really irked me was the poor excuse of a business center. Horribly maintained with broken furniture, a company contracted by the hotel provides Internt access for 49 cents a minute. I learned my lesson -- NEVER travel without my laptop and a V-card. Online services are provided in the room for about $10 a day. This is a pet peeve with the Marriott Corporation hotels. With so many smaller hotels, chains, and establishments of lesser quality offering free Internet service, why must Marriott (including Renaissance) continue to charge for access? Of course, I know the answer. Business travelers like me will pay for it. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and when the refurbishment of the hotel is complete, I'm sure issues with food will be ironed out. As for fine dining, tops on my list is Charleston at 1000 Lancaster Street in the Harbor East area -- nouvelle Southern cuisine. If you can afford to splurge, get the seven course tasting menu -- superb! Chef Cindy Wolf oversees the kitchen (we had a table looking into the kitchen, which I enjoy watching). Top service, beautiful space, and outstanding food. Other nice choices -- Roy's has a top notch branch near the Polish Martyrs memorial and the high-rise Marriott Waterfront in the Harbor East area. If you like sushi, Edo Sushi on the second floor of the Inner Harbor building you see directly across from the Renaissance is delicious and has a welcoming and efficient staff. Many other Inner Harbor eateries are substandard.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location!”
Reviews.Author: dwarrior212
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here this weekend over Saturday night. I booked it on Priceline for $85 a night. It's not as nice as the Hyatt, but it was okay. The best part is the location. It's attached to Harborside mall, which has some nice shops. Check-in was easy, we came in around 4:30 and waited less than five minutes. I asked for a high floor, and was given the 9th. The room was fairly large (I'll upload pics tonight) and the bathroom was larger than most. The nicest part about the bathroom was that you can hear the television through a speaker in the ceiling. We stayed in 9009 and had a view of the courtyard and pool. It was not what I had in mind, but did not intend to stay long. The pool is very small, but goes up to 6'. I don't know why when you can swim a lap in three strokes, but hey. We didn't use the gym so I cannot comment on that. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It's right across the street from the harbor and all the shops. It was a three minute walk to the Aquarium. For this low price, you can't beat it, but I don't think it's an accurate representation of a four star hotel. Also, beware that it's $25 to park (I hate being nickel and dimed), but you do get to stay there for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelvet1
Reviews.Content: Priceline booking for two nights (June 9-11) at $89 per night. Just what you would expect from a top hotel. The room was quite a walk from the elevators, but the room was large, clean, the bed was very comfortable, and everything worked. I guess the renovation has been completed since we didn't see any evidence of it. Every staff member we encountered was polite, friendly, and helpful. Valet parking at $30/day was a lot, but this is an urban hotel. Internet access from room is extra, but front desk clerk suggested I use free wireless in lobby unless I had a lot of work to do. Actually, the wireless worked from our room one night. Would definitely stay here again, and even with the Priceline booking were not treated any differently, which was refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, **Overall Great Hotel**”
Reviews.Author: BigDogCT
Reviews.Content: Every review has stated the great location, which was my biggest reason for choosing this hotel. Walking distance to all major attractions. Baltimore is a great "walking city". I looked at the other hotels closer to Camden Yards, the purpose of my trip to Balitmore, but I am glad that I choose correctly. The area surrounding Camden Yards is under major construction, a brand new Hilton is being built a stone's throw from the ballpark. I am so glad that I stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel, to avoid the construction mess. Other than the extreme ease of getting to the ballpark, I do not know why you would choose one of those hotels. I did walk to CY, it took 20 minutes, nice walk. The rooms were larger than normal for a "city" hotel. Nice bathroom with granite marble counter tops. Excellent toiletries, I love the lemongrass sopa. I will say that the beds were the MOST COMFORTABLE I have ever slept in!!!! WOW on comfort!!! Very clean! Turn down service...extremely friendly and accommodating staff. The hotel was still under revonation while I was there, but I did not notice. No extra noise, no problem what so ever. 2 thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 diamond standards”
Reviews.Author: JackieBlue
Reviews.Content: Our 2 night stay here was very unacceptable for a 4 diamond rated hotel. Upon our arrival, my husband had to kill several flies that were in the room. There was also no room service menu nor binoculars which were promised as part of the 'perks' of paying extra for a harborview room. Then we discovered the alternate restaurant/lounge location was simply a small room with tables, a makeshift bar and a tv blaring. And to make matters worse, the service was slow even though we were the only patrons and were just getting a drink. And if you want to drink at the makeshift lobby bar there is no restroom - we had to go to the 5th floor! On our second day we were out of the room from 8:30 to 3:30. We came back to find housekeeping had not taken care of our room. Several attempts to speak with a manager were made to no avail. Thankfully the front desk sent housekeeping up within 10 min of our call. We did encounter several members of the staff who were pleasant and helpful such as the bellmen but overall I would not be able to recommend this hotel as a good place to stay. My husband and I were extremely disappointed with our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: reed83
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about staying at this hotel after reading all of the negative reviews. I should never have worried! This was one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff was friendly and courteous. We didn't have any problems checking in and even arrived several hours early. Although there is construction in the hotel we didn't hear any noise as many of the complaints stated. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Being within walking distance of all the major attractions was great. I would definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Room and Location!”
Reviews.Author: 46oceangirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel over April School vacation with our two children ages 12 and 8. What a fantastic location. Right across the street from the waterfront shops and restaurants. We had a harbor view on the 6th floor, what a nice view! The room was big, the beds were Queens which is rather nice and comfortable. The bathroom big with plenty of towels and we had a mini bar (didn't use it but it was there). The hotel was under renovations, but we weren't affected by it at all. The pool area was nice and had a hot tub. Nice sitting area with tables for those who didn't swim along with chairs around the pool. Due to the renovations, the dinning area for breakfast was elsewhere but the food and service were fantastic and we had a harborview at breakfast. The staff went out of their way to help. Great omelets! Attached to the hotel is the Gallery shopping Mall. Nice stores. We walked across to the harbor and took a harbor cruise, went on the USS Constellation, the National Aquarium of Baltimore is there along with the Science Museum, so there is plenty to do. There is a Hard Rock Cafe, Cheesecake Factory, California Pizza Kitchen, and Irish Cafe, Thai Food, Capital City Brew Pub, great beer and pretzels, ice cream stands and many more and a huge Barnes and Nobel. If you are into baseball, Camden Yards is up the road, not too far. Loved Baltimore and would definitely stay at the Harborplace Hotel again, great location, great service even while they are under construction, the check in people were great as well as the bell staff. They do however charge you to park your car there, but still not bad, about $23 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: BethAnnP
Reviews.Content: Visited the Renaissance for 1 night in mid-April with 2 friends. We had a nice 2 queen room, plenty of space for the 3 of us for the night. The hotel is undergoing a lot of renovation, so looks a little construction-y, but should be great when its all done. This hotel is very convenient to everything in the harbor area. We were able to walk to Fells Point, Little Italy, and the Power Plant area. Cabs were also easily obtained in the overhang of the valet area. Our car was valeted & very quickly brought back to us when we turned in our ticket. Overall, it was a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “good but renovations not”
Reviews.Author: alexandria
Reviews.Content: The staff and this hotel was very accomodating, addressing us by name and catering to our every request. The room was spacious and clean, as was the very well stocked fitness and pool area. The water and granola bars were a nice touch with fresh towels galore. My only complaints about this hotel are the renovations and room distances from elevators. It makes for a mess around the pool hallways, and distance from elevator is long haul with luggage to room. The shrill sound of a jackhammer permeated the lobby so it gave me a headache and I could not hear the desk clerk giving me directions or answering my questions. Beautiful orchids all around the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: mariavhaag
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel and location. All amenities. Has a mall-The Gallery-attached to the hotel. Conveniently located at Inner Harbor. Staying at this hotel was a wonderful experience and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Even better when the refurbishment is over”
Reviews.Author: Andy99
Reviews.Content: Reception area was slightly chaotic due to the ongoing refurbishment. Staff were very helpful, room clean and spacious. Asked for a quiet room, which was a hike from the elevators, but it was worth the walk. Good quality hotel and close to the attractions. Not the best city, some dodgy areas/people to avoid, so be careful when walking inland from the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “We needed a vacation after our experience!”
Reviews.Author: galantini
Reviews.Content: Recently even though we knew that the hotel was under construction we stayed with all of our family at the Renaissance Hotel in Baltimore for my daughter wedding shower. We were told that construction was not going to be a problem during the weekend. We had booked a harbor view room and upon our arrival we were greeted by construction workers working in full swing and 900 very noisy students spread across every floors of the hotel. After complaining several times especially during the night about the loud noise, in the morning after only a few hours of sleep the manager offered us a room on the 12 concierge floor. We agreed to change and were guaranteed a quiet floor only 6 rooms had kids. Unfortunately this was not a quiet room after all, on Sunday morning the construction team started to drill on the roof directly on top of our room. At that point we had had enough and decided to leave the hotel very disappointed with our experience at the Renaissance Harbor Place. From now on we will tell all of our friends to go elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: mamasan38
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Service was good. Access to all that the Inner- Harbor has to offer. You just can't find a better hotel for the money. We loved everything about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: travelguy101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance hotel overnight recently and enjoyed my stay. I had a comfortable harborview room on the 10th floor and the view was spectacular. Here is some information to make the most of your visit: Service/Staff: Wonderful and freindly staff at the hotel. We arrived early at the hotel and they were happy to check us in. Plus, all of the other services (i.e. concierge, front desk) were also friendly and helpful. Room: The room was comfortable, clean, and spacious. The bed was nice, the easy chair was nice, and the bathrooms were also very nice. We had a great view of the harbor, shops, and the buildings. Location: The hotel is in a fabulous location, right nearby the World Trade Center, Aquarium, and the Harborplace shopping mall. I had one problem during my stay - the television. We had a hard time trying to watch a movie because the TV wasn't working and we had a repairman spend a while fixing it. We couldn't fix it so we had to watch another movie. Another problem is that it is a long walk to the elevator and it can get tiring, especially if you're carrying something. These weren't extremely bad problems but it was frustrating so I will give the review four stars. Tips: Don't leave your window open at night if you are staying in a harborview room. It can get noisy with people yelling, car horns, and sirens. Overall I would stay at the hotel again but I would try to get a room near the elevator and a room with a new TV set.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable good location”
Reviews.Author: DrLogical
Reviews.Content: This hotel is going through renovations but I still found it to be well kept and comfortable. Beds are excellent, bathrooms also great. TV could use more channels, heating system had trouble keeping up with some cold days (february). Hotel kept pretty clean as far as hotels go (they don't clean like the used to). Great location for walking to mosts points of interest (aquarium, harbor restaurants and stores, clubs etc.). Staff is very accommodating and professional.

Reviews.Title: “nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: hitherephilly
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Harborplace is a great business/conference hotel in Baltimore. I stayed here for 2 nights and 3 days for a business conference with about 580 employees attending. Great location with tons of shops inside the building. Excellent customer service. Nice, large, and spacious clean rooms with comfy beds. Great heating/air conditioning system. The only downside I found is that the hotel is currently under construction, and I could hear the noise at 7:30 am starting on the 2 weekdays I was there. I believe they're doing some construction on the roof. Public areas were fine (no dust or plastic sheeting seen, and had I not heard the noise, I wouldn't have known construction was even an issue.) Therefore, although this is a nice place, if you like to sleep late, this hotel is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: exchanged
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on the harbor and the harbor facing rooms on the higher floors have a great view. In the heart of downtown it is close to major offices. You can go for a jog on the riverfront in the morning. Cleanliness is good and the restaurant is also fairly good. Since I was on a business visit I could not explore much of the hotel. I stayed here for a month and will come back if am travellin and working in downtown Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel, great locaation”
Reviews.Author: stavos
Reviews.Content: Great location, great view from harbor rooms. Beds were way to soft and hurt my back and rooms were very plain. Restaurant was very good but expensive. Parking with Valet was very easy. The gallery is great place to shop and right inside hotel, real convenient. Would recommend hotel for convience but not luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip - Nice Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akdaley2003
Reviews.Content: I went to the Harborplace in late October through early November for a week long business trip. The hotel staff was friendly, even bumping me up to a Harborview room once I reminded the manager at the front desk that I was a Marriott Rewards Member. The room service was good, and I dare even say the grilled chicken sandwich was the BEST I've ever had. Across the street there are plenty of shopping and dinning options, plus the hotel is a short drive to local bars. The Harbor provides a nice jogging path for those looking for a place for a jog. In the end, Id say the hotel is in a nice location, and provides good service, and GREAT grilled chicken sandwiches!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Baltimore Marathon”
Reviews.Author: MAT2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Baltimore Marathon (three years in a row). Convenient walk to expo and start/finish lines. Lots of nearby restaurants and Inner Harbor attractions - everything walking distance. Rooms are large and very comfortable. I plan to return every year!

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: homeschoolinmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for our anniversary. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean. The bed is the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The location is awesome--right across the street from the inner harbor shops, aquarium and an excellent science center. (If you get a chance, to visit the science center be sure to see the DEEP SEA 3-D Imax movie, which is awesome). We were treated well by the staff, but be sure to research good restaurants before you arrive in Baltimore because the hotel staff was clueless! We stayed in a suite which was beautifully appointed with a full dining and living room and a second bathroom with T.V. and telephone.

Reviews.Title: “Great First Visit to Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: musedoc
Reviews.Content: We are here to attend a conference, and we lucked out into getting great rooms for less than $200 per night, and are across the street from the Inner Harbour. Everything is very convenient, maybe a little too touristy, but for the first visit that is ok. The Hotel amenities are first class, the parking is easy below the hotel, and my wife enjoys the shopping in the small mall attached to the hotel. Everyone has been very hospitable,the Front Desk, the Porters, Housekeeping, and any other staff. I would return here anytime. Hope the weather cooporates next visit.

Reviews.Title: “horrible service”
Reviews.Author: krcs
Reviews.Content: My husband works for Marriott and he could not believe how rude the staff was. Upon checking in, it was pure chaos. The front desk was so rude and unfriendly and no one new what was going on nor did they care. That evening we tried to order room service but upon several tries, no one ever answered. Finall y,reached the front desk, again she was put out but took the order. It arrived one hour and fifty minutes later. As for the room, the view was great. The bellman, Brooks, was awesome. We will never stay there again, too many other hotels to choose from. The front desk really needs to take a course in hospitality, otherwise quit their job. If things are not right upon check in, they only seem to get worse. The hotel manager was just walking around the lobby, as if she was in a daze. People like to feel like your happy to see them not a burden.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kareberry
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a lovely location. We were assigned a room with a courtyard view, but requested a change and they gladly gave us a partial harbor view. We stayed on the Concierge floor as we are Marriott Rewards members, and the breakfast and snacks were great. The location is great -- right across the street from the Harbor. The restaurant selection in the Harbor was wonderful! As an added bonus, the hotel is actually connected to a nice little mall, with several fast-food possibilities and a few brand name stores.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and services”
Reviews.Author: The_Silent_Music
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right at the center of everything. You just need to park your car there and that's it. Gallery Mall is inside the same building, and there is a skywalk that connects to one of the 2 Inner Harbor shopping centers. Baltimore Duck boards merely a traffic light away. You could even take the water taxi to all major sight-seeing points in Baltimore (that's what we did). In case you don't know, the 2 routes of water-taxi all go to HarborPlace (you tranfer between boats of different routes there), which is right across from the hotel. The room is spacious and the water view is simply spectacular. I would not consider the room furnishing itself the most luxurious (compare to Westin and Four Seasons) but the services are without peers. Try the crab egg omelette at the hotel's restaurant. You won't be disappointed! The lobster boil is also superb. In retrospect, there is a few hotels that offer more amenities on paper and cost less, but I can't stress enough how convenient it is, after a long day of shopping / dining / sight-seeing, a nice room with unparallel views awaits you merely a few minutes away. A few blocks of walking is a whole lot more than you think at the end of each day! TIP 1: Before booking this hotel from all those travel websites, try the property's website directly first! I regret I didn't do it. The property offers really good deals / packages periodically. For example, you could book your room at Expedia or Travelocity at $239 a night, but for $30 more, you could have book it directly from the hotel and get 4 adults tickets to National Aquarium (that's $130 folks!) or, for $10 more, 4 breakfast buffets ($64 value). TIP 2: You want a healthy exercise? Try the Dragon Paddle Boat! The rental is merely 2 minutes away from the hotel, right next to the World Trade Center. If you don't want to wait in line, or you prefer something more relaxing, try the electrical boat rental between National Aquarium and World Trade Center (an 30 seconds additional walk). It's real nice to ride the electric boat in Inner Harbor after dusk!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: travelismymiddename
Reviews.Content: Wow, I was somewhat concerned with some of the reviews on this hotel because I have pretty high standands when it comes to a hotel. My concerns where unwarranted because our stay was very nice. Check-in: A gentleman by the name of Lio checked us in upon our arrival (early about 2:00). Our room was ready and we were placed in room 11043. Room: Nice size room, very clean, bathroom clean, tub, sink, toilet, floor all were spotless (no hair). The room, bedding, and furniture were all clean and dusted. Lather bath products (love them) were in the bathroom. No dust on the tables, behind the curtain, or even behind the TV (I checked). Our room had two queen size beds,chair and ottoman, desk, nightstand, etc, the usual. It overlooked the Gallery Mall and the pavillion area. Fast elevator service. The room is a little bit of a walk to the elevator but it was not a big deal at all. My kids didn't even complain. In-door Pool: Clean with excellent lifeguard staff. The lifeguard immediately stopped children who were diving (no diving is permitted) or behaving in an unsafe manner. Well monitored pool area by the lifeguard. We didn't use the sauna but did use the whirlpool/jacuzzi and it was also clean. Yes, the pool is small, it is not an Olympic Size Pool but it is adequeate especially for children. Staff: Excellent, friendly and greeted us with a hello/smile in the hallways. Concierge was very helpful. He provided us with directions as requested to the Great Blacks in Wax Musuem (excellent by the way), and to local restaurants. He was very friendly, accomodating, and thorough. Room Service: Our meals arrived within the 25 minute guarantee with a smile each time. Set up was complete and professional. The food was good and priced fairly in my opinion. I don't expect "value priced meals" when ordering room service in a hotel. Let's be realistic. Overall: Excellent stay, great staff, with only one minor concern; it takes a looooong time to receive extra towels/washcloths after the maid staff has left for the day. If you anticipate needing extra, make your request early in the day. Well done Renaissance, we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Like camping, but without the fun”
Reviews.Author: Danimal818
Reviews.Content: On July 28, my boyfriend and I checked into the Renaissance to begin what we thought would be a nice, romantic weekend. The desk clerk told me that he did not have any non-smoking rooms with a king available, but he offered to "upgrade" me to the "Governor's Suite." He added that it had a "queen bed." We were shocked to discover that the "suite" was actually a glorified conference room! Although the conference room was the size of an apartment and the view was amazing, the “queen bed” was a rollaway twin about a foot off the floor next to the conference table. We called to the front desk, and they said they'd bring up a queen. About 45 minutes later (and only after a second call), another rollaway bed was delivered, but it was only a double. The thin mattress was very uncomfortable, the sheets were coarse, and the box spring was literally falling apart. We felt like we were one step up from camping. We tried the pullout bed in the couch. The edges of the thin mattress were curled upwards, and we could feel the metal bars through the mattress. We moved back to the rollaway bed after I cut my elbow on an exposed piece of metal in the pullout couch. We requested a room change, but the front desk said nothing would be available until the next day. Because we were going to be out most of the day, we were told we would have to check out of our room and let the front desk store our things for the day. Not only did we not want the hassle of re-packing and moving, at this point, we had very little trust in the front desk to secure our luggage. In the end, we had two nights of horrible sleep, and we both had neck and back stiffness the following day. I am shocked that a hotel like the Renaissance thought it would be acceptable to misrepresent the quality of the room (it was not a suite, it was not an upgrade, and there was NO queen bed) and then charge 300+ a night for us to sleep on a rollaway bed. Perhaps the hotel was so packed that the front desk had no other option for us, but this was unacceptable. We will never go back to the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “very exceptional hotel”
Reviews.Author: simmie17
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights 7/31 with a teenager while on business. Had a double room on the Club floor- Everyone- from check in, to valet, to bellmen and wait staff were extremely friendly and professional. Room was large, and while it had no real view- just inner courtyard, was very clean and comfortable. Housekeeping was more than adequate as was room service. Location is excellent- you are across from the heart of the Inner Harbor. The Club Louge had a nice assortment for breakfast and decent pastries late in the day. Food at hotel restaurant Windows was wonderful- this was especially appreciated after a Disasterous experience at Legal Seafood across the st- and the view is amazing. Yes, carpets in hallway are worn, but so what. This is a really nice hotel. Phillips is a fun place to eat also. However, strongly advise Legal Seafood be avoided. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “okay, could be better”
Reviews.Author: faither130
Reviews.Content: just stayed in the renaissance hotel from july 25th to july 30th. nice location ovearll rooms were spacious and clean. fyi for all the baseball fans out there, most to the teams tend to stay here. being from new york it didn't make any difference that the white sox were staying in the hotel. beds are awesome, pillow top with down comforter with a duvet that is changed daily with the bed linens. lots of pillows. issues: no fan in the bathroom, the tub is higher then normal so be careful stepping out. another thing is housekeeping is done anywhere from 930 in the am till 530 pm on the weekends. one night got back to the room at 10 pm and they still hadn't gotten to it. left a note for extra towels wasn't fufilled since the cleaning staff can not speak english. the room service trays from all the rooms sits out in the hallway alllll day no one comes along to pick it up. next, one central elevator, so if you are on the other side of this quad you have a very long walk to the elevators. the restaurant, ok we only had breakfast there. they offer a buffet which the price goes up as the weekend comes along. not that impressed, service quite slow and that is with having patience for not being a new york minute response. the bar is again pricey but ok, they tended to run out of everything at one point or another. overall nice hotel if you don't let the little things bother you. great location attached to a small mall with a food court, connecting to another small shops mall across the street in the inner harbor. the main problems of this hotel seemed to be organization and management.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing decor, luxurious bed, top service, fabulous bath products!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel! I just returned from a little weekend retreat to the Inner Harbor and loved it. The Renaissance was top-notch. We arrived very early (9:30am!) and requested an early check-in. No problem! Got us immediately into our room and we also requested a harbor view room--they only had rooms available with two queens and we wanted a king so opted for the partial harbor view instead (no extra charge). Apples and granola bars in bowls at check in for a light breakfast. Everyone was very nice and helpful in the check-in process, even though I'm sure they knew we bought the reservation on priceline.com for practically nothing. It didn't matter, they treat everyone like celebrities here. We didn't need help with our little suitcases and the butler didn't push (i hate it when they force themselves on you when you can easily roll your own little bag!). I let the lady checking us in know that we were celebrating a birthday and within minutes of entering our room the maid arrived with a birthday card and chocolate dipped strawberries from the hotel! How sweet! The room was gorgeous (and I'm picky!) a huge bed, new carpet, pretty drapes, just very tasteful! The bed was unreal. About 6" pillowtop with a featherbed, 400+ threadcount sheets, down comforter, tons of pillows of various types to choose from. Of course there was an in-room coffeemaker (standard) but you know how aweful that stuff usually is. Not here! Organic, Fair Trade coffee and it was so delicious that I brewed two pots while I stayed there! YUM! The bath products are made by Lather, an up-scale brand with light but delicious scents made with nice ingredients (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, two soaps, plus sealed Qtips and cottonballs). I asked for extra bath stuff to take home with me! We stayed on a Friday night and be warned that if you have a harbor view it will be noisy. This hotel is literally on top of the action (there is a 4-story mall under the hotel) and there are bands playing outside and lots of people enjoying themselves all around. There are also quite a few ambulences that add to the noise. I wasn't bothered by it because we only had a partial view room but I can see how some people might be annoyed. Do not get a courtyard view room, it's pretty blah--no grass or flowers, just brick and an indoor pool to look at. If you eat at Phillips order the Chessapeake Crabcakes. We ordered breakfast room service and it arrived 10 minutes late, so it was free (it's their policy!). I'd highly recommend the Eggs Benedict. Wonderful spread including the heating tray to keep things warm if you aren't going to eat right away. They allowed us to have a late checkout at 1pm and also stored our luggage until our flight at 5pm. The butler offered us delicious lemonade as we left! I can't wait to go back, this hotel is in the best location out of all the hotels. The service was excellent. You won't regret staying here! Bought the night on priceline for $102. Best hotel deal i've gotten in a long time. Have fun:)

Reviews.Title: “Adequate lodging, horrible service with an Attitude”
Reviews.Author: An0nym0us
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance while attending a meeting at the Convention Center. There were a number of problems with the service we received. On attempting to check in at 2 pm (stated check in time is 4pm), I was told the room was not ready. The reservation was in my companion’s name and I arrived with a signed letter from her and a copy of the front/back of her AmEx used to make the res. They requested phone authorization from her but refused to use my cellphone when I had her on the line and offered it to the clerk, instead insisting that I hang up so that the clerk could dial herself. When that was settled, I asked about putting my Marriott Rewards number on the room and was told I couldn’t do that. Then I was told (not asked if I wanted) to leave my carryon with the bellman. Excuuuse me! When my companion arrived later that evening, four clerks were standing around behind the desk, she was the only guest waiting, and nobody offered to help her. After 10 minutes, she requested and got assistance. The room was a good quarter mile from the elevator, as noted by a previous review, and had a distinct though stale odor of smoke (non-smoking room). On the positive side, the room was spacious with a comfortable bed, nothing fancy but the a/c worked well, there was always hot water, and there even was a window that opened, a rarity nowadays. The room service meals arrived promptly as ordered, and the restaurant brunch was excellent and smoke-free. The concierge (Marie) was gracious and helpful with restaurant recommendation. We had prearranged a late checkout at booking, but when we called on the morning of departure were told that it wasn’t available unless we paid for it, and then when we offered to pay were told that in fact it wasn’t available at all. After a lengthy discussion with the supervisor, who was very rude and insulting, she finally conceded to allow us to stay til 2p, not 4p as requested. As a result we ended up in the TV lounge, where I was watching sports while my companion took a brief nap until rudely awakened by hotel security (because sleeping was not allowed). We weren’t from off the sidewalk, we had just dropped $860 at the hotel for a 3-day stay and this just was the last straw. Needless to stay, on our next visit to the Inner Harbor we will select another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average everything else”
Reviews.Author: noworry
Reviews.Content: The location can't be better if you are there for the average "touristy" vacation. Many previous posters complained about the noise. The noise level is totally reasonable for a hotel on a main street and in between 2 busy hospitals. Noone in our group found it offensive. The rooms were clean and very comfy beds. There is valet parking for $30 per day, self park (under the hotel) is $21 if you just do it and don't tell the front desk or is $23 for them to put it on your bill. The one consistent disappointment was the concierge. We spoke to 3 different ones. All of them were uninterested and knew no more than any brochure available next to their stand. The front desk staff was either very helpful or very new (as identified on their name tags) and not of much help. Two "newbies" did our check in, was uncomfortable when one of them called the other "retarded" more than once. Is pricey but the location made up for some of that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: YukonRoadKing
Reviews.Content: The best part of this hotel is its location, right across from Harborplace and the harbor. If you're really lucky you'll get a room with a view of the harbor, but only a small proportion of the hotel's rooms face that way, and many, including mine, faced the inner courtyard. No view at all. What's really ridiculous is the very long walk from most of the rooms to the elevators, all at one end of a large hotel that's built in a square with a central courtyard. The hotel actually starts on the fifth floor where the ballrooms and restaurant are, and goes up to the 12th floor. Its part of an office/shopping complex. The fifth floor bar is full of smoke, which is hard to adjust to if you've been living in a city where this is a capital offense. The parking is very expensive. The room was nice, roomy, with a very good bed, nice bathroom. Mine was clean. Concerierges were helpful, staff friendly. So all in all, it was fine, but not great. Watch out for Baltimore cab ripoffs. There is a flat fare to and from the airport, but don't expect the driver to tell you before he puts on the meter. And no two meters are alike. I took the same route in different cabs, different fares. I ask why--- they say the other driver is a crook, etc. The good news: Charleston restaurant in Fells Point, perhaps one of the top ten restaurants on the eastern seaboard. It's that good. Worth a trip by itself. Also , a 15 -20 minute walk to Federal Hill District brings you to Cross Street Market, where I could sit all day at the seafood counter drinking beer and eating steamed crabs and crabcakes. and oysters. And catch a ballgame if you can at Camden Yards. A reasonable and safe walk from the harbor hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: mdgorick
