Reviews.Content: Recently, we stayed at Harborplace and absolutely loved it. Our room was spacious and facing the harbor so we had a beautiful view. The location was very good and we walked everywhere. The best part is that the Hotel was connected to two malls which had many places to eat, drink and shop. ( Tir Na Nog, The Cheesecake Factory and etc...) We also took advantage of the Bar at the top of the hotel, which also faces the harbor and gives a breath taking view at night. The only problem we had was the thick smoke, because there was no non-smoking section there. Otherwise, the prices were reasonable and the dessert selection was delicious! The service was also vey good. Overall, we enjoyed our stay....but our best piece of advice is to prepare to spend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: purplejenn11
Reviews.Content: I also checked in on April 14, as a previous poster did. I actually was in line behind her and heard her yelling about not getting the two double beds and the non-smoking room. I felt bad for her, but my experience was the exact opposite. Check in was smooth and we got exactly what we had requested. We were also granted access to the Club Room, just by asking (my husband is a silver points member and the acess is usually only for gold and above). So, with that, we enjoyed desserts in the evening and breakfast in the morning. I didn't visit the pool, but it looked pretty small and crowded from what I could see. We had a great view, and found the room to be very comfortable. The bed was good, and the bathroom was well stocked and worked fine. We got great service and directions from the conceirge and also no problems with the bell hop and valet parking. I loved that the hotel had direct access to a nice mall, and could go shopping easily. In addition, there were many places to eat within walking distance. We also walked to Fells Point for the nightlife. It is about a one mile walk, but very easy and along the waterfront. In all, an excellent stay for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Dough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arriving at 9:30 pm with our small children, we were looking forward to relaxing a bit in the "extravagant" Club Room which we had sprung for. Unfortunately, front desk personnel forgot to mention that the Club Room closed at 10:00. So after a lengthy check-in, parking, getting our bags brought up and walking a country mile from the elevator to our room, we missed out on the reason we paid extra in the first place. Although we had requested otherwise, we were in a smoking room which must have hosted a bachelor party the previous night. A case of Febreeze would have only put a dent in the odor. Breakfast in the not-so-extravagant Club Room was every man for himself. There were a few stale danishes, chopped watermelon, a couple of boxes of cereal, water and some good coffee. (Did you notice that bowls, spoons and plates were not mentioned? Our children had fun using straws as chopsticks to eat watermelon out of paper cups.) Again, not worth the money. The location was good but we paid dearly for parking. The pool was fine but a bit a chilly- basically the highlight of our stay at this establishment. We definitely will look elsewhere for our next stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice although short stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: OHTrip
Reviews.Content: Last week my husband daughter and I stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel overnight. We were in town for a college visit. The hotel was beautiful and we had an outstanding harbor view. We got a government rate since my husband is a federal employee and I could not believe how nice the room was for the price. After a 6 1/2 hour drive the comfortable queen sized beds were appreciated. The harbor area was a bit touristy with many overpriced shops. But we enjoyed dinner along the harbor at night. We had a brief yet enjoyable stay at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Staff and Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: YoHo
Reviews.Content: After being treated like persona non grata at another Inner Harbor hotel, we checked into the Renaissance after 9 PM, tired and stressed out. The desk clerk was sweet and friendly. Later in the visit, the bell desk went out of their way to get directions to an attraction about an hour outside Baltimore. After checking out, I mentioned to one of the knot of managers in the lobby that I really appreciated the help of two of the staffers, the manager came out with a gift bag with a teddy bear for my daughter! So nice and thoughtful. It seems they truly care about their hotel guests. The one huge disappointment was the pool and hot tub. Yuk! The pool is small and the water was cloudy. My daughter who is crazy for swimming refused to go back- she said the water had a unpleasant taste. The hot tub looked like a soup pot- discolored water and scads of foam. Totally gross and out of character for a hotel that would appear to pride itself on superior service.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on April 9th and 10th and really liked it. We originally had reservations for the Hyatt, but I read online in a review that it was undergoing renovations and could be noisy. I called the Hyatt and confirmed that they were in fact still renovating so we switched to the Renaissance. And I'm glad we did. The Renaissance is in a much better location. It has a walkay to restaurants and the Harbor. It's nice and everyone is friendly. The Harbor itself wasn't what we expected though (this was our first trip). It's much smaller than we imagined and much more crowded (in terms of buildings) so it's not very picturesque. We have two kids so we did the aquarium which is cute (Definitely buy your tickets ahead of time online. We were so glad we did. Otherwise you have to wait in a long line for tickets only to be told what time to come back to be admitted. But because we had tickets in advance, we were able to walk right in). We also did the Maryland Science Center which we didn't care for. Not much to do or see. The Imax movie was good though (which is part of the Science Center), so it may be worth buying tickets just for that. We've always wanted to check out the aquarium and the Harbor so we're glad we did, but we're also glad that we didn't plan on spending more than just two days. It's a great little overnight trip, but not worth more than that in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Room”
Reviews.Author: bellskee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 9 & 10. Super fast check-in and out. Great rate $160. Large room, comfy bead, extremely clean.Best location. Hotel food was good, this is not usual. Good thing - instant hot or cold water on 9th floor. I don't even get that at home. The only thing I can complain about was the Concierge. Very limited restaurant choices from him, not a real pleasant guy. Luckily I did my research on Trip Advisor and found a great place to eat - Momma's on the 1/2 Shell - SUPER.$10 cab ride. I'd stay here again in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: oneLten
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night in December 2005 for quick getaway. The biggest assest of this hotel is its location. You can walk to any of the important sights of the Inner Harbor; this incudes several restaraunts and bars located across the street in an enclosed mall. I don't remember any big noise issues from within the hotel itself. As other reviews have stated, it is on a busy commecial traffic route so it is not uncommon to hear sirens or truck traffic. I'm a light sleeper, but I've grown up with that noise and it didn't bother me. The front desk staff was competent but not as friendly as desk staff I've encountered at other hotels. The parking for this hotel is located within an underground garage immediately adjacent to the hotel that is managed by an outside company. The hotel charges $23 per day to park there which seems excessive, despite the prime location. This hotel is ideal for couples or families on a 2 or 3 day trip to Inner Harbor that want to be close to all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: alimoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with my husband and two boys. Top of the line service from the minute we pulled up to the door. Excellent service, very friendly staff. Ordered room service and it came very fast with excellent server. Check-in was quick, they even gave my son a present. Great breakfast in the Windows restaurant. All around top of the line experience. We had the aquarium package, great deal for families. Can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a weekend stay at the hotel. We found everything to be great. We had a harbor view room on the 10th floor what a view. The staff could not have been any nicer. Our room was decorated nicely, and the beds very comfortable. We have three children that loved the pool, and the attractions around. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Sleepless night”
Reviews.Author: 62 Model
Reviews.Content: This property is in a great location and you can walk to all of the sights. But....if you plan on NOT SLEEPING then I would recommend this hotel. My husband and I stayed here for one night and the best news is that his company paid to have us stay in order to attend their gala awards event. We arrived in enough time to grab a nap, we should have known the night would be sleepless since we could hardly nap for all of the noise from the hallway. After returning from our evening event we did go to WINDOWS to have a night cap. We retired to our room about 1am. The doors to the guest rooms are very old style and heavy. When a guest would depart from their room they would walk out and the door would SLAM and I mean it would slam so hard that our door would rattle. Then as other guests would walk down the hall you could hear every word. Not to mention that the room next to us had guests that spoke very loudly in their room at 1:30am. At one point I had to bang on the wall. I will NEVER book this property nor recommend it to my clients (yes I am a Travel Consultant) For a downtown Baltimore Harbor Hotel their prices reflect this location. If I had booked client's here to experience a sleepless night for the price they get at this property, I would be sure they would never use me again. So if you want to stay here, please bring ear plugs.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again! Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: weenose
Reviews.Content: Went to Baltimore for a conference and brought my mum and sister with me. Really enjoyed staying in this hotel- it was lovely! Room was very spacious and comfortable- remember to ask for a harbour view, I did and it was well worth it- fantastic. I think this made all the difference to our stay, it wouldnt be the same if we had been looking over the parking lot. Hotel is right on the inner harbor, close to aquarium, world trade centre and other tourist attractions. we had room service one evening, clam chowder, pizza and cold beer - yummy! We would definetly recommend this hotel for a pleasant stay in Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Harborplace Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed there for a Thursday and Friday night, and I have to say, our stay was just wonderful! We were not dissappointed one bit and it was definately worth the money we spent there. If we happen to go to Baltimore again, we will definately stay there! On a side note, I work in the hotel industry myself and I have to say this place is pretty well run. I'm curious as to why there are so many negative reviews of this place. I think a sad part of the status of our society is that we demand perfection, when in fact we are dealing with places that are run by people that are just like us. I think people would be happier in general if they do not demand perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Bare Bones Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: wadaole
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at the Renaissance, with some pros and cons that I found. Pros: Excellent location- several restaurants and bars (ESPN Zone, Hard Rock, Powerplant Live, and several other chain restaurants) just steps away. The hotel is also connected to a small (but adequate)mall. Windows restaurant (inside the hotel) served a very nice breakfast. The service at the hotel was good as well. Cons: The room. While I had no major complaints with the room, it was really not a 'Renaissance room'. Maybe the best way to put it is, it lacked character. Although the size was adequate (maybe 375- 400SF), it could have been a Holiday Inn or a Four Points. The bathroom was clean, and there were no complaints there either. If you are accustomed to staying at the typical large city Renaissance Hotel, you may be disappointed. While I don't think that the room is worth $175.00, it is probably the best bet in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: WERTTraveler
Reviews.Content: I keep wondering what the Renaissance brand really means. In this case, it means a pretty average hotel with some real oddities. In the case, for example, of the Renaissance Mayflower in Washington, D.C., it means something close to perfection. Our room was okay, if non-descript, with a ninth floor view of a parking lot. We searched high and low for electrical outlets and the room itself was dark. On the other hand, the room was very quiet, the bed was wonderful, and we slept like babies. The bar area is thick with smoke and the service is rather eccentric. It had an air of slowly unraveling chaos, but has a great view of the Inner Harbor. The restaurant which we used for breakfast was very nice with wonderful views, even if the staff experienced bouts of amnesia when we ordered exotic items like hot tea. All in all, for a much more impressive Baltimore Marriott, and we do like this chain, try the Marriott Baltimore Inner Harbor. Now that should be a Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: Lorimisty
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days, 2 nights at this hotel with husband and 2 kids, 11 & 13 for a weekend getaway. The location of this hotel is great! We never took our car out of parking garage. It is close to aquarium and right across the street from inner harbor shops and restaurants. It is also connected to the Gallery mall. The rooms are nice, great beds, and housekeeping staff was accommodating. The front desk people were a little snobby when I asked for a harbor view. I guess my jeans and tshirt didn't warrant their consideration especially when the request was granted for the suit next to me. There was a large conference being held in the hotel as well. Then came the room service. First night it took 45 minutes(guarantee 25 minutes or less)for kids pasta with tomatoe sauce and then came with NO sauce. Apologized and didn't charge. Brought up a hot dog instead. Next night ordered pizza and PBJ. Pizza was cold and PBJ was grilled!!! I called room service and they said that was the only way they made it. C'mon now. I didn't push it since I had complained previous night. Breakfast in restaurant was okay...not the highly acclaimed food it should have been. The next day walked a block and got great bagels, hot coffee, no tude. So, for this being a Marriott property, I'd say it was okay. Would chose a different place next time.

Reviews.Title: “And Saturday makes two”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel, it is walking distance from everything and the service is excellent. My mom and I stayed there for the Afram and it was well above our expectations. The temperature was set at a perfect 72 degrees, and the bed was super comfortable, we paid the extra $20 to have breakfast included, and it was well worth it, they have everything from cereal to steak. My mom said the only thing missing was some good old fashioned grits and our waiter had some made just for her. I booked a second stay this weekend for my husband and I last week, when I looked on their website today I noticed that the rooms were $40 cheaper, I called the Marriot and they gave me the reduced rate with no problem. With experiences like this, the Marriot is definately my hotel of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Harborplace is in a perfect location for touring Baltimore’s Inner Harbor. Everything you’ve read about and plan to visit is within a few minutes walk, except for Fort McHenry. The staff was courteous, though our check in took quite a while as there was a line. We arrived early, and as expected our 2-queen, city-view, Concierge Level room was not ready. So we left our luggage and went strolling around the Harbor for a few hours. When we returned, I think they had given our room away, but compensated us with a Harbor view on another floor, and gave our keys Concierge privileges. It was an acceptable trade, as the room we got was clean and neat, with nice linens and toiletries, and was even quiet despite being on the same floor as several banquet rooms. The view overlooking the Harbor was lovely and very enjoyable. Breakfast in the Lounge was generous and tasty, though a bit hectic, as many guests had arrived at the same time and had to wait for a table. The friendly staff more than made up for it, though. My only tip is to skip the skywalk unless you're looking for a tour of the adjoining mall on the way to your room!

Reviews.Title: “Good and the not-so-good...”
Reviews.Author: mccarthys5
Reviews.Content: I use to stay at this hotel 8-10 years ago for business in Baltimore and had recollections of it being a solid 4-star property in the Inner Harbor district. That being said, I just stayed for a 2-night getaway with a group of girlfriends and really do think it is more of a 3.5-3 star property now. The location is excellent. Check-in went smoothly enough, we requested a rollaway bed without issue and it was delivered within the hour. We also requested more towels and these were promptly delivered as well. We paid a rate of $219/night, including breakfast for 2 people either via room service or their signature restaurant, Windows. The first morning we opted for room service - called at 8:30 am for breakfast for the four of us. The way they work things is that they give you a $33 credit towards breakfast and you pay anything over and above that amount. That was fine. They said our order would be delivered in 25 minutes or less. Well, 45 minutes came and went and finally we called and they said it would be another couple of minutes, but because of the length of our wait, the apologized and said the entire breakfast was complimentary. That sounded great to us, but in reality it took another 30 minutes at least before our food was delivered. It was lukewarm and they forgot our orders of toast, but at that point, we were so hungry, we didn't have the energy to complain! The second day we opted breakfast in the Windows restaurant. It is a nice restaurant with a great view of the Inner Harbor and the food was great. When the bill came, they didn't take the difference off for the credit that we got in our room rate and when I questioned them, they said they would do it and it would be correct on our bill when we went to check out. Needless to say, when we checked out, the full amount for breakfast was still on our bill and the assistant manager had to make a couple of phone calls to get it all straightened out. He did, but it was still a tad bit inconvenient. The hotel is also attached to the Harborplace Mall, which was great because we are shoppers and enjoyed having the mall in close proximity to the hotel. It was raining terribly while we were in the Inner Harbor district, so it was nice to not have to go outside and get wet. The pool area also looks tired. I used the pool and the hot tub and while they were both clean, they are in need of a renovation. The lockers in the women's room are all rusted. Valet parking is $28/night, befitting of its central location. I'd stay here again due to location and the rooms are pretty nice and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly enjoyed our visit at the Renaissance Harborplace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katiemetz
Reviews.Content: My husband received a gift certificate for a free night's stay and breakfast at any Marriott property, so I cannot comment directly on the price/value of the room. That being said, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel. At the time of booking, I was told that there were no harborview rooms available, so we were very pleased when we were given a harborview at the time of check-in! The room was pleasant and spacious, and the bed was quite comfortable. There was a fair bit of street noise (even on the 8th floor) in large part due to emergency vehicle sirens that we heard several times. All of the staff was quite friendly and helpful; however, we did not receive the wake-up call that was requested. Parking was expensive at $21/day; however, this price is to be expected given the location of the hotel right on the harbor. Breakfast at the Windows Restaurant was very good-- one of the best hotel breakfasts I have had in quite some time. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance has set the bar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I planned a meeting for 125 ppl at the Renaissance Baltimore in April 2005 and I couldn't have been more pleased. From my very first call to the hotel through every last detail everything was perfect. The sleeping rooms were clean and comfortable, the view was breathtaking. Directly across from the inner harbour. This was my first time to Baltimore and it was such an exceptionally postive experience I would go back again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A dog for the price”
Reviews.Author: antim007
Reviews.Content: I thought the hotel room was spacious, with a comfortable bed. However the view was a toilet. Our room over looked a run down, weed infeasted sloppy courtyard. Considering that half the rooms in the entire hotel view the court yard Marriot should be ashamed. It could be nice because the courtyard sits on top of the a glass enclosed mall. It was very expensive when you add on the tax and the parking charge. It was us almost 1200 for a 3 day stay (not counting food). There food was terrible and the service was poor. On the positive side the location is excellent and there are many good resturaunts within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Best Around the Harbor!”
Reviews.Author: balophil
Reviews.Content: Had such a wonderful experience at this hotel over Memorial Day weekend that I will go back this September. Lobby is beautiful, guest services warm and prompt, restaurant is extraordinary and has magnificent harbor view. Gift shop is well stocked, Starbucks opens by 6:30 or earlier. The pool is like a resort pool with an outdoor plaza and beach chairs for sunning in the warmer seasons, and has really long hours, 6 to at least 10 or 10:30. Though I travel alone, it seems to work well for those with children too. Concierge was especially helpful to me, Many welcoming public seating areas throughout the two main lobbies and in other parts of the hotel, a rarity these days. All in all, a gorgeous, comfortable and friendly place. Harbor is right across the street. Plus a real value for the price. Have paid more at other hotels and not received nearly as much across the board.

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance - Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ntaylor2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance Harborplace 8-11 to 8-14. Family of four. Very expensive but well worth the price. Staff was outstanding. Rooms were large and beds were just like home. Slept well. I have stayed in several hotels around the country but will have to say this was the best. Location, location, location. Convenient to everything. Highlights for kids were the aquarium, Maryland Science Center and game at Camden Yards. Restaurant - try Sabatinos in Little Italy, not your usual Italian restaurant. Family owned and operated, real Italian food. Felt safe everywhere in the Inner Harbor, Little Italy and Camden Yards areas. Hotel valets hailed cabs for us if needed. Will definitely return to Baltimore and this hotel. ntaylor

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Harborplace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 202 E Pratt St, Baltimore, MD 21202
